loans.name: Arlen

texts.en:
Arlen runs a sari-sari (variety) business to earn a living. She has run her store for more than a year now. 

Arlen is requesting a loan to buy additional stocks of soda, snack food, dry goods, seasoning, and other products to sell. She will use her loan to cater to more buyers and improve her income. Arlen also wants to save money to help her husband to send their children to school for better learning.

loans.use: to buy soda, snack food, dry goods, seasoning, and other products to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 41 years old and married to Mary. The couple has six children. For the past two  years, Joseph has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town. He plants maize and beans to sell and his business has been profitable.

Joseph is requesting his first loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops. He also plans to pay his laborers. Joseph anticipates making a profit with his loan that he plans to use to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his farm and buy more land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops and to pay laborers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and the mother of five children, three of whom are attending school. She lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya.  For the past year, Florence has been operating a grocery stall where she sells greens, fruits, vegetables, and other products. Her family also earns some income from a boutique and retail shop. Florence learned about Milango through a friend and she joined to access credit to improve her business operations. Florence's business challenge is the occasional low demand for her stock.

Florence is requesting a 31,450 KES loan to buy wholesale vegetables, greens, fruits, and clothing to sell. The extra income from her loan will be added to her savings to expand the business and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy wholesale vegetables, greens, fruits, and clothing

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 32 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. For the past 10 years, she has been manufacturing "waan," which is a material used in making charpoy (a bedstead of woven webbing or hemp stretched on a wooden frame on four legs, common in Pakistan). She offers various kinds of waan in different colors, and she is famous in providing a good quality product in her community. In this way she is able to manage the needs of her family members. 

Sakina is requesting her fifth loan from Kashf Foundation for 10,000 PKR, which she will use to buy another waan making machine so she can continue to provide good quality products to her customers. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. Sakina expects gains in her earnings and will be better able to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase another waan making machine.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a merchant from Bien Unido, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of six grown-up children.

She has run a sari-sari (or variety) store business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of her income.

Beatriz is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and seasonings, toiletries and soap. 

In the future, Beatriz has hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store such as canned goods, noodles, cooking oil and seasonings, toiletries and soap.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Ms. Shahida is a 36-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of stitching clothes since 15 years ago. She stitches clothes for people who live around her home and uses the income to support her household expenses. She is very popular in her community due to her neat and fine work. Her husband is a laborer and not able to meet household expenses with his low salary. She makes enough to contribute to the family income.

Shahida has four children, and all of them are school-going. She dreams of providing a good education to her children. 

To cope with the increasing demand, she requested a loan of 25,000 Rs. (Pakistan rupees) to purchase more material such as reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and ribbons in various colors. 

She is in her second loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She intends to use the earned profits on the expansion of her business and on providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more material such as reels of threads with packs of buttons, zippers and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en:
Dioscora is a 60-year-old married woman with five adult children from Trinidad, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari (or variety store) business and has been in the business for more than 10 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Dioscora is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like soda, dry goods, and ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar and cooking oil. 

In the future, Dioscora dreams of making her business a success and saving money for future use.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soda, dry goods and ingredients for food vending like flour, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Mohannad

texts.en:
Mohannad is from Iraq. He is a youth client aged 27 years and is single. Mohannad lives with five family members, of whom four are employed.

Mohannad owns a big generator, and he provides his neighborhood with electricity. He established his business in 2010, and now he has an employee. He has built good experience in this field, and he is well-known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a sum of $3,000 for a youth loan to build a new room for his generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to build a new room for his generator.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada earns a living through her variety store. She sells various goods to the people at her place in Bien Unido, Bohol. 

Diosdada is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like rice, soda, chips and snack food, toiletries and other items. Through this, she will be able to attract and cater to more buyers in her store.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like rice, soda, chips and snack food, toiletries and other items.

loans.name: Djatougbé

texts.fr: Revendeuse de profession, Kayi vend des fournitures scolaires et des produits d’alimentations générales à domicile et au marché. Elle est dans ce domaine il y a 20ans. Avec son quatrième crédit qu’elle sollicite auprès de WAGES, elle va acheter des produits d’alimentation générale et des fournitures scolaires. Il est à préciser qu’elle est mariée à un conducteur de grue et a 03 enfants tous à l’école. Comme perspectives d’avenir, elle veut assurer les besoins primaires de la famille.
texts.en: Reseller by profession, Kayi sells school supplies and general foodstuffs from home and at the market. She has been working in this domain for 20 years. With her fourth loan that she is requesting from WAGES, she is going to buy general foodstuffs and school supplies. It should be specified that she is married to a crane operator and has 3 children who are all in school. For future prospects, she wants to ensure the primary needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs and school supplies.

loans.name: Woégan

texts.fr: Mariée à un retraité  et mère de 03 enfants, woégan est revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle pratique son activité dans une boutique et est aidée toutefois par un employé. Son fonds de commerce ne lui permettant pas de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, elle sollicite son second crédit auprès de WAGES pour renforcer son stock de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut ainsi réaliser son rêve, agrandir son activité et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille en tant qu’une bonne épouse.
texts.en: Married to a retiree and mother to 3 children, Woégan is a reseller of general foodstuffs. She practices her business in a shop and is always helped by an employee. Since her business is not allowing her to meet the needs of her customers, she is requesting her second loan from WAGES to strengthen her stock of general foodstuffs. In this way she wants to realize her dream of expanding her business and ensuring the self-fulfillment of her family as a good wife.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Julia es una madre de familia multifacética que continúa dedicándose a la comercialización de autopartes y accesorios en general para automóviles, negocio que lleva junto a su esposo, pero además de esto aprovecha su tiempo para vender ropa en una pequeña tienda y a solicitud de sus clientes  de forma directa. Julia en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar mercadería como polos, casacas, pantalones, camisas etc. para capitalizar su actividad para la próxima campaña navideña. Julia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas, las cuales representa un nuevo ingreso económico y la posibilidad de ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Julia is a member of the "Qorichuspas" communal bank of the town of Cusco, Peru. Julia is a versatile mother who still sells spare parts and general accessories for cars, a business she owns alongside her husband. However, aside from that she spends her time selling clothing in a small store and also by direct order from her customers. Julia is currently requesting a loan in order to purchase merchandise such as polo shirts, jackets, trousers, shirts, etc. so that she can stock up her business for the upcoming Christmas sales season. Julia is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to make progress as a person and in her business. Her business means that she has another source of income and the opportunity to provide her children with education and better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase polo shirts, jackets, trousers, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos Alberto vive en la cuidad de Managua, Nicaragua trabaja  agente de seguridad desde hace 13 años.
Casado con tres hijos a su cargo uno en edad escolar.
 
El señor Carlos  esta solicitando un crédito para la  compra de materiales de construcción como bloque, cemento, arena, hierro, para la elaboración de un cuarto  ya que lo considera necesario para la comodidad de su familia.

Carlos es el segundo crédito que esta solicitando y manifieste que con el primer crédito que le otorgaron ayudo a mejorar las condiciones  de su familia.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto lives in the town of Managua, Nicaragua. He has been working as a security officer for the past 13 years.
He's married and has three children under his care, one of whom is of school age.
Carlos is requesting a loan in order to purchase construction supplies such as bricks, cement, sand and iron. He'll use them to build a room, because he considers it necessary for his family's comfort.
This is Carlos' second loan, and he expresses that the first loan he obtained helped him to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement, sand and iron).

loans.name: José Ángel

texts.es:
El señor José ángel vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja en la capital como perforador de pozo de agua potable. Soltero con tres hijos a su cargo  en edad escolar.

Esta solicitando un préstamo para  la compra de materiales de construcción  y así empezar la construcción de un cuarto  para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Ángel lives in the town of Managua. He works in the city as a safe water borehole driller. He's single and has three school-age children under his care.
He's requesting a loan in order to purchase construction supplies and thus start building a room so he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 30-year-old business man.  He is single, but supports his parents. He has been a hawker (seller) for the past two years with the monthly income of 10,000 KES which he uses to pay for his basic needs. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by an existing KADET LTD customer.Samuel will use the loan to purchase more stock of watches, belts, and albums.  

With the anticipated profit he will plough back in the business . His hope is to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of watches, belts, and albums

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has 3 children ranging from 3 to 15 years old. She describes herself as a jovial and determined woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, maize flour etc. Her business is located at a conducive business environment and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use her KES 33,000 loan to buy a water tank that will be used by her family members and livestock. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of KES 20,000 previously, which she managed to pay successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy, de 59 años de edad, es una mujer alegre y con deseos de superación, así como también es amable y cordial, esta divorciada, vive en compañía de su hija de 24 años de edad. Viven instalados cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Lucy es la costura, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, para luego comprar una maquina de coser con sus ahorros, la cual instaló en su propia casa, desde donde atiende a sus clientes quienes la buscan por sus buenos acabados, logrando ganar  su aceptación y así una regular clientela a lo largo de estos 10 años que lleva en ese negocio, realizándolo ella sola.
Le gusta su negocio ya que le gusta la costura, además de las buenas ganancias que le deja, que le valió para apoyar a su hija en  los gastos de su educación de, quien  es su mayor motivación para progresar. Por lo contrario comenta le incomoda un poco el cansancio físico por estar sentada en una misma postura que le ocasiona dolores de espalda, pero eso no la desanima, continua trabajando y esforzándose. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, comprar maquinas de coser y dar trabajo a otras personas. Este será el préstamo número 14 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con la ayuda financiera que viene recibiendo y desea continuar con este apoyo, por tanto se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal ya que conoce a la mayoría y los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000  nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de  01 maquina de coser valorizada en 900 nuevos soles y con el saldo tiene planeado comprar materiales de costura como telas, hilos, y demás.
texts.en:
Lucy is 59 years old and is a happy woman with many desires to succeed.  She is also friendly and cordial.  She’s divorced and lives with her 24 year old daughter.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Lucy sews and learned this art at a trade school and later bought a swing machine with her savings and set it up in her home, where she sees clients who seek her out.  She was able to win the acceptance of regular customers over the 10 years she has been in business.  She built it herself.

She likes her business and likes sewing.  It also provides her a good income that helped her support her daughter’s educational expenses.  She says that she is a little uncomfortable with having to sit in the same position, which causes her back pain, but this does not deter her and she will continue to work.  She plans to expand her business, buy sewing machines, and provide employment to other people.  This will be her 14th loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial assistance she has been getting and wants to continue.  As before, she is committed to making her payments on time as with the previous loans.  She also says that she is comfortable with the communal bank because she knows that the members are good people.

She will use the 2,000 PEN from this loan to invest in a 900 PEN sewing machine and supplies such as fabric, thread, and other things.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and supplies.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, tiene 47 años de edad es una mujer alegre, entusiasta  y emprendedora, conviviente con Sinecio quien es conductor de maquinaria pesada,  vive con su pareja, y su hijo que tiene 19 años de edad.  Vive en su casa propia la cual compro con el apoyo de su pareja. El trabajo que realiza Zoila, es la crianza de pollos, ésta crianza lo realiza en su propio terreno, donde tiene instalado un galpón con una capacidad de hasta 100 pollos, ésta actividad viene realizando desde hace  05 años consecutivos, tiempo en el cual le valió para hacerse conocida  por los vecinos y compradores  mayoristas que le compran los pollos, ésta actividad lo realiza con el apoyo de sus hijo para la crianza, limpieza y venta. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que es rentable, le da un buen ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus gastos, y le permite estar en todo momento con sus hijos. Lo que no le gusta es que los alimentos del pollo varían el en precio, lo cual hacen variar sus márgenes de ganancia, pero  esto no la desanima a seguir trabajando. Nos comenta que tiene planes de criar mayor cantidad de pollos por que así obtendrá mayor ingreso económico. Por tanto éste será su 12 préstamo con la institución MFP, le gusta mucho su grupo porque siente que son responsables, espera poder seguir bien y seguir trabajando con la institución a quien agradece mucho por la oportunidad brindada.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 3000 nuevos  soles comprará hojas de bijao que se utilizan para  cambiar y ampliar su galpón, y así criar pollos en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Zoila is 47 years old and is a very happy, enthusiastic, and enterprising woman who lives with Sinecio, who operates heavy machinery.  She lives with her life’s partner and 19 year old son in her own home, which she and her husband bought together.

Zoila raises chickens and does this on her own land, where she has a chicken coop with 100 chickens.  She’s been doing this for five years and she used this time to become well known by her neighbors and large customers who buy from her.  Her son helps her raise, clean-up, and sell.  What she likes about this work is that it is profitable, allows her to generate an income to pay her household expenses, and be with her children all the time.  What she doesn’t like is that the cost of feed varies in price and affects her margins, but this doesn’t cause her to lose enthusiasm to continue working.  She says that she plans to raise a large number of chickens so that she can obtain a larger income.  This will be her 12th loan through MFP and she likes it because she feels that the members are responsible and she expects to be able to continue working with this institution and appreciates the opportunity.

She will use the money from this loan of 3,000 PEN to buy banana leaves that she will use to change out the old ones and expand her chicken coop so she can raise more chickens.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a forty-eight-year-old farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya where he lives with his wife and four children. Three of his children are still in school. He has been in farming for the past eighteen years, producing tea leaves, coffee, bananas, maize and vegetables which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 40,000 Kenyan Shilling (KES) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry, from which he will generate extra income after selling the products. This will improve his living standards and help pay for his children's schooling. He aspires to open a big market just for poultry products in the next five years.

Inadequate funds and dry spells are his major challenges in farming.

Julius says that Juhudi Kilimo plays a great role in fighting poverty.

loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 33-year-old married woman. She is a mother of six children. She wants to provide them with a healthy life.

Asia has been doing a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has spent difficult times in her life, so she decided to go to work herself to financially support her family. Her husband also encouraged her to work and contribute to the family's income. Asia now has five years of experience in this field and has gained a lot of regular customers. 

In order to meet the demands of her customers, Asia requested a loan of 25000 PKR to buy more spools of thread, along with packs of sequins and glittering material for embellishment. She hopes to earn more profits by completing orders on time. She intends to utilize the earned profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, along with packs of sequins and glittering material for embellishment.

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has three children. Tarek is the only provider for the family.

Tarek owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2011, and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to renovate and expand his store. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better life conditions.

loans.use: to renovate and expand his store.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Ms. Shehnaz is a 44-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last two years. She offers various items and goods for everyday use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. Her husband is a sales person in a garment shop and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. Ms. Shehnaz is a mother of four children. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items, such as flour and grains, in large quantities to meet the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy a stock of detergents and other grocery items, such as flour and grains, in large quantities to meet the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is a widow with four children who do not attend school. She is also looking after two grandchildren. Sarah stays in a rented house without access to either electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.
 
Sarah has been selling fish in the market, at retail, for eight years and works seven days a week. She generates additional income through selling sweet bananas. She has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy baskets of fish and sweet bananas for sale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Sarah's dream is to turn her business into wholesale and accumulate profits that will enable her to build a house on her land and also to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because loans are easy to access.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of fish and sweet bananas

loans.name: Raheela

texts.en: Ms. Raheela is a 40-year-old, married woman. She is very talented and excels in work of stitching. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. Raheela wants to support her family by use of her talent and contributes enough in the family income. She is a mother of five, and is responsible to provide them good quality food, education and clothing. Raheela requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of buttons, zips, etc. to meet up with her customers’ demand. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of providing good and higher education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads in different colors, packs of  buttons, zips, etc. to meet up with her customers’ demand.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, two of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other member of the family. 

Norah has been operating a stall of food stuffs and vegetables in the market, at retail, for one year. She works seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

Norah has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy tomatoes, vegetables, mangoes, onions, and silver fish for resale. Her challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her dream is to carry out her business on her own premises and to become a wholesaler. 

Norah joined MCDT SACCO because the loan interest is relatively low and the loans are timely. She stays in a rented house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, vegetables, mangoes, onions, and silver fish for resale.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of a 5-year-old daughter. She is from Trinidad, Bohol. She has been engaged in a sari-sari or variety store business for more than three years now. She is also engaged in a hog raising business. 

Elisa is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store like canned goods, snack food, toiletries and other items.

In the future, Elisa hopes to expand her business so that it will augment her income. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her store like canned goods, snack food, toiletries, and other items.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud, a 53-year-old married man, is a father to 8 sons and daughters between the ages of 7 and 26. He owns a fruit and vegetable store. He brings his goods from the main market at dawn to get fresh produce to sell back in his store. Now, Mahmoud has applied for this loan to take over the shop next to him and expand his store. This will allow him to increase the quantity and variety of fruits and vegetables that he has in his store and increase his revenue.

loans.use: to take over the shop next to him and expand his store.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr: Âgée de 46 ans, Adjowa est une femme mariée à un mécanicien auto qui pratique la revente des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a débuté cette activité il y a 10ans et dispose d’une boutique. Nécessitant des fonds pour le renforcement de son stock, elle sollicite son premier prêt auprès de WAGES pour  payer de la marchandise. Ses  objectifs sont l’agrandissement de son activité et l’épanouissement de sa famille. Elle a 02 enfants tous sur les bancs d’école.
texts.en: Forty-six years old, Adjowa is a woman who is married to an auto mechanic and practices the resale of general foodstuffs. She started this business 10 years ago and owns a shop. Needing funds to strengthen her stock, she is requesting her first loan from WAGES to pay for merchandise. Her objectives are the expansion of her business and the self-fulfillment of her family. She has 2 children who are both in school.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Arouna

texts.fr: Mr Arouna est père de 03 enfants tous sur les bancs d’école. Il a pour conjointe une revendeuse. afin de subvenir aux besoins de la famille, il vend depuis 2004 des pièces détachées auto dans une boutique. Pour faire face à la concurrence, il sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des pièces détachées. Comme perspectives d’avenir, il veut agrandir son activité tout en assurant l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en: Mister Arouna is the father of 3 children who all go to school. His spouse is a reseller. In order to meet the needs of the family, he has been selling automobile spare parts in a shop since 2004. To face competition, he is requesting a first loan from WAGES in order to buy spare parts. For future prospects, he wants to expand his business while ensuring the future of his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for automobiles.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Perfil  Milena
Comercio y Belleza 
1000.000

	Es una mujer joven de 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijos menores. Ella decide trabajar en su casa hace cerca de 4 años con el objetivo de cuidar a sus hijos y apoyarlos en su educación.  En la parte educativa tampoco se queda atrás, sus títulos en belleza y tratamiento de uñas la muestran como una persona con deseos de superación, al demostrar interés en capacitarse. Este nuevo negocio le ha permitido  brindarles apoyo económico para la  educación de sus hijos. Muy ordenada en su actividad, lleva un libro diario con sus cuentas y elabora su contabilidad mensual, por lo que sabe exactamente cuánto le entra y cuanto sale de su negocio. Su Tienda Milena, está inscrita en la municipalidad por lo que su negocio cuenta con todos los permisos para su funcionamiento. El cual  Inició con un dinero que su esposo le dio su esposo,  70000 colones,  con el cual invirtió en mercadería, con este capital empezó a desarrollar su negocio y le ha permitido capacitarse para diversificar sus servicios (tratamiento de uñas).

	.

	 En su casa cuenta con un local y su Tienda Milena está legalmente inscrita, está llevando su tercer curso en un conocido Instituto especializado  en Costa Rica  de estética corporal y ha empezado a trabajar desde hace 2 años el cuido de pies y uñas. Cuenta con el equipo de belleza. En lo que respecta al comercio, maneja una cartera de clientes a crédito, los cuales le están comprando constantemente, gracias a sus facilidades de pago. 

	El préstamo se va a utilizar para la compra de mercadería (ropa, perfumes, cosméticos, ropa interior) y materiales (esmaltes, y otros para pies y uñas) Con esto espera incrementar los ingresos de su actividad ya que una limitante ha sido el capital de trabajo, pero después que asistió a una reunión y escuchó de Fundación Mujer  y Kiva, vio la posibilidad de cumplir sus sueños, que es  empezar a ahorrar para su casa propia y poder ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad en sus estudios y lleguen a ser profesionales.

Este año enfrentó la enfermedad de su esposo que estuvo en cama por lo que tuvo que enfrentar los gastos del hogar. Gracias a su actividad logró superar esta situación y ya su esposo está repuesto y trabajando en su actividad de transportista.
texts.en:
Milena
Business and beauty salon.
1000.000

Milena is 31 years old, married, and has two young children. Approximately four years ago, she decided to operate a store out of her home in order to be able to take care of her children and help pay for their education. Milena is an educated woman with certifications in beauty salon and nail services. She is a woman who strives to excel and always improve. Her newest business has allowed her to financially support her children in their education. She manages her store in a very organized manner, every day she records her daily and monthly accounting so that she can track exactly how money comes and goes in her business. Her business is registered with the city and she has obtained all the legal permits necessary to operate it. 

Milena started this store with 70000 colones given to her from her husband so that she could buy merchandise. From there she began to develop her business and equip herself to diversify her services, for instance, by offering manicures and pedicures. She owns salon equipment and is currently taking her third course in a well-known cosmetology school. Two years ago, she began offering her manicure and pedicure services. Milena manages a portfolio of credit customers, those who patronize her business regularly, thanks to the ease of payment. 

She will use this loan to buy merchandise (clothing, perfume, cosmetics, lingerie) and equipment (enamels and other foot and nail products). With this, she hopes to increase her profits since recently she has had limited working capital. After attending a meeting with Fundación Mujer and hearing about its partnership with Kiva, she saw the possibility to realize her dream of saving money to buy her own house and be able to give her children a better quality education so they will become professionals.

This year, her husband's illness left her to confront their household expenses alone. Thanks to her hard work, she was able to overcome this situation and now her husband is back to work in his transportation business.

loans.use: to invest in merchandise such as men's, women's, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Amévi est âgée de 35ans. Elle est mariée à un gendarme et ils ont 04 enfants en charge. Trois sont sur les bancs d’école et ils ont 13, 10,06 et 02ans. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenus des céréales, des ignames et du charbon de bois dans un marché de la place. Elle a une ancienneté de 04ans. Pour répondre aux besoins des clients, elle fait un troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter des céréales, des ignames et des charbons de bois. Madame Amévi voudrait à l’avenir constituer un stock considérable et assurer l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en:
Amévi is 35 years old and is married to a police officer. They have four children under their care, aged 13, 10, 6, and 2 years old. Three of the children go to school. 

Amévi earns a living by selling cereals, yams, and charcoal in a local market. She has been doing this for four years. 

To better respond to the needs of her customers, she is taking out a third loan from WAGES to buy cereals, yams, and charcoal. 

In the future, Amévi would like to have a larger stock and to ensure the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals, yams, and charcoal

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale et cosmétiques dans une boutique, ayawa est mariée à un entrepreneur. Âgée de 36ans, elle est mère de 02enfants  tous sur les bancs d’école. Ils ont 08 et 06ans. Aidée par une personne dans l’exercice de son activité elle a démarré en 2006. Avec ce quatrième  crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES, elle va s’acheter des produits cosmétiques et des produits d’alimentation générale. A l’avenir, elle veut agrandir l’activité et assurer les besoins élémentaires de la famille.
texts.en:
A seller of general food items and cosmetics in a shop, Ayawa is 36 years old, married, and an entrepreneur. She is a mother of two children, who are eight and six years old, and who both go to school. 

She started her business in 2006, and now she has an assistant to help her. 

With this fourth loan from WAGES, she is going to buy cosmetics and general food items. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and [continue] to ensure the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and general food items

loans.name: Yendoubouam

texts.fr: Mariée à un pompiste, et mère de 02 enfants dont 01 sur les bancs d’école, madame Yendoubouam âgée de 34ans est revendeuse de gâteaux. Elle exerce cette activité à domicile. Pour augmenter son revenu, elle sollicite un cinquième crédit à WAGES pour acheter de la farine de blé, d’huile, de charbons de bois. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité et avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en: Married to a gas pump attendant and mother to 2 children of whom 1 goes to school, Yendoubouam is 34 years old and a reseller of cakes. She practices this business from home. To increase her income, she is requesting a fifth loan from WAGES to buy wheat flour, oil and charcoal. She wants to reinvest in her business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, oil and charcoal.

loans.name: Xiomara Verónica

texts.es:
La Joven Xiomara Verónica, trabaja en un centro Educativo  de la Ciudad de León desempeñándose como docente desde hace  seis  años, es madre de tres  hijos menores de edad.

Xiomara   sale se sus casa a las 6:00 am inicia sus  labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 12:45 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

Xiomara   es el segundo crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel el que utilizara para  cubrir gastos de graduación de uno de su Hijo y pagos de matrículas del siguiente año escolar,  Ella  sueña que su hijos logren a coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Young Xiomara Verónica works in an education center in the town of León. She has been a teacher for the past six years and she's a mother of three underage children.
Xiomara leaves her home at 6 a.m., starts working at 7 a.m. and finishes at 12:45 p.m. These are her hours from Monday through Friday.
This is Xiomara's second loan with Ceprodel. She'll use it to pay for one of her children's graduation fee and for the next school year's tuition fees. She dreams of seeing her children succeed in achieving a professional degree.

loans.use: to pay for schooling expenses.

loans.name: Anisia

texts.en:
Anisia, 61, is married to George. She is a mother of four children, who are all adults. Anisia sells rice in Dandora and has rental houses. Anisia has been doing this business for twenty years, and it generates a monthly income of twenty eight thousand shillings.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to finish building some of the rental houses and also buy more rice for resale. In the future, she wants to open a cereal shop.

loans.use: to build a rental houses.

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rehab is 24 year-old a business lady.  She is married to David, a businessman. They are blessed with one child. She has been running a green grocer business for the past five years with the monthly income of KES.10,000, which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET LTD customer.Rehab will use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for sale. 


With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop and improve the family living standard.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en:
Augustine is 40 years old and married with three children of the following ages 20, 17, and 14 years old. His spouse is a teacher and she produces additional income for the family. He runs a spare parts shop and he has been in business for 10 years with a monthly income of KES. 80,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES. 100,000, which he plans to use to purchase motor vehicle spare parts for sale .

 
He plans to use the anticipated profit from the business to pay back the loan and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts

loans.name: Maripet

texts.en:
Maripet is 40 years old and married. He supports a family of five children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last 10 years with a monthly income of KES. 26,000. 

He is taking his third loan of KES. 40,000 from KADET LTD and this will help him to prepare the farm and purchase inputs

He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and to reinvest. His dreams are to improve the family's living standards and educate his children

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 26 years old, married to Nelly and blessed with one child that he supports. He has run a mobile money facility for the last two years, making a monthly income of KES.30,000 KES. 

He is applying for his first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD ,he plans to increase his operating business float. The anticipated profits will help educate his children. 



His future plan is to improve the family's living standards

loans.use: to increase his mobile money business float.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en: Fatu is 33 years old and lives in Ground Bassa County. She is married and has three children aged 3 to 18. Two are in school and all of them live at home. For the past three years she has been selling palm oil and soap in the local market. She makes a lot of profits because she sells quality palm oil and soap and has a lot of customers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil and soap for her business. She hopes to build a house and expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and soap for her business.

loans.name: Ma-Koia

texts.en: Ma-koia is a 37-year-old mother of four children between the ages of 2 and 13. They all live with her in West Point and attend school. For the past seven years she has been working hard at managing her business. Ma-koia sells six days a week from 7 am to 5 pm. Her husband is a driver, and his truck is used to transport her goods from Guinea to Monrovia. She sells imported slippers for women and children and lappers (locally-dyed cloths.) She learned to sell from her mother, and she first started by selling food in her community. Due to the quality of her goods that she sells, she makes profits every day. She uses some of the profits to buy more goods and help with the expenses of the family. She has requested a loan to purchase more imported slippers and lappers for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more imported slippers and lappers (locally-dyed cloths) for the business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in the Malindi area of Coast province, Kenya.  She is a married mother of six school-going children and she owns a charcoal stall, which she has been operating for two years.  She also earns some income from a salon. 

Joyce learned about Milango through a friend and joined in order to access credit to improve her business operations.  The challenges she is facing include a seasonal business climate and the lack of enough capital to expand the business.  Joyce feels that she will be able to address the issue of business expansion by applying for this new loan.  

Joyce is applying for a loan of 21,100 KES to buy an additional stock of charcoal.  The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to help her expand the business and pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy an additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Mwambeyu

texts.en: Mwambeyu is a 24-year-old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 8 years. She describes herself to be social woman. She operates a retail stall where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a highly populated area and her primary customers are residents from the environs. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy clothes to sell. Her business goal is to enlarge her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will save with SMEP DTM so as to improve her business. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM after taking a loan of Kes 30,000 which she managed to repay.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 46 years old, married to John, and blessed with five children. Martha has been in the retail shop and bodaboda (bicycle or motorcyle taxi) business for the last six years earning 12,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) monthly. This is her fifth loan with KADET Ltd. after successfully repaying her previous loans.

She is going to use the loan of 100,000 KES to purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice and soaps for resale. She plans to use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.

Her hopes and dreams are to educate her kids to the highest level of education.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil, rice and soaps for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renovate his shop and to install a new rolling shutter

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He owns an electronic and electrical sales and spare parts shop which has been operating for six years. In this shop, he sells radios, televisions and other electronic gadgets. He is married and has two school-going children. 

Among the challenges his business faces is lack of capital, a case he now sees slightly sorted by this loan application. Samuel is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to purchase more electronics such as televisions, radios, plugs, cables, bulbs, etc.. He also intends to save the extra income obtained from this loan and use it to improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: To buy more electronics such as televisions, radios, plugs, cables, bulbs, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more electronics.

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a 37-year-old married lady who is looking after her three boys and two girls. She works at home in a clothing sales business. Her husband is a public sector employee who receives a humble salary at the end of the month. 

Manal helps him in paying some of the household bills and to save for emergencies by selling clothes at home that she buys at a wholesale price. She has now applied for this loan to get a new winter clothing collection.

loans.use: to get a new winter clothing collection.

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a resident of the Mariakani area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She operates a salon business, a business that she has been operating for nine years.

She learned about Milango through a friend with an aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are the seasonal market and competition from other businesses of the same type.

Riziki is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to buy hair chemicals, creams, drier/blow dry machine, chairs, etc. 

The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to increase her income, improve the living standard of her life and pay for her children’s education. She aspires to open other branches in the future and build a family residential house.

loans.use: to buy hair chemicals, creams, drier/blow dry machine, chairs, etc.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, all of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other members of the family.

 She has been operating a retail shop for basic commodities for three years and works six days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 300,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy rice, flour, cooking oil, sugar and salt for sale. Her challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

Her dream is to own a big shop in her building and also to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because it is easy to become a member. She stays in her husband`s house without access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, bags of bread, cooking oil, sugar and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a juice-making machine.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a resident of Likoni, Kenya. He has three children and runs a motorcycle transport business in the area. This mode of transport is preferred by many who lack enough money for transport and also for movement within short distances in the area. He began the business two years ago and is also a farmer. He has three children, two of whom are in school.

Samuel was introduced to Milango by his friends and is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to repair his motorcycle.

Samuel will save the additional income obtained from this loan. The challenge with the current business is theft of bicycles and high cost of fuel and spares. He desires to own many more motorcycles as he has seen the returns in the business.

loans.use: To to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 39 year old, married, and has five children.  She is from Bien Unido, Bohol.  Emily is engaged in seaweed farming, which she has been doing for several years together with her husband. This is the sole source of their income.

Emily is requesting for a loan, which she will use to buy materials for seaweed farming, such as seaweed seedlings, straw, rope, and sticks.  In the future, Emily dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy materials for seaweed farming.

loans.name: Neelum

texts.en:
Ms Neelum is a 21-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has had a business stitching clothes for many years. Her husband is a rickshaw driver. He works very hard for his children but due to a large family, he is not able to fulfill the needs of his children in a better way. So Neelum started her own business of stitching.

She is a very hardworking lady but due to the non-availability of funds, she contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to purchase stitching material. For this she applied for a loan of 10,000 Pakistan Rupees (PKR). She intends to use this loan to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and ribbons in various colors. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of thread with packs of buttons, zippers and ribbons in various colors.

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is 25 years old, married, and has three children. Nour works in a private company during the day while her husband serves in the military. At home Nour made a room into a small shop where she sells stationary, school supplies, accessories, and ladies scarves. This business adds to the income of the family. 

Nour is requesting a youth loan, which she will use to increase the quantity of schools supplies.

loans.use: to increase her quantity of schools supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional second-hand bed sheets and shoes.

loans.name: Nehad

texts.en:
Nehad, a 29-year-old, married woman, is a mother to two children. Nehad has a small, home-based business selling clothes and sewing. 

She applied for this loan, so she can increase her profits by adding a new winter collection to her inventory. She wants to start selling perfumes and kitchen appliances in the future.

loans.use: to add a new winter clothing collection to her business.

loans.name: Mouhanad

texts.en:
Mouhanad is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 20 years old. He is single and lives with three family members, two of whom are employed.

Mouhanad owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2008, and now he has an employee. He built up good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

He is requesting a $3,000 youth loan to buy a new generator. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a new generator

loans.name: Ushindi Ii Group

texts.fr:
Boniface  fait partie du groupe  Ushindi II  et  habite à Bujumbura. Il a 45 ans et est marié à  Nahimana, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont  6 enfants, âgés de  3  à 20 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutique (sucre, sel, riz,…) depuis  20 ans. 

Il est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique  (sucre, sel, riz,…),à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait    acheter  des parcelles pour  ses enfants et leur assurer une bonne alimentation.
texts.en:
Boniface is part of the group Ushindi II and lives in Bujumbura. He is 45 years old and is married to Nahimana, a shopkeeper. Together they have 6 children, aged from 3 to 20 years old.

He has been a shopkeeper (sugar, salt, rice...) for 20 years.

He is on his third loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that he receives, he is going to increase his capital and buy many items for his shop (sugar, salt, rice...), to resell to make more.

In the coming years, he would like to buy plots of land for his children and ensure good nutrition for them.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many items for his shop (sugar, salt, rice...), to resell to make more.

loans.name: Toribia Oneyda

texts.es:
La Joven Toribia Oneyda, trabaja en un centro Educativo  de la Ciudad de León desempeñándose como docente desde hace  ocho  años, es madre de tres  hijos de los cuales solo dos de ellos están estudiando. 

Toribia   sale se sus casa a las 6:15 am inicia sus  labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 12:45 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

Toribia está solicitando  crédito a Ceprodel para  utilizarlo en pago de matrículas y gastos varios   del siguiente año escolar,  ya que sus sueños son la preparación de sus lindo Hijos.
texts.en:
For the past eight years, Toribia Oneyda has been working as a teacher at the León Education Center.  She’s the mother of three children, but only two attend school.

Toribia leaves her home at 6:15 am and begins work at 7:00 am and finishes at 12:45 pm, Monday through Friday.

Toribia is asking for a loan through CEPRODEL to pay for tuition and various expenses for the coming school year.  Her dream is to prepare her lovely children.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Claudia Helena

texts.es:
La Señora Claudia Helena, trabaja en un centro Educativo  de la Ciudad de León desempeñándose como docente desde hace  17 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad.

Claudia   sale de sus casa a las 6:20 am inicia sus  labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 12:45 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

Claudia  es el segundo crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel para cubrir gastos de escolares  de sus pequeños hijos,  Ella  sueña con realizar mejora en su vivienda para darle una mejor comodidad a su linda familia.
texts.en:
Claudia Helena has been working as a teacher in the Leon education center for the past 12 years.  She is the mother of two young children.

Claudia leaves her home at 6:20 am and begins work at 7:00 am, and finishes at 12:45 pm, Monday through Friday.

This will be Claudia’s second loan through CEPRODEL and will use the money to pay for her children’s educational expenses.  She dreams of having a larger house to that she can provide more comfortable living conditions to her lovely family.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Sr.  Antonio tiene 44 años y un hijo que tiene la edad de 16 años,  El Sr. Antonio  se dedica  a la  reparación de autos, el es chapista hace ya varios años, tiene su taller  ubicado en la Zona de Barrio Internacional  donde ofrece sus servicios,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sr. Antonio  va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una compresora, herramientas y materiales para realizar su trabajo y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  actividad, El Sr. Antonio va utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando  herramientas para seguir equipando su taller, Antonio  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Antonio is 44 years old and has a 16 year old son.  He repairs cars and has been doing this for a number of years.  His workshop is located in the International Neighborhood zone where he offers his services.  He will use the money from this loan to buy a compressor, tools, and supplies to do his work.  In this way he can provide better service to his customers and increase his income.  Antonio will use the benefits to buy these tools to continue running his shop.  He is a very hardworking and happy person grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de 36 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy responsable y trabajadora, quien vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad, ella trabaja comercializando tambos de gas propano, los cuales comercializa desde su casa de habitación contando con una venta muy estable. María solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL con el deseo de mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos, ella utilizará el dinero para comprar más gas propano y así mismo para invertir en la compra de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, así mismo para comprar carne de res y de pollo para comercializar en este fin de año. De esta manera brindarles a sus hijos todo lo necesario junto a su esposo quien también es muy trabajador, velando ambos por el bien y sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old. She is a responsible and hardworking mother, who lives with her husband and two young children. She works selling tanks of propane gas from her home. This is a stable business for her. 

María is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL with the desire to increase her sales and, therefore, earnings. She will use this money to buy more propane gas, men's, women's, and children's clothing, as well as beef and chicken that she will sell during the end of the year. In this way, she will be able to provide for her children alongside her husband, who is also very hardworking. Both work together to look after the well-being and upkeep of their home.

loans.use: to buy clothing and propane gas to sell.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.en:
Dilnoza is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a sportsman. He always wanted Dilnoza to become a business lady. With the advice of her husband, Dilnoza studied at the course ‘To Get Ahead’ at a women's organization and got enough skills about business. 

She wants to organize a business of animal husbandry.  She will be a very successful business woman because she is hard-working and smart. 

Dilnoza is asking for a loan of 3000 USD to buy cattle to start her new business. She will get through using the loan. Her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities for progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her new animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  Her husband is a mechanic. Recently Zainab opened a small snacks market at her house where she sells candy, chips, and different types of biscuits. 

Zainab is requesting a youth loan, which she will use to buy more goods.

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel is 20 years old and single. Her father started working in another job as his military retirement salary is not enough to support the family. Aseel has finished high school but for many reasons she was not able to enroll in a university, so she started taking music classes and is learning to play an instrument.  

Aseel is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for the classes so that she can be a pianist one day and teach music to children.

loans.use: to pay for her music classes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, and gari.

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Ramona del Rosario tiene un negocio de venta frutas, verduras y especies  en unos de los mercados  del departamento de León desde hace 18 años, sale de su casa a las 5:00 am y abre su negocio a las 6:00 am cerrándolo a 5 pm. realiza este trabajo para el sustento de su familia, ella es madre soltera de dos hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo.  

Doña Ramona está solicitando crédito a Ceprodel para el que utilizara para comprar pasas, vino dulce, alcaparra, ciruela, salsa de tomate, zanahoria, chayote, cebolla, papas, y así  aprovechar la ventas en  los días festivo del mes de diciembre.

Los sueños de Doña Ramona son mantener siempre negocio y terminar la construcción de su humilde vivienda para darle mejor comodidad a su familiar.
texts.en:
Ramona del Rosario has a fruit, vegetable, and spice business in one of the markets in the Leon department.  She’s had it for 18 years and leaves home at 5:00 am, opens her business at 6:00 am, and closes at 5:00 pm.  She works to support her family; she’s the single mother of two children but only supports one.

Ramona is asking for this loan through CEPRODEL in order to buy raisins, sweet wine, capers, plumbs, tomato sauce, carrots, chayote squash, onions, and potatoes so that she can take advantage of the December holidays.

Ramona’s dreams are to always have her business and finish building her humble home to provide a more comfortable environment to her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Vanessa Carolina

texts.es: Vanessa de 31 años de edad, vive junto a dos hijos y su madre junto a quien trabajan para sostener el hogar. Ella es madre soltera quien trabaja muy duro por sacar a sus hijos adelante y brindarles todo lo mejor y necesario. Vanessa posee una tienda en la que comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual tenga la capacidad económica de surtir su negocio, esto debido a que  no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo, y es muy primordial tanto para ella como para sus hijos, ya que es este el negocio que les permite solventar sus gastos familiares. Ella desea poder surtir su tienda con productos como detergente, comida enlatada, pan, golosinas, bebidas y  ropa para niños y adultos, debido a que su demanda incrementa en este mes de diciembre, y así mismo obtener otros productos más, los cuales son de primera necesidad en un hogar y que también son los que se solicitan más en una tienda. Vanessa espera mejorar las ganancias y de esta forma contar con una vida más estable.
texts.en: 31-year-old Vanessa lives with her two children and her mother, and they work together in order to support their household. She's a single mother who works very hard to get her children ahead and provide them with all the best and everything they need. Vanessa owns a store where she sells perishable goods and basic household staples. Her store is located in her home. She requests a loan that allows her to afford stocking up her business, since she doesn't have enough money to do that. This business is very important for her and her children, because it allows her to pay for her family's expenses. She wishes to stock up her store with merchandise such as detergent, canned food, bread, snacks, beverages and clothing for children and adults, since sales increase during this month of December. She also wishes to purchase other products that are basic staples in a household and are the most sought-after in a store. Vanessa hopes to improve her profits and therefore have more stability in her life.

loans.use: to purchase perishable goods.

loans.name: Candida Luz

texts.es: Cándida de 60 años de edad, vive junto a su hija menor de edad, a quien trata de brindarle todo lo necesario para vivir.  Como toda madre responsable, quien ha debido trabajar muy duro realizando tanto el papel de padre como madre, se ha dedica durante muchos años a la venta de ropa y zapatos para hombres, mujeres y niños, la cual comercializa en su casa, Candida vende la ropa a muy buenos precios, así mismo es una persona muy amable y positiva, razón por la que cuenta con varios clientes. Con el deseo de contar con más ganancias también se dedica a la venta de cocos sobre una calle principal, lo que es de mucho beneficio ya que es muy transita por varias personas. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de poder contar con el monto necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir, zapatos y cocos con lo que espera obtener mayores ganancias, las cuales sean de gran beneficio para su famialia como también para su hogar.
texts.en:
Cándida is 60 years old and lives with her minor daughter, for whom she tries to provide everything she needs to live.  Like a responsible mother who has had to work hard to play the role of father as well as mother, she has made her living for many years selling clothes and shoes for men, women and children from her home.  Cándida sells the clothes at good prices, and since she is also a kind and positive person, she has many customers.

In an effort to increase her earnings, she also sells coconuts on a main road, which is very profitable since the road is well-traveled by many people.

She is applying for a loan with the hopes of having enough money to invest in buying a larger quantity of garments, shoes and coconuts, so that she can increase her earnings.  This would be of great benefit to her family as well as for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Mwadena

texts.en:
Mwadena lives in the Mariakani area of Coast province, Kenya. He is a married father of two children and owns a retail shop which he has been operating for four years. In this business, Mwadena sells bread, tea leaves, polish, sugar, flour, fat, soap, etc. 

Mwadena learnt about Milango through a friend and joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve business operations. The challenges he is facing are seasonal supply and high cost of transport.

Mwadena is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy bread, tea leaves, polish, sugar, flour, etc.  The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to expand the business. His plans for the future are to start other businesses and also open stalls in different areas.

loans.use: To buy bread, tea leaves, polish, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children. He has been selling new clothes for the past three years. He has a monthly income of KES. 25,000 which he uses to support his family. 

John is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by staff. John will use this loan to purchase more stock of new clothes for sale in the coming high season. 


With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land, build rental houses and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Mudzomba

texts.en:
Mudzomba is a married man. He has six children. He describes himself as a business-oriented man. He operates a retail business where he sells goats and chickens. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located at a viable business area, and his primary customers are local residents. He says that his biggest business challenge is stiff competition within the area. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy goats and chicken to resell. 

His business goal is to expand his business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful in his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy goats and chickens to resell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, two of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other member of the family.

Lydia has been selling charcoal from her home, at retail, for five years. She works six days a week. She has no other source of income, but her sons support her.

Lydia has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to go wholesale. 

Lydia joined MCDT SACCO because of the good relationship between the staff members and the clients, many of whom are her friends. She rents a house with access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is a 52 year old, married, and has nine children.  She is from San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband are farmers. They have been in the farming business for more than 15 years, growing rice, corn, bananas, and other crops.

Feliciana is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With these products, they will be able to grow healthy crops. In the future, Feliciana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.

loans.name: Tariel

texts.en:
Tariel is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and two sons in the Mtskheta District of East Georgia. The family runs a small agricultural business. In particular, they have a greenhouse, where tomatoes and cucumbers are grown. The harvested products are sold in the capital city at a good price. 

Although both Tariel and his wife work hard, they still live in poverty. Tariel requested a loan to start a dairy farm. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. 

With this loan, Tariel will purchase calves. The family will raise calves and when the calves become milk cows they will start producing dairy products. Locally, the family will sell produced cheese and other dairy products. The sales will increase the income of the family. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calves and start a dairy farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married. Peter is a mechanic. He has been in the field for more than seven years. He learned about Milango from a friend, and he joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan of 41,900 KES to purchase additional spare parts for motor vehicle repair work. 

The only challenge in the business is the high cost of spare parts. Peter is determined to carry out his operations well, because he believes that it is from such a venture that he can establish/educate his family. His future ambition is to be able to install other computerized systems to his motor vehicle repair shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts for motor vehicle repair work.

loans.name: Francisca Haydee

texts.es: Francisca de 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores de edad. Ella trabaja comercializando cosméticos como: cremas para el cabello y cuerpo, labiales, sombras, rubores, y otros más, y así mismo vende perfumes, todo lo comercializa desde su casa y de forma ambulante para obtener más clientes y mejorar sus ventas, Francisca ofrece sus productos por catalogo y así mismo invierte en compras de productos en oferta para luego comercializar de forma física con lo que muchas personas en ocasiones se entusiasman más al ver el productos. Francisca solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, y de esta forma aumentar su inventario para época navideña, en donde las ventas se incrementan significativamente permitiéndole tener mayores ganancias lo cual es el principal deseo de ella y así ahorrar para el mes de enero e invertir en útiles escolares para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two minor children.  She works selling cosmetics such as hair and body creams, lipstick, eyeshadow, blush and others, as well as perfumes.  She sells everything from her house and also as a traveling salesperson in order to obtain more customers and improve her sales.  Francisca obtains her products by catalog and also invests in purchasing products on sale to later sell them physically, since many people often get excited when they actually see the products.

Francisca is applying for a loan from INTEGRAL in order to increase her inventory for the Christmas season, when sales increase significantly, allowing her greater earnings.  The latter is her main desire, so that she can save for the month of January and invest in school supplies for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Abuu

texts.en:
Abuu is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. He is a single business man.  Abuu is a fish monger, a business he has run for three years. He learned of Milango from his friends.

Abuu is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenyan shillings to purchase a freezer. His main challenges include low seasons and the perishability of fish.  He will use the extra income from this loan to set up other businesses and has the ambition of being a wholesaler of fish and other groceries.

loans.use: buya freezer

loans.name: Pazilat

texts.ru: Пазилат 61 год, замужем, воспитала 7 детей. У неё 4 сына и три дочери. Младший сын Пазилат, живет и помогает маме. Остальные дети, уже взрослые.  В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Пазилат с 1997 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) купив маленького теленка и барана.Благодаря стараниям Пазилат на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Пазилат имеется 10 овец с ягнятами, 2 коровы и 1 лошадь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Пазилат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 15 голов овец и корма для них. Доходы от кредита Пазилат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства. Давняя мечта семьи, приобрести машину.
texts.en: Pazilat is 61 years old, married, and has raised 7 children: 4 sons and 3 daughters. Her youngest son lives with her and helps her, and her other children are already adults. As the main breadwinner of the family, since 1997 Pazilat has worked in animal husbandry. She began this business with only 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS), purchasing 1 young calf and sheep. Thanks to her persistent hard work, today she has 10 sheep with lambs, 2 cows, and 1 horse. For the purpose of further developing her business, Pazilat has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 Som (KGS) to buy 15 head of sheep and feed for them. She plans to use the profit generated by this loan to expand her farm. She and her family have a long-held dream of buying a car.

loans.use: To purchase 15 sheeps

loans.name: Misbah

texts.en: Ms. Misbah is a 35-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband in her community for the last four months. She offers various goods for daily use. She has good communication skills and a good client list. She is a mother of two children. She is motivated to provide for her family. In order to grow her business, she requested a loan of 10,000 PKR to buy rice and flour from the market at lower rates. She then will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her first loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: to buy rice and flour

loans.name: Fatmira

texts.en:
Fatmira is requesting a loan, which she will use to repair a damaged stable.
Fatmira is 39 years old, married, and has two children who attend school. They live in the west part of northern Albania. For over 15 years, Fatmira handcrafted and sold crochets while she was a stay-at-home mom. After her children got older, (she is photographed here with one of them who is 11 years old), she went into the livestock business and has been doing very well financially since. Her husband has no occupation of his own, thus, he helps Fatmira with her activity.
With the weather getting colder in the northern region where they reside, animals need to stay warm, yet the stable Fatmira has at the moment for her own animals is in bad shape.

loans.use: to repair a damaged stable.

loans.name: Rakiyabubu

texts.ru: Ракыябубу 53 года, замужем. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, 17 лет назад Ракыябубу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве.Начальный капитал для бизнеса составлял 10,000 KGS Благодаря упорному труду, Ракыябубу смогла развить хозяйство численностью в 2 дойной коровы и 20 овец что приносит около 10,000 сом от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Каждый год семья  семья обрабатывает 2,8 га земли, где ежегодно выращивает фасоль и многолетние травы . В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Ракыябубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков.Так как цены в этом году низкие, и ожидается повышение цен. Доходы Ракыябубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, женить сына и построить большой сарай.
texts.en: Rakiyabubu is 53 years old and married. As the main source of income for the family, 17 years ago she started her own business in animal husbandry and growing crops. Thanks to her persistent hard work, from a start-up capital of only 10,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS), she has managed to develop her farm to now include 2 dairy cows and 20 sheep, which generates an income of around 10,000 Som from the sale of milk and dairy products. Every year, the family work 2.8 hectares of land, where they annually grow beans and perennial herbs. For the purpose of further developing her business, Rakiyabubu has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 Som to buy bulls, since the prices are now low and a future rise is forecast. She plans to use the income generated by this loan to increase her herd, to host her son's wedding, and to build a large barn.

loans.use: To purchase 3 bulls

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Bolorerdene, 30 years old, lives with his wife and two children in a get (a traditional Mongolian home) in his father-in-law’s fence. He works as a taxi driver in a private taxi enterprise and his wife washes glass containers in a local hospital. 

As winter approaches, the couple wants to insulate the walls of their ger. By insulating the walls, the ger will be a warm place for family to live. As a result of insulation, the ger's heat loss will be reduced, and in turn the family will decrease its consumption of coal, contributing to environmental protection. He requests a 1,000,000 MNT loan to buy materials which will be used to insulate the walls of his ger.

loans.use: to insulate his home

loans.name: Altanerdene

texts.en:
