Mr. Altanerdene, 27 years old, lives with his wife, his mother and two children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a technician in an information and communication enterprise since 2010. His mother is working in a private construction company as a bricklayer. 

To raise their living standard, he has begun building his own house which occupies a 40-square-meter  area. Just now he has finished the foundation and purchased some materials such as bricks, planks and others. But due to lack of finances, he hasn’t completely bought the construction materials. During wintertime, construction materials get cheaper so he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy construction materials. 

High quality houses such as he is expecting to build reduce the consumption of coal and as a result will reduce air pollution. By finishing his house, he can make a comfortable living environment for his family and can contribute to environmental security.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rajabmurod

texts.ru: Рачабмурод житель города Вахдат. Ему 53 года. Он женат, имеет 3 детей. Рачабмурод занимается частным извозом. Для улучшения и расширения своей деятельности, он хочет купить новую автомашину.
texts.en: Rajabmurod lives in Vahdat. He is 53, married, and has 3 children. Rajabmurod operates a private taxi service. He wants to buy a new car to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a new car for his taxi service business

loans.name: Sarantuya

texts.en:
Sarantuya is a 47-year-old mother of three sons who lives with her family in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia on their own small plot of land in an outer ger (nomadic tent) district without basic infrastructure. Her husband runs a taxi business and her elder son works as an accountant while their other son attends a local high school.

Sarantuya has supported her family by operating several kinds of businesses. Currently, she stays at home, because her elder son now works. She doesn't want to stay at home, so she decided to buy an old car and run a taxi business with her husband. Her goal is to increase family income in order to purchase an old car and run it as a taxi. Thus, she is requesting a 3,000,000 Mongolian Tugrik (MNT) loan.

loans.use: to purchase a car for taxi business

loans.name: Darejani

texts.en:
Darejani is 53 years old. She lives in a small village in Lagodekhi District, East Georgia. Darejani lives with her family: her husband, son, daughter-in-law, mother-in-law, and infant grandchild. 

The family has a milk cow and a calf. Also, the family grows peanuts, maize, and different kinds of vegetables on the family-owned land. Darejani sells cheese and peanuts at the local open market. The harvested maize is used by the family for feeding the cattle. 

All family members work hard, but the income is not enough for the six-member family. Darejani requested credit to expand a dairy farm. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions provisioning business start-ups and re-startups with credit with soft conditions. These would be made available to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Darejani will purchase a milk cow. She will place it in the old cattle-shed located in her yard. She will produce more cheese and sell the cheese on the local open market. The income for the family will increase by 150 – 200 GEL (Georgian Lari), a 45% to 60% increase. The living conditions for the family will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: To purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Waad

texts.en: Waad is a 21-year-old lady who is majoring in law at a government university. She has applied for this loan to help pay for her upcoming school semester fees and to allow her to start practicing law in real life.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming school semester fees

loans.name: Sakher

texts.en: Sakher is a 22-year-old single man living with his four siblings. Sakher is a university student majoring in computer sciences. He has applied for this educational loan to help him pay for the next semester's fees.

loans.use: to pay for the next semester'sfees.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, four of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other member of the family.

She has been selling cooked food for five years and works four days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to buy rice, flour, cooking oil, peas, meat, charcoal and salt. Her challenges include transportation and defaulters. Her dream is to own a fully stocked restaurant. She joined MCDT because it is easy to become a member. She stays in her own house, which lacks access to both electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses are school fees.

loans.use: to buy more rice, flour, cooking oil, peas, meat, charcoal and salt.

loans.name: Nedal

texts.en: Nedal is a third-year university student majoring in French Language. He hopes that after graduation he could either teach at schools or work in governmental entities where they need the language. He has applied for this educational loan to help him pay for his upcoming semester fees, so he will graduate and get his degree.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Lizam

texts.en: Lizam is 46 years old. He lives with his wife and son in the Kaspi District of East Georgia. His son works as a guide, and Lizam is a driver. They both earn a monthly income, but their income isn’t enough to feed three family members. Lizam requested a loan to start a dairy farm. His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative from Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides loans with reasonable terms to start-up businesses. These loans are provided to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low incomes. With this loan, Lizam will purchase calves to raise. After they become milk cows, Lizam will start producing dairy products. He will sell cheese and other dairy products locally. This will increase the income of their family. The family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available on the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Harbiya

texts.en:
Harbiya is a 45-year-old conservative woman. She asked her daughter to take her place in the photo. 

Harbiya has three other children besides Amani, her daughter, who is a 19-year-old single woman majoring in civil engineering. Now, Harbiya has applied for this educational loan to support her daughter in her education and pay for her next semester and registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's semester and registration fees.

loans.name: Bedougui

texts.fr: Malgré son âge avancé, Bedougui est une femme dynamique qui se bat chaque fois pour subvenir aux charges de ses trois enfants qui vont encore à l’école. Elle vend de la nourriture à la devanture de son domicile à tout le monde et achète les denrées alimentaires au marché. C’est pour l’achat des denrées qu’elle fait son second crédit à WAGES. Elle veut avec le bénéfice mettre ses enfants dans les écoles spécialisées et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Despite her advanced age, Bedougui is a dynamic woman who fights each time to meet the responsibilities of her three children who still go to school. She sells food in front of her home to everyone and buys foodstuffs at the market. She is taking a second loan with WAGES for the purchase of foodstuffs. With the profits she wants to put her children in specialized schools and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Oumarou

texts.fr: Père de 05 enfants dont 02 scolarisés, Oumarou est revendeur de profession. Il exerce son activité dans une boutique et vend des produits d’alimentation générale. Il fait appel à WAGES par un troisième crédit pour acheter de la marchandise afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Avec le bénéfice réalisé, il veut assurer un avenir radieux à ses enfants et agrandir son activité.
texts.en: Father to 5 children of whom 2 go to school, Oumarou is a reseller by profession. He practices his business in a shop and sells general foodstuffs. He is appealing to WAGES for a third loan to buy merchandise in order to better respond to the needs of his customers. With the profits he makes, he wants to ensure a radiant future for his children and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy general foodstuffs.

loans.name: Norberta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,la socia alquila carros a diferentes personas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de transporte.La socia solicita el credito para comprar llantas para los carros.

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member continues making a living in the transportation business.  She rents cars to different people, working from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m.  She's been doing this work for six years and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to expand her transportation business.

She's requesting the loan to buy tires for her cars.

The member's grateful for this opportunity and is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires for her cars

loans.name: Cacilda

texts.es:
Cacilda, de 37 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y alegre. Es conviviente con Gerardo quien se dedica a la pesca y es padre de sus 3 hijos: Gerardo de 16, Derly de 13 y Beldyt de 10 años de edad, por quienes se esfuerza en salir adelante. Juntos viven en su casa propia que compró con el apoyo de su pareja. La actividad que realiza Cacilda es la pesca artesanal, llevando  pescado frescos a los  puertos de la localidad para luego a venderlos  a los comerciantes del mercado, Su pesca lo realiza en los afluentes de los ríos, caños y cochas logrando sacar su producto cada semana, atendiendo de manera amable y atenta a sus clientes que siempre le consumen sus productos.
Se inició hace más de 20 años con un capital propio y en compañía de su pareja e hijos. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja, y que logra acabar con todos su mercadería que oferta.
Antes de empezar con su negocio sufría muchas  dificultades por la escasez de trabajo, y la poca necesidad de tener un oficio y buscó generarse sus propios ingresos para apoyarse con los gastos del hogar.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los ingresos obtenidos desea sembrar y cosechar papayas ya que ha visto que sería un negocio rentable. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, por el apoyo que vienen brindando a las personas con negocio y lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de víveres para sus viajes de pesca, además de materiales de pesca como redes, hilos, tramperas, y guardar un saldo para usarlo como capital de trabajo en alguna oportunidad de negocio que se presente.
texts.en:
Cacilda is 37 years old, a driven and hard working woman who is also friendly and happy. She lives with Gerardo who makes a living as a fisherman and is the father of her three children: Gerardo is 16, Derly is 13 and Beldyt is 10 years old. For their children he works hard to get ahead. They live together in their own house that she bought with the help of her partner. 

Cacilda fishes on her own and carries fresh fish to the ports of her neighborhood to then sell to merchants. She fishes in the tributaries of rivers, channels and lagoons each week. She provides her customers with friendly and attentive service so that they continue to consume her products. She began more than 20 years ago with her own capital and continues with her partner and children's help. She considers her business to be pretty profitable because she has made a good living and is able to sell all the fish that she offers. Before beginning this business she suffered from many troubles because of the scarcity of employment and the minor need of having a trade. She searched to generate her own income to support the household expenses. 

Now as she has obtained more income she hopes to grow and harvest papayas. This is a business that appears to her to be profitable. This will be her fourth loan with MFP. With this loan she expects collaboration so that she can finalize her plans. In addition to being pleased with her communal bank, she is also happy for the support brought to those with businesses. She considers her group to be united and supportive. 

With the amount requested of 1000 nuevos soles she will invest in the purchase of basic items for her fishing trips and the fishing materials including nets, fishing lines and traps. She will save a portion of her income to use as working capital some day for the business that she is proposing.

loans.use: to buy nets, fishing line and traps for fishing.

loans.name: Macliny

texts.en: Macliny lives in Martissant, a section of Port-au-Prince, Haiti with his wife and 9-month old daughter. He usually works as a taxi driver but is venturing into the clean energy business by becoming an EarthSpark entrepreneur. With a Kiva loan, Macliny will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  Macliny has electricity in his home but he likes to use solar products as it is often unreliable. Macliny will start by selling Lanp Enèji Pwòp, a solar light bulb, but would some day like to sell efficient cookstoves.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en:
Jacques lives in Jacmel, Haiti and is a regional distributor for EarthSpark. He enjoys selling solar products because he would like to “light up the world” and is an enthusiastic vendor for EarthSpark products. He has a network of other retailers who he stocks regularly with clean energy products. He would like to build his business and expand his network of retailers. The most popular product he sells is the TiPowa, a solar desk lamp with phone charging capabilities. With a 
Kiva loan, he will be able to benefit from bulk prices for the TiPowa so that he can expand the number of EarthSpark retailers throughout his region and the whole country.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business

loans.name: Jean Marie

texts.en: Jean Marie lives in St. Marc, Haiti and works as a doctor. He is a distributor for EarthSpark products and has about 15 retailers throughout the Artibonite department. He is looking to expand his business and take on new retailers. A Kiva loan will help him take advantage of bulk prices to really boost his business. He mainly sells kerosene stoves, an alternative to the charcoal stoves which are common in Haiti and lead to deforestation, and small solar lights. He will also sell larger solar home systems that can light an entire home as well as power radios and charge mobile phones. He wanted to become an EarthSpark entrepreneur so that he could earn money and help protect the environment and is eager to continue.

loans.use: to purchase stock for clean energy products

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef, a 20-year-old single guy, is one of six siblings living together with their parents. 

Having an independent personality, Yousef started supporting himself as soon as he turned 18 years old. Now he is working at offices and a school supplies shop. At the same time Yousef is a university student majoring in accounting. After graduation he wants to start looking for a full time job where he can apply what he studied. 

Yousef has applied for this loan to help him pay part of the semester fees.

loans.use: to help him in paying part of the semester fees.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en: Alaa, a 20-year-old single lady, is the only sister for five brothers. Alaa has applied for this loan to help her pay for her semester fees as she is studying at the university and majoring in computer information systems.

loans.use: pay for her semester fees

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is farmer from San Miguel, Bohol. She has been in the rice farming business together with her husband for almost 20 years now. This is the source of their income.

Felicidad is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.
 
In the future, Felicidad aims to improve her farming business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Raad

texts.en: Raad is an 18-year-old single guy, and he is the oldest brother to three siblings. His father is supporting them from the income he makes from working as a driver. Raad now is a freshman at the university majoring in accounting; he has applied to this loan to be able to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase hair weaves, beauty soaps, shampoos and beauty cream to sell

loans.name: Norma Eulogia

texts.es: Norma es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Norma continúa dedicándose a la comercialización de material educativo para niños. Norma en esta oportunidad y por ser fin de año, está solicitando su préstamo para comprar ropa para bebés y niños y aprovechar la campaña navideña y comercializar sus productos en las diferentes ferias de la ciudad. Norma está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle tener un ingreso extra y ayudar con el sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the communal bank “Qorichuspas” of the city of Cusco, Perú.  Norma continues to make a living selling educational materials for children.  Norma, on this occasion and being the end of the year, is requesting a loan to buy clothing for babies and children, to take advantage of the Christmas season and sell her products in the different markets of the city.  

Norma is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to have an extra income and helping to sustain her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing for babies and children.

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia prepara desayunos,almuezos y cenas,la socia tambien sigue vendiendo productos medicinales,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
This member continues dedicating herself to her business selling food. She prepares breakfast, lunch and dinner and also continues selling medicinal products. She works from 8:00am until 5:00 pm. She has had this business for eight years and it is going well for her. Her dream is to have her own restaurant. She is requesting this loan to buy food to prepare including chicken, red meat and vegetables. 

She is very thankful for the opportunity brought to her and is committed to making her payments according to the agreement.

loans.use: to buy products to prepare including chicken, red meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Medita

texts.es:
Medita, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y amable,  está separada desde hace 3 años, vive en compañía de sus hijos de 11, 08  y 5 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su la casa de su mamá. El negocio que tiene Medita es la venta de comidas, como cenas que lo realiza de lunes a viernes atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes logrando tener una buena acogida y demanda, además los domingos venden parrilladas de pollos, realizando este negocio desde hace 05 años contando con la ayuda de su mamá, iniciándose con un capital de un préstamo particular.
Comenta  que su negocio es rentable porque tiene buena sazón, así como el ingreso económico que le permite pagar sus cuentas y gastos de su hogar. Al contrario no le gusta porque cuando llueve el local donde esta ubicado su negocio donde se inunda, pero eso no la desanima y continúa en trabajando, por eso desea ampliar, arreglar y mejorar su techado donde pueda atender más cómodamente a sus clientes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además desea conocer a la gente que conforman  el  banco comunal del cual será parte. Ya que considera a sus miembros ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles los invertirá en el arreglo de su local y su techo para así atender más cómodamente a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Medita is 27 years old, is a driven and hard working woman and is also happy and friendly. She has been separated for three years and lives comfortaby with her children of 11, 8 and 5 years of age in her mother's house. Medita's business is selling food for dinner which she does Monday-Friday. She provides her customers with friendly service and receives a great welcome and demand from them. She also sells grilled chicken on Sundays which she has done for five years with the help of her mother. She began this business with a loan. 

She notes that her business is profitable because her food has good flavor. Her income allows her to pay the bills and househould expenses. What she does not like is that when it rains her business floods. This does not discourage her though and she continues working. Because of the rain, she hopes to expand, fix up and improve her roof so that she can serve her customers with more comfort. This will be her first loan with MFP. She awaits the collaboration so that she can finalize her plans. She hopes to also meet those of the communal bank which she will become a member of because she already considers the members to be responsible. 

With 500 nuevos soles she will invest in fixing up her business and it's roof so that she can attend to her customers in greater comfort.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to improve her locale's infrastructure where she sells food.

loans.name: Imelda María

texts.es:
La Señora Imelda María, trabaja en un centro Educativo  de la Ciudad de León desempeñándose como docente  desde hace  cuatro años, es madre de cinco  hijos de los cuales solo una está a su cargo. 

Doña Imelda sale de sus casa a las 6:00 am inicia sus  labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 12:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes,  es primer  crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel para realizar el pago de título de graduación de su hija,  Ella  se siente muy orgullosa por haber logrado la formación de su hija.
texts.en: Imelda María has worked as a teacher at an educational center in the city of León for four years; she’s the mother of five children only one of whom is still in her care.  Imelda leaves home at 6am and starts work at 7am ending at noon Monday through Friday.  This is the first loans he’s requested from Ceprodel to pay her daughter’s diploma fees.  She feels very proud to have accomplished her daughter’s training.

loans.use: to pay diploma fees.

loans.name: Santos Ramón

texts.es:
Don Santos Ramón vive en el departamento de Managua  Nicaragua, es una persona soltero,  tiene bajo su cargo a una persona,  trabajo estable desde hace  sietes años donde se desempeña como conductor de transporte liviano en una institución del estado.

don Santos Ramón se presento a CEPRODEL  para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como bloque, arena, cemento para construir en su vivienda un baño, para darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia. 

"Esperamos de CEPRODEL y de los organismos que  apoyen para seguir brindándoles ayuda a los clientes que necesitamos de estos financiamientos, para hacer inversiones en nuestra vivienda  y le agradecemos por esta oportunidad que brindan".
texts.en:
Santos Ramón lives in Managua Department in Nicaragua.  He’s single and has one dependent.  He’s worked as a light transport driver for a state institution for seven years.  Santos Ramón has come by Ceprodel to request a loan to buy building materials like concrete blocks, sand and cement to build a bathroom at home in order to provide better living conditions for his family.

“We hope from Ceprodel and from organizations that support it that they will continue providing help to clients who need financing so we can invest in our homes and we are grateful for the opportunity being provided.”

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Olgha

texts.en:
Olgha is from the town of Mtskheta. She is 38 years old, married and lives with her husband, 18-year-old daughter and mother-in-law. Olgha’s husband works as a driver and her mother-in-law is a cook at a restaurant. Both of them get a monthly salary. As the existing income is not enough for the family, Olgha decided to start a new business. In particular, she plans to renovate her garage properly and rent it for a good price. 

Olgha has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time because of her lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. However, her loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, for they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With this loan, Olgha will purchase building materials to renovate the garage properly so that it satisfies the personal needs of her clients. Olgha hopes her business will be profitable and this will increase her income, providing her family members with enough money to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions. Olgha also plans to finance the education of her daughter. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to renovate a garage for renting.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 45 years old and married to Peninnah. They have three children and live in the town of Ndunyu Njeru. He has been running a cereal-selling business now for four years and it has been profitable.

Having paid his previous loan amount n good time,this will be his second loan term and he plans to use the amount to buy more stock of cereals to sell.

These include wheat, rice, beans, and maize flour. With the festive season ahead, he anticipates to make more profits with which he plans to pay school fees for his children. Simon hopes to expand his business by adding more stock of cereals to sell.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of rice and flour.

loans.name: Manar

texts.en:
Manar is a 20-year-old single lady. She has two brothers and two sisters. 

Manar goes to a governmental university to study public relations and media. Now she has applied for this educational loan to pay for her registration fee.

loans.use: to pay for her university registration fee.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with eight children, three of whom currently attend school. She is not looking after any other members of the family.

She has been operating a retail shop for basic commodities for ten years and works seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 2,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy rice, flour, cooking oil, soda, fruit juices, sugar and salt for sale. 

Her challenges include transportation and recovering payment from debtors. Her dream is to own a fully stocked shop and also to become a wholesaler. 

She joined MCDT because it is easy to become a member. She rents a house with access to electricity, but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more rice, flour, cooking oil, soda, fruits, juices, sugar, boxes of  soap and cartons of salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a part of his fourth year fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is 20 years old and is majoring in politics at one of the Jordanian universities. He is requesting an educational loan to proceed with his registration for the next semester and pay for the university fees.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester fees.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase goats and cows.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin” y con la venta de productos de primera necesidad y con la elaboración de artesanía, ella también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chanchos y pollos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento (afrecho, alfalfa, vitaminas, pasto y concentrados) para sus animales. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank and with her sales of basic staples and with her crafts-making.  She also works raising small farm animals like guinea pigs, pigs and chickens.  She’s been in business several years now and does quite well.  She’s asking for the loan to buy feed (bran, alfalfa, vitamins, grass and concentrate) for her animals.  She is a responsible, kind person who supports her family and she’s happy with the loan and committed to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Rimber

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de agencia de viajes,el socio ofrece viajes a lugares como machupicchu o valle sagrado del cusco,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliarele negocio de agencia de viajes.El socio solicita el credito para comprar boletos turisticos.

El socio disfruta mucho su trabajo y es muy trabajador y él se ha comprometido a hacer los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en: He continues working in the travel agency business.  He offers trips to places like Machupicchu or the Cusco Sacred Valley.  He works from 8am until 6pm and has been in business 6 years and does very well.  His dream is to expand the travel agency business; he’s requesting the loan to buy tickets to tourist attractions.  He enjoys his work very much and is very hardworking; he’s committed to make his installment payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tickets to tourist attractions.

loans.name: Yaqueline

texts.es:
La socia sigue siendo emfermera y trabaja en una clinica,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de venta de regalos.La socia solicita el credito para uso personal para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues being a nurse working in a clinic from 8am until 7pm; she’s had this job for 7 years and does very well.  Her dream is to have a gift shop.  She requests a personal use loan to buy a television set for home.  She’s happy with the granted loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy a television set.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”, con la agricultura y con la elaboración de chicha de jora. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz para elaborar jora para preparar chicha de jora. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues in the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank, with agriculture and with making ‘chicha de jora’ [drink made from fermented corn].  She’s been in business for several years now and does very well.  She requests the loan to buy more corn to make jora used to make chicha de jora.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family and is happy about the loan and committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Edgar Erasmo

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de cabina de internet,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta als 9:00 p.,el socio ya tiene 6 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de cabina de internet.El socio solicita le credito para comprar un repuesto  para su computadora.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: He continues with his business of Internet access booths working from 8am until 9pm.  He’s been in this business for 6 years and does very well.  His dream is to expand the Internet access booth business.  He requests a loan to buy a spare part for his computer.  He’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and at the same time commits to make his payment as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy a part for his computer.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir advente y apoyar a su familia. Es conviviente con Lino quien es pescador y padre de sus 5 hijos: Kety de 15, Marjory de 11, Karol de 8, Cintia de 5 y Mateo de 3 años de edad, por quienes se esfuerza por brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Viven juntos en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que realiza Maribel es la venta de pescado fresco, empezando muy de temprano cuando se dirige al puerto a recibir el pescado que pesca su pareja para venderlo en su puesto del mercado más concurrido de la ciudad, atendiendo muy amablemente a sus clientes, sabiendo  que así se ganará sus preferencias y le seguirán comprando.
Se inició hace más de 5 años con un capital propio que invirtió comprando materiales de pesca para su pareja y ella se dedica al vender el producto de la pesca, luego  viendo la acogida que tiene su negocio fue aumentando sus ventas.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene ese producto sobre todo en tiempo se escasez donde aumenta sus precios.
Se decidió a empezar con su negocio por la necesidad de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar y mantener a sus hijos que son numerosos.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados que tiene, desea mantener su negocio y continuarlo pues es su única fuente de ingresos. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta que le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y colaborador.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra materiales de pesca para uso de su pareja como redes, arpones, tramperas, hilos, anzuelos y otros, así conseguir su principal producto que es el pescado fresco, esperando aumentar el volumen de sus pescas y ventas, para así obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maribel, 34, is a woman who has a strong desire to get ahead and support her family.  She lives with Lino, who is a fisherman and is the father of her 5 children: Kety, 15, Marjory, 11, Karol,  8, Cintia, 5, and Mateo, who is 3 years old.  It is for them that she exerts herself, so that she can provide them with a better quality of life.  The family lives together in their own home, which was purchased with a lot of effort.

Maribel has a business selling fresh fish.  She starts working very early when she goes to the port to receive the fish that her partner has caught, so that she can later sell it from her stall in the busiest market in the city.  She provides her customers with friendly service, knowing that in this way she will gain their preference so that they will keep buying from her.

Maribel started this business more than 5 years ago with her own capital, which she invested in fishing supplies for her partner so that she could sell the fish that he caught.  Later, seeing how well her business was received, she started increasing her sales.  She considers her business to be quite profitable, because of the good earnings she gets and the strong demand for her products, particularly at times when there is a shortage and she can raise her prices.  

Maribel decided to start up her business so that she could support her partner with the household expenses and support her large family.  Now, seeing the good results that she has, she wants to keep the business going and continue with it, as it is her only means of generating income.  

This will be Maribel's 4th loan with MFP, and she expects that with this small loan she will be able to meet her goals.  Also, she comments that she enjoys working with her communal bank, because she considers it to be a group of people who are united and cooperative.  With the sum of 1,200 Peruvian soles that she requests, she will purchase fishing supplies for her partner, such as: nets, harpoons, traps, fishing lines, fish hooks, and other supplies.  This way, she can obtain her main product, which is fresh fish.  She is hoping to increase the volume of fish that she sells, so that she can increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy nets, harpoons, traps, fishing lines and fish hooks

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия  опытная портниха и она шьет национальные матрасы, которые таджики называют «курпача».  Ей 47  лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 4  детей. Ее муж работает на химическом заводе их района и получает маленькую зарплату. Его зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми нужными средствами  10 лет назад она начала свой бизнес. Она шьет «курпачи» дома. Благодаря  хорошему сервису, она обладает широким кругом клиентов. Ее клиенты очень требовательные, но Зулфия с легкостью справляется с их капризами. Одна из дочерей Зулфии скоро выходит замуж и Зулфие не обходимо деньги для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1700 сомони для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Don't you want to help a dressmaker, who is a master of her craft? Zulfiya is an experienced dressmaker and she sews national mattresses that Tajiks call "kurpacha." She is 47 years old, married and is raising four children. Her husband works in the chemical factory and receives a small salary. His salary is not sufficient to provide the family with all the necessary means. 

In order to provide for the family, she started her own business ten years ago. She sews kurpachi at her home. Thanks to excellent service, she has a wide range of customers. Her customers are very demanding, but Zulfiya easily copes with their whims. One of Zulfiya's daughters is getting married soon and she does not have the needed money for the wedding event, nor for the purchase of a dowry. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,700 Somoni for the wedding event. She looks forward to your kindness.

loans.use: To make her daughter’s wedding party

loans.name: Islam

texts.en: Islam is a 21-year-old lady who recently got married. Since her husband is on duty serving in the military, Islam went back to the university to continue the process of getting a bachelor's degree. She is now majoring in Managerial Information Systems. Islam has applied for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Saio

texts.en: Pictured above is Saio, a petty businesswoman from the town of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone. Saio sells market foodstuff like margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste) salt, pepper, etc. The 27-year-old native of Kabala town has been a businesswoman for six years now. Saio is married and has two children who are attending primary school. With the help of this loan, Saio is going to buy margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 21-year-old single guy living with his two brothers and a sister. Omar is still a university student majoring in Business Administration. He has applied for this loan to help him pay for his semester and registration fees.

loans.use: to pay for his semester and registration fees.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
Ignatius is 60 years old and still owns and operates a public service vehicle in Mombasa. 
He is a married man with three adult children, and has been in this business for the last 20 years. His monthly income is KES. 87,000 

He will be using the requested loan to purchase spare parts for his vehicle, and use the anticipated profit to service his loan. This is his third loan; the previous ones were paid successfully. He hopes to excel in the future.

loans.use: to refurbish his matatu (shared taxi) in order to make more trips.

loans.name: Elaf

texts.en: Elaf is a 21 years old single lady.  She is one of four siblings living together with their parents.  Elaf is a university student majoring in geology.  She has applied to this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David lives in Kutaisi District.  He is 53 years old, married and lives with his wife and 27-year-old daughter.  The only source of income for the family is the small salary earned by David working as a watchman locally.  The income is not enough for a 3-member family.  According to Credo estimations, they belong to the vulnerable poor category. 

David decided to start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor.  His loan request was approved as part of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.  With the received credit, David will purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver.  The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family.  Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is a 56 year old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol.  She has been running a sari-sari or variety store business for 5 years now.  She sells various goods to people in her place.

Florencia wants to make use of a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, snack foods, seasonings, soap and toiletries.
In the future, Florencia dreams of making her business grow and be sustainable.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell like canned goods, snack foods, seasonings, soap and toiletries

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Ms Aneela is a 22 year old married woman and a mother of two.  She has been doing sewing work for many years.  Her husband works in a factory but strikes and load shedding affects his daily wages so Aneela decided to use her sewing machine which was given to her as gift from her parents.  By this time she has become well known in her community and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf foundation as she is in her 4th loan cycle.  To cope with the increasing demand. she requested for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of zippers, buttons and needles.  She wishes to spend parts of the profits on providing a better future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads with the packs of zippers, buttons and needles.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson used his previous loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer as well as to pay the laborers.  It was profitable and he was able to pay back the previous loan. 

This being his fourth loan term, he plans to buy potato and maize seeds as well as fertilizer for planting on his farm.  He will use the anticipated income to buy a heifer cow.

Nelson hopes to buy more dairy cows as well as plant more cash crops to sell, hence make more income and be able to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy potato and maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with five children, all of whom currently attend school.  She is not looking after any other member of the family.

She has been operating a hair salon for seven years and works seven days a week.  She has no other source of income.  She has requested for a loan of UGX 600,000 from MCDT- SACCO to stock braids, weaves, hair chemicals and oils for sale and for the salon.  Her challenges include an unstable power supply.  Her dream is to own a big salon and be able to provide various services. 

She joined MCDT because loans are timely.  She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more hair chemicals, oils, braids, weaves for resale and for the salon

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 27 year old young married man.  He lives in Rafah city located in Gaza Strip with his wife with no children yet.  Fares is employed and gets a low salary.  This salary does not cover all of the family's needs.  Fares would like to complete his house and make some improvements by buying some construction supplies like cement, steel and other building materials . 

Fares took a USD loan from FATEN to buy construction materials he needs to complete building his house.  This loan will help the family to live in suitable conditions and enjoy living in their house.

Fares is photographed in the picture.

About Shariah-compliant lending:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to complete building the house

loans.name: Grace Wanjiku

texts.en:
Grace used her previous loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer for planting in her farm.  It was very profitable and she was able to pay back the loan amount.

This will be her sixth loan amount and she plans to buy a dairy cow.  She also plans to buy fertilizer and seedlings for planting.  She will use the generated income to pay school fees for her children who are in secondary school and college.

She hopes to expand her farming business by buying more dairy cattle and thereby become one of the leading dairy farmers in Ndunyu Njeru town.

loans.use: to buy a cow and fertilizer.

loans.name: Wilber Fernando

texts.es: El joven Wilber de 31 años de edad continua siempre con su labor como optometrista en conjunto con su señora quien le ayuda en las ventas, ya tienen su clientela establecida  y están ubicados en la zona de la costa norte del país, sus ingresos le ayudan para sacar adelante a sus 4 hijos quienes estudian y que cada vez va creciendo más la familia, ya el mayor tiene 15 años, Wilber solicita  este noveno crédito para comprar un auto refractómetro para ver la calidad de la vista de sus clientes y así darles resultados más exactos, poco a poco el va adquiriendo sus equipos que son de vital importancia para continuar con su trabajo, brindándole sus buenos servicios a las personas.
texts.en:
Wilber, 31, continues to work as an optometrist, together with his wife who helps him with sales. They have loyal customers now and are located by the coast, north of the country.

With his income, he helps his four children to progress. They all study and continue to grow; the eldest is 15.

Wilber is requesting his ninth credit to buy an auto refractometer in order to evaluate the sight quality of his clients and give them more accurate results. Step by step, he acquires more equipment, necessary for the continuation of his business and for giving his clients a good service.

loans.use: to buy an auto refractometer.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial en su trato a los demás. Es separada del padre de sus 7 hijos. Vive en la casa propia  en compañía de 4 de  sus hijos, su mamá y su papá, quienes la apoyan en la crianza de sus hijos menores.
La actividad que realiza Cecilia es la venta de artesanías como colares, pulseras, mantas con diseños nativos y otros. Para eso cuenta con un pequeño taller en su  casa donde  prepara todos sus productos y los vende de manera ambulatoria muy amable y cordial a sus clientes que en su mayoría son los turistas ganándose su preferencia. Además de llevar a vender en otras ciudades.
Se inició hace más de 18 años con un capital propio y preparando en pequeñas cantidades, aprendió de su madre y ahora viendo la cogida que tiene su negocio, decidió continuar, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de sus pequeños hijos en la preparación y la venta la realiza ella sola.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable porque casi siempre acaba todo lo que prepara para vender, dejándole buenas ganancias. Decidió empezar con éste negocio debido a la necesidad de contar con un oficio y un ingreso económico para cubrir sus gastos y los de sus hijos, ya que se separó de su pareja.
Viendo los buenos resultados que está tendiendo con su negocio tiene planes de continuar y hacerlo crecer. Este será el préstamo número 4 con la institución MFP, está contenta de saber que tendrá accesos un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal  pues conoce a la mayoría de sus  integrantes y los considera ser personas amables y responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de materiales para la preparación de artesanías como telas de tocuyo  para los mantos, hilos, tintes y otros, así brindar un mejor producto a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 40, is a hardworking, enterprising woman in addition to being kind and gracious in the way she treats others.  She’s separated from the father of her 7 children.  She lives in her own house in the company of four of her children and her mother and father who support her in the care of her younger children.

The activity Cecilia does is crafts; she makes necklaces, bracelets and fabric with native designs and others.  To do so, she has a small workshop at home where she makes all her products that she then sells from place to place being very kind and gracious towards her customers who for the most part are tourists whose preference she’s won over; she also goes to sell in other cities.

She started more than 18 years ago with her own capital and making small amounts.  She learned from her mother and now, seeing the good response she’s had to her business, she’s decided to continue and to date her little children help her produce; she does the selling by herself.

She considers the business to be quite profitable because she almost always sells out everything she makes producing good profits.  She decided to start this business because she needed to have an occupation and a source of income to cover her and her children’s expenses since she separated from her spouse.

Seeing the good results she’s had with her business, she plans to continue with it and make it grow.  This will be MFP loan #4 and she’s happy to know that she’ll have access to financial support to make her plans reality.  She also comments that she’s comfortable in her communal bank because she knows most of the members and considers them to be kind, responsible people.  She will use the requested 800 new soles to buy materials and supplies like ‘tocuyo’ [coarse cotton cloth] for the fabric, thread, dyes and others to make the crafts and thus provide better products for her customers.

loans.use: to buy cotton fabric, thread, dye and others.

loans.name: Delmer

texts.es:
Delmer, de 34 años de edad, es un hombre empeñoso  y trabajador, además de amable y solidario. Es conviviente con Lidia quien es docente y madre de sus 2 hijos: Walter de 3 años y Charlise de 5 años de edad. Vive en compañía de su pareja y sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Delmer  es la venta de mercadería variada como abarrotes de primera necesidad, ropas, artículos de ferretería, envases de plástico y otros. Todos estos productos los vende por los caseríos ubicados en las riveras de los ríos. Iniciándose por la necesidad económica que atravesaban ya que con los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba, ahora cuenta con un ingreso adicional que le da un alivio, además de verlo crecer en estos 3 años  de lleva funcionando su negocio contando con la ayuda de su pareja en sus ratos libres.
Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso adicional para  los gastos del hogar, además de realizar viajes cortos y conocer nuevos lugares.  Pero no le agrada cuando algunos de sus clientes le solicitan crédito por sus compras a lo que él  se niega ya que considera que su negocio está en crecimiento y no le conviene éste tipo de venta. Por otro lado, con el resultado positivo que evidencia  su negocio,  tiene planes de hacerlo crecer y ampliar sus productos. Este será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues ha observado que es un grupo unido y colaborador logrando tener bastante apoyo por sus partes.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los piensa invertir en su negocio comprando mercadería como abarrote, artículos de ferretería, ropas y otros a precios más cómodos, para así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Delmer, 34, is a hardworking, enterprising man in addition to being kind and supportive.  He lives with Linda who is a teacher and the mother of their two children, Walter, 3, and Charlise, 5.  He lives in his own house with his spouse and children who he loves very much.  Delmer’s activity is selling varied merchandise like basic staple food items, clothes, hardware, plastic containers and others.  He sells all the products in hamlets located on river banks.  He started out because of the economic need they were going through because his spouse’s income was insufficient and now they can rely on this additional income with is a great relief.  He’s also seen the business grow in the three years it’s been in operation with help from his spouse in her free time.

He likes his business because it allows him to earn additional income for the home as well as to make short trips and get to know new places.  But he does not like it when some of his customers ask to buy on credit; he refuses because he considers that the business is in the growing phase and this type of sale isn’t advisable.  On the other hand, with the positive result his business is having, he plans to make it grow and expand his products.  

This will be MFP loan #5 and he’s hoping for your collaboration to continue towards his goals.  He’s also comfortable in his communal bank because he’s observed that they are a united, cooperative group that provides quite a bit of support to its members.  He will use the requested 1,000 new soles to buy merchandise like grocery items, hardware supplies, clothes and others at more affordable prices in order to earn higher income.

loans.use: to buy basic staples, hardware and clothes.

loans.name: Las Concentidas De Mazani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CONCENTIDAS DE MAZANI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Achacachi, está compuesta por once integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Mery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, tejedoras de cama, pesadores y chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Mery es parte integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que se incorporó a la institución por invitación de una promotora que fue a visitarla a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene el negocio de pesca y venta, cuenta que este negocio lo comenzó conjuntamente su esposo, ya es un negocio familiar.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para mejora de su herramienta (compra de redes) que adquirirá de las tiendas comercializadoras y posteriormente lo implementará en  su espacio de trabajo. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyarse en lo posible a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Las Concentidas de Mazani" will start their first loan at Pro Mujer as part of the Achacachi Regional Office. The group is made up of eleven members and is led by a board of which Mery is the president. The communal bank members' businesses are diverse. Among them are milk sales, blanket weavers, fishers, and a driver. 

The loan they are taking will benefit small micro-businesses within distinct fields. Mery is one of the members and she says that this is the first time that this is the first time she is working with the institution through the invitation of a loan officer who visited her at her home. She currently has a business fishing and making sales. She says that she started the business with her husband and now it is a family business. 

The loan she is taking out now is to improve her tools (purchase nets) that she will acquire in the retailers stores and later she will use them in her work space. This kind of work allows her to make an income to support her family however possible. She is married and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the health training and the loan.

loans.use: to buy nets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with children.  She is not looking after any other member of the family.

She has been running a mini bakery, selling basic commodities and selling samosa and chapatti for two years and works seven days a week.  She has no other source of income.

She has requested for a loan of UGXs 300,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy flour, peas, cooking oil, baking powder for making samosa and chapatti.  Her challenges include seasonality.  Her dream is to sell samosa and chapatti at wholesale and also to own a fully stocked bakery. 

She joined MCDT because of the testimonies give by members that these loans are profitable.  She rents a house with access to electricity and no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, peas,cooking oil and baking powder

loans.name: Saidi

texts.en:
Saidi is a 32-year-old, hard-working man with three children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. For six years, he has been operating a retail shop. He started the shop in order to financially support his growing family. Like most good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the University level and set up sustainable income generating activities. Saidi also grows cocoa which has high demand since the cocoa-processing factory is located near his home. 

Saidi intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise, such as sugar and cooking oil, for resale. Inadequate capital to meet the increasing demand is his great challenge while his dream is to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as sugar and cooking oil, for resale.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha, de 38 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente con Bernardo quien se dedica al comercio, fruto de esa unión tienen 3 hijos: Neiser de 9, Gelber de 7 y Rusber de 7 años de edad. Juntos habitan su propia casa, la cual compró con mucho esfuerzo.
La actividad que tiene Bertha es la venta de abarrotes para esto cuenta con una bodega que está instalada en su propia casa. Donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, logrando así hacerse conocida y  ganándose su preferencia.
Lleva más de 6 meses dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja ocasionalmente y sus hijos, quienes atienden cuando ella está fuera de casa.
Considera a su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular demanda que tiene desde que se inició en su negocio
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y se siente ocupada, además de poder estar en casa para cuidar y atender  sus hijos menores. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio y ampliarlo vendiendo bebidas gaseosas y ropas. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues le gusta el trabajo que vienen realizando apoyando a las personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de mercaderías  como abarrotes de primera necesidad para surtir su bodega, así también bebidas gasificadas. Buscará precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen, de esa manera espera tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Bertha, age 38, is a hardworking and determined woman with a strong desire to get ahead.  She lives with her partner, Bernardo, who works in business.  They have three children:  Neiser, age 9, Gelber, age 7, and Rusber, age 7.  They live together in their own home, which they bought with much effort.

Bertha runs her own small grocery store, which is located in her home.  She waits on her customers – who are mostly neighbors – with a lot of kindness, in order to make herself well-known and gain her customers’ loyalty.

She has been working at this business for six months with the occasional help of her partner and the help of her children, who mind the store when she is out of the house.

She considers her business a success because of the profits it has generated and the regular demand she has experienced since she started.

She likes her business because it provides her with income and she feels busy.  She also likes that it allows her to be in the house to look after her young children.  She therefore plans to continue growing her business and broaden it by selling carbonated soft drinks and clothing.  This will be her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have financial support, since she will then feel secure to move ahead with her business.  She also says that she feels good about her communal bank because she likes the work it has been doing to support people.

Bertha will invest the requested total of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) in the purchase of merchandise such as grocery essentials to supply her store, as well as carbonated soft drinks.  She will look for affordable prices for her bulk purchases in order to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy carbonated soft drinks.

loans.name: Cesar Antonio

texts.es:
El socios se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el brinda servicio turistico lleva a turistas a diferentes lugares como valle sagrado de los incas como pisaq,ueubamba entre otros lugares,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio esta contento con el credito y se ocmpromete a pagar las cuotas de su prestamo.
texts.en: He continues in the transportation business.  He takes tourists to various places like the Sacred Valley of the Incas, Pisaq and Ueubamba, among other places. He works from 8am until 5pm and has been in this business for 8 years and does very well.  His dream is to buy a new car.  He’s requesting the loan to buy tires for his car.  He’s happy with the loan and commits to make his loan payments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: Moises es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El señor Moises  continúa dedicándose a la construcción civil como maestro de obras. Moises en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar herramientas que le faciliten el desarrollo de su trabajo. Moises está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse en su actividad económica, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Moises continues being a member of the “Qorichuspas” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.  He also continues working in civil construction as a master construction worker.  On this occasion, he’s asking for a loan to buy tools he heeds for work.  Moises is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for him to continue in this economic activity that is his main source of income to support his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y comidas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar en el restaurant como pollo,carne y verduras.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
The group member continues to devote herself to her restaurant business. She prepares breakfast, lunch and meals, working from 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.  She has had this business for seven years and it is doing well. Her dream is to expand her restaurant business, and she has requested a loan to buy food items to be used for cooking in the restaurant, such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

The group member appreciates and is thankful for the loan, and is committed to making the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy food items to be used for cooking in the restaurant, such as chicken, meat and vegetables

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth de 23 años es soltera y posee un gran motivo de vida, su hija Sayuri de 3 añitos. Ella tiene deseo de superación que espera cumplir algún día. Desde hace 3 años se inició en la venta de pollos al por menor en el mercado de su localidad gracias al puesto que su madre le cedió. 
Comenta que optó por esta actividad por considerarlo algo fácil a manera de iniciarse como comerciante y porque es uno de los productos que la población de su localidad más consume. Es así que desde muy tempando por la madrugada se dirige a los centros de acopio y selección de pollos. Para continuar trabajando, desea contar con capital de respaldo para la compra de más pollos y así mantener su negocio bien abastecido frente a la constante variación de precios.
Uno de sus sueños a un futuro es iniciar estudios superiores como secretaria ya que sus deseos de superación apuntan a hallar una mejor calidad de vida para su pequeña. Este es su tercer crédito, considera que cada crédito otorgado es una gran herramienta para llevar el negocio por buen camino y a futuro vivir de él. Con respecto a sus compañeros de su banco comunal se muestra muy a gusto por como el grupo ha ido creciendo con el paso de tiempo e indica es señal de que las cosas van muy bien.
Los 3,000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de pollos, para tener abastecido su negocio.
texts.en:
Ruth is a 23-year-old single woman who has a great reason for living: her 3-year-old daughter Sayuri. She has a desire to excel which she hopes to fulfill some day. Three years ago she began selling chicken at a local retail market, thanks to the stall her mother gave to her. 

She explains that she chose this activity because it was an easy way to get started as a merchant, and because chicken is one of the products that the local population consumes the most. Very early in the morning, she goes to the chicken supply and selection centers. In order to continue doing her work, she would like to have backup capital to buy more chicken, keeping her business well supplied to deal with the constant fluctuation in prices.

One of Ruth's dreams for the future is to pursue higher education and become a secretary, since her desire to excel means improving her daughter’s quality of life. This is her third loan; each one has been a great tool to get her business on the right tracks so that she can make a living from it in the future. As to her colleagues from the communal bank, she is pleased that the group is growing with time; it means that things are going very well. She will invest the 3,000  nuevos soles in buying chickens, so that her business is supplied.

loans.use: To buy more chicken.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa, 45, is a widow with five children who lives in the Sinkor community. Theresa has been working very hard for the past fifteen years, managing her business and taking care of the expenses of the family. Her children are between the ages of 16 and 33. Three are college students and live outside the home; the other two live with her at home and are in school. Theresa sells coal by retail in her community. She sells thirteen hours a day and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. She makes a profit when she sells because she is the only one that sells coal in that part of her community. Theresa is very grateful to the lenders for their support of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal bags to sell by retail. Her future plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more coal bags to sell by retail

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 48 years old and a motorcycle operator in Shanzu, Mombasa. He is married and supports a family of five. He has been in this business for the last three years and has been doing great. 

He will use the requested loan to repair his grounded motorcycles and open a new business for the wife. He will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and construct some rental shops. 

This is his fourth loan after repaying the previous ones successfully. He hopes to uplift his economic status.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts and to repair his motorcycles.

loans.name: Hermanita

texts.en:
Hermanita is a 59-year-old farmer from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in the rice farming business together with her husband for several years now. This is the source of their income.

Hermanita is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. With this, they will be able to grow and produce a good harvest from the farm.

Hermanita dreams of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”, con la crianza de animales menores (cuyes, gallinas, cerdos y patos) y con la venta de verduras (culantro, perejil, orégano y otros). Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar alimento (pasto, forraje, concentrados y vitaminas) para sus animales. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues as a member of the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank and raising small farm animals (guinea pigs, chickens, pigs and ducks) and selling vegetables (coriander, parsley, oregano and others.  She’s been doing this for several years now and does very well.  She’s asking for a loan to buy feed (grass, forage, concentrate and vitamins) for her animals.  She’s a responsible, kind person who supports her family and who is happy about the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Angelica Susana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y aceite,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y el va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y fideos.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de sus cuota.
texts.en: She continues with her grocery store business selling basic staple items like rice, sugar, milk and oil from 8am until 7pm; she’s been in business 8 years and does very well.  She wants to get ahead by means of this business and her dream is to enlarge the grocery store.  She requests a loan to buy rice, milk, sugar and noodles.  She’s happy with the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Margarita Cortona

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia trabaja 5 años y le va muy bien,la socia por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es que sus hijos sean profesionales.La socia solicita el credito para pagar los estudios de sus hijos.

Ella se ha comprometido a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en: She continues working as a teacher from 8am until 1pm; she’s been working for five years and does very well.  She’s able to support her children by means of this work.  Her dream is that her children become professionals and is requesting this loan to pay for their schooling.  She has committed to make all her necessary payments on time.

loans.use: to pay her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es La socia que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Elsa continúa dedicándose a la agricultura en el cultivo de maíz y paralelamente lleva su negocio de restaurante. Elsa en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar insumos y una parrilla para su restaurante, la cual le permitirá ofrecer barbacoas a sus clientes. Elsa está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse y expandirse en su nueva actividad económica, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en: Elsa’s a member of the “Qorichuspas” communal bank in Cusco, Peru.  She continues working in agriculture growing corn and also running her restaurant at the same time.  On this occasion she’s requesting her loan to buy supplies and a grill for her restaurant that will make it possible for her to offer barbeque to her customers.  She’s very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to develop and expand in this new economic activity which is her family’s main source of economic support.

loans.use: to buy a grill and supplies for her restaurant.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es:
Simón, es casado y tiene un hijo vive en una casa alquilada ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de adobe, el piso de tierra y las paredes semi planchadas con estuco y tumbado de contención, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.

Simón estudió solo hasta el bachillerato y actualmente trabaja como chofer en el área del transporte publico sindicalizado por más de ocho horas al día y con una antigüedad de 3 años, su esposa dio a luz un bebé hace 5 meses y no trabaja por el momento; de esta forma Simón  cubre los gastos de alimentación, vestimenta y gastos médicos de su familia ya que no cuentan con seguro medico.

El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento general de su movilidad ya que es su única fuente de ingresos; los gastos de mantenimiento y mano de obra son muy elevados es por eso que requieren este servicio.

El sueño de Simón, es vivir en casa anticrético para mejorar su calidad de vida y dar más comodidad a su familia.
Es la primera vez que el cliente solicita crédito con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Simón is married and has a son; he lives in a one-bedroom, rented house with adobe walls and dirt floor; the walls are semi-plastered with stucco and are wire-mesh reinforced.  The house is located in the city of La Paz’s Pasankeri zone.

Simón studied up to high-school and currently works as a driver providing syndicated public transportation services for more than 8 hours daily; he has three years’ experience.   His wife had a baby five months ago and isn’t working for now.  Simón therefore covers all food, clothing and medical expenses for his family since they have no medical insurance.

He needs the loan to service his vehicle which is his only source of income.  Service and labor costs are quite high which is why he needs this service.  Simón’s dream is to live in a house in the ‘anticrético’ [transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from you in exchange for housing, which must be paid back to you at the end of your contract. If your loan is not repaid, the property owner could lose the property to you] modality to improve his quality of life and provide more comfort for his family.  This is his first loan request to IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to pay maintenance costs for his transportation vehicle

loans.name: Narmeen

texts.en:
Narmeen is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Narmeen is a 29-year-old young married woman. She is the mother of three sons and one daughter. Her husband is employed and gets a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the necessary needs for the family.
