texts.en: Eustus is 32 years old, married, and has three children. He runs a bicycle transport business to earn a living. He has been in business for five years and is very hard-working. Faulu Kenya has helped him save his money and manage his business properly. Someday he hopes to own a taxi and a motorbike. He requires a loan of 53,812 KES to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
La señora Yanina tiene un taller de imprenta su nivel de educación en secundaria, vive en casa de sus padres con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.

La  señora Yanina trabaja en su imprenta mayormente realizando invitaciones, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de materia prima como ser  papel tinta y placas.

El sueño de Yanina es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.

Es la segunda vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Yanina operates a printing shop. She has a high school education. Yanina lives at her parents’ house, which has fine finishes and wooden plank floors. The house is located in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz.

Yanina works at her print shop making mostly invitations. This enables her to generate income to cover expenses such as food, electricity, and water. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies such as paper, ink, and printing plates. Yanina’s dream is to have a house of her own and to see her children finish their studies.

This is the second time she has worked with IMPRO, but the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, and printing plates.

loans.name: Dolores De La Concepción

texts.es:
La Joven Dolores de la Concepción,  posee un negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas, jugos y frutas   ubicado en  la ciudad de León, desde hace seis  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad  que están bajo su responsabilidad.

Sale de su casa de habitación a las 5:00 am  abre su negocio a las 6:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 4:00 pm este trabajo  lo realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario,  Su negocio lo inicio de forma ambulante.

El  crédito que esta solicitando a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar variedad de gaseosas, jugos, frutas y caramelos para ofertarles a toda su clientela, y así obtener   mayores ingresos y le permita mejorar su calidad de vida tanto de ella como la de sus tres hijos. 

Los sueños de Dolores es la preparación de sus tres pequeños hijos y lograr a tener su propia vivienda  para darle una mejor comodidad.
texts.en:
Dolores de la Concepción is a young woman who has a business in the city of León selling water, sodas, juices, and fruits. Her business has been in operation for six years and allows her to support her family. Dolores is a single mother with three young children for whom she is responsible.

She leaves her home at 5:00 A.M. so that she can open her business at 6:00 A.M. Dolores finishes at 4:00 P.M. and works from Monday to Saturday on the same schedule. She started her business as a traveling vendor.

The loan she is requesting from CEPRODEL will be used to buy a variety of sodas, juices, fruits, and caramels that she can offer to her customers. As a result, she will be able to generate more income and improve the quality of life for herself and her three children. Dolores dreams of preparing her three young children and having a house of her own so that they will be more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, fruits, and caramels.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lenis

texts.es:
La Joven Lenis es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposo  y sus  2 hijos en una comunidad al  sur de Honduras.
Lenis tiene un negocio de pulpería. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de refrescos, carne, maíz, leche, frijoles, azúcar, pan, agua, papel higiénico, churros  etc. Con  el préstamo ella espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes para cubrir los pedidos que a diario recibe de sus ellos.
Lenis con los ingresos obtenidos desea mejorar su situación económica y la de su  familia. En el futuro ella espera que su negocio sea un mercadito, gracias a la inversión hecha en el mismo.
Lenis sueña con ver a sus hijos graduados y convertirlos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre del  2012
texts.en:
Lenis is a very responsible, honest, and hardworking young person.  She lives with her husband and two children in a community in the south of Honduras.  Lenis has a grocery store business.

She needs the loan to buy soda, meat, corn, milk, beans, sugar, bread, water, toilet paper, chips, etc.  With the loan she hopes to have more merchandise to sell to her customers and cover their daily requests.  She wants to improve her family's financial situation with the income.

In the future she hopes her business will be a small market, thanks to her investment.  Lenis dreams of seeing her children graduate and become good people with better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras, November 2012

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Braulio

texts.es: El Sr. Braulio  tiene 25 años tiene un hijito de la edad de 5 años,  se dedica  a la construcción y remodelación de viviendas, el es albañil contratista, el vive en la localidad de Joronchito,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Braulio va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida a sus obras ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Braulio va a utilizar los beneficios en comprar Herramientas para su trabajo ya que las que tiene se le están gastando y necesita renovar para realizar un mejor trabajo, el Sr. Braulio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Braulio, 25, has a young son who is five years old. He works building and remodeling homes as a contract builder. He lives in the city of Joronchito. This loan is his first from the institution. Braulio will use this loan to buy a motorcycle, because this will allow him to do his work more efficiently. He has contracts to fulfill, and this will allow him to get to his sites quickly, since he has to move over great distances. 

He is applying for this loan in order to keep improving at his job. Braulio is going to use the profits to buy tools for his job, since the ones he has are worn out and he needs to update in order to do a better job. Braulio is a very hard-working person. He is grateful for the opportunity that the loan gives him, because this is his only activity that allows him to sustain himself.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marizabel

texts.es:
La Señora Marizabel  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, madre soltera tiene una hija y vive en una comunidad de Choluteca al sur de    Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos. 
Doña Marizabel el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, calzonetas, faldas, suéteres, lociones, desinfectantes y cremas etc. Con el préstamo ella espera que sus ventas aumenten para tener más productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y poder cubrir los pedidos  que le solicitan.
Doña Marizabel con el préstamo espera mejorar un poco su situación  económica y la de su familia. En unos años ella espera que su negocio crezca y se convierta en el más grande y reconocido de su  colonia  y a su vez que su familia viva de una manera digna.



Choluteca, Honduras – Noviembre  2012
texts.en:
Marizabel is a very responsible, honest, and hard-working person. She is a single mother with one daughter and she lives in an area of Choluteca in the south of Honduras. Her business is the sale of new clothing and cosmetics. Marizabel needs the loan to buy pants, blouses, shirts, undergarments, skirts, sweaters, lotions, disinfectants, creams, etc. With the loan, she hopes that her sales will increase in order to have more products to offer to her customers and cover the orders they place with her.

With the loan, she hopes to improve her economic situation and that of her family. In a few years, she hopes that her business grows and becomes the biggest and most widely recognized in her area. She also hopes that her family will live decently.

Choluteca, Honduras – November 2012

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, undergarments, skirts, sweaters, lotions, disinfectants, and creams for her business.

loans.name: Abigumira

texts.en:
Abigumira is 41 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, in the Mubende region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, three of them currently in school. For the past six years, Abigumira has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells various items, such as sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Abigumira has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more essential commodities, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt, to resell. This will help Abigumira to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Abigumira hopes that in the future he will be able to own a bigger and well-stocked shop. 

Abigumira is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abigumira, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more basic items, like soap, sugar, and cooking oil, to offer for sale

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has two children, both of them currently attending school. She is not looking after any other member of the family.

She has been sewing clothes, for sale at retail, for ten years. She works in the shop seven days a week. She has no other source of income. Her business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,800,000 from MCDT-SACCO, to buy rolls of cloth and thread, for making clothing. She joined MCDT because of the timely loans.

Regina's dream is to accumulate profits that will enable her to build a home. She rents a house, where she does not have access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses are school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of cloth and thread, for making clothing.

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is 25 years old and lives in the town of Fortportal in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Madina has been working hard to manage her retail shop in which sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 2000000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt for resale and will help Madina to generate greater profits and pay for family medical expenses and food. Madina hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another retail shop in town. 

Madina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Madina, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Eduarda Lucrecia

texts.es:
La Señora Eduarda Lucrecia, trabaja en un centro Educativo  de la Ciudad de León desempeñándose como Conserje desde hace  tres años, es madre de cinco hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo.

Doña Eduarda sale se su casa a las 6:00 am inicia sus  labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 2:30 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes. 

Eduarda  es primer  crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel y lo utilizara para cubrir gastos de graduación y pago de matrícula  del próximo año de su hijo,  los   sueños de ella son que su hijo logre a coronar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Sra. Eduarda Lucrecia has worked as a janitor for three years at a school in the city of León. She is the mother of five children, but only one is still under her care.

Doña Eduarda leaves her house at 6:00 A.M. so that she can begin her work at 7:00 A.M. She finishes her job by 2:30 P.M. and works the same schedule Monday through Friday.

Eduarda is requesting her first loan from CEPRODEL so that she can cover the graduation expenses and next year’s tuition for her child. Her dreams include seeing her son complete his professional degree.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition and graduation expenses.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: El Sra. Hilda tiene 24 años tiene tres hijos de 3, 5 y 8 años, ella   se dedica a la Agricultura sembrando variedad de vegetales como también papa, yuca y maíz en su parcela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Zanja Honda,  este préstamo es el su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  El Sra. Hilda va a utilizar  este préstamo para la siembra de maní  y lo que implica el preparado de la tierra, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es para obtener recursos  para la siembra y poder subsistir, El Sra. Hilda enfrenta retos en su negocio que son las inclemencias del clima que en muchas ocasiones arruinan los sembradíos,  y utilizara los beneficios Para mejorara la calidad de vida del cliente y de su familia ya que el corre con todos los gastos del hogar, es una persona  responsable y trabajadora se siente agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Hilda, 24, has three children, ages 3, 5, and 8. She works in agriculture, planting a variety of vegetables, as well as potatoes, yucca, and corn on her parcel of land in the community of Zanja Honda. This loan is her first from the institution. Hilda is going to use the loan to plant peanuts and prepare the soil. Her reason for applying for this loan is to be able to get resources for the planting and to be able to survive. Hilda confronts challenges in her business, like inclement weather that ruins the the planted fields on many occasions. She will use the profits to improve her quality of life and that of her family, since she is in charge of all household expenses. She is a responsible and hard-working person and she is grateful to the institution for the help it has given her.

loans.use: to plant peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as cement, bricks and iron.

loans.name: Arnold Renzo

texts.es: Arnold es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El señor Arnold es un joven soltero que trabaja en una empresa de servicio de emergencias médicas como personal administrativo y paralelamente también se dedica al servicio de transporte turístico en el cual es accionista en una sociedad. Arnold en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para realizar mantenimiento a una unidad de transporte turístico y comprará repuestos y accesorios automotrices. Arnold está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad económica.
texts.en:
Arnold is a member of the Communal Bank “Qorichuspas” which is located in the city of Cusco, Peru. He is a single young man who works for a emergency medical service company as a staff administrator. At the same time, he is a partner in a transportation business in the tourism sector.

Arnold is requesting a loan so that he can maintain a tour vehicle. He will buy spare parts and automotive accessories. Arnold is very grateful to Kiva for allowing him to maintain and develop his business activity.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories for his tour vehicle.

loans.name: Nidia Del Rosario

texts.es:
Nidia es originaria de la ciudad de Estelí, su edad es 22 años su estado civil unión estable y tiene un hijo a su cargo en edad escolar.

Se dedica a la actividad comercial por más de cuatro años  su principal rubro es la elaboración de pan el cual es distribuido por su esposo y demás personal que trabajan como vendedores en los diferentes municipios de Estelí, con su negocio está generando fuente de empleo a más de cinco personas permanente.

Nidia es una mujer emprendedora, que ha sabido administrar su negocio y lograr que este sea sostenible y rentable gracia al trabajo en equipo con su pareja de vida y a la unión familiar.

Pan que se elabora en esta panadería es degustado y muy demandado por la población Estiliana,  por su calidad, sabor y la higiene que lo caracteriza.

la joven solicita a ceprodel un crédito través de Kiva ya que lo va destinar para compra de materia prima tales harina, azúcar, manteca entre otros.
texts.en:
Nidia is originally from the city of Estelí. She is 22 years old, married, and has one child. 

She has been doing business for more than four years, and her main focus is the production of bread, which is distributed by her husband and other salesman in the different municipalities of Estelí. Her business creates stable employment for more than five people. 

Nidia is an entrepreneur who has learned to administer her business well and has managed to make it sustainable and profitable. This was made possible thanks to her teamwork with her husband and family. 

The bread that is produced in her bakery is in high demand by the people of Estilia, for its quality, its flavor and its hygienic production. 

She is requesting a loan to be able to purchase supplies such as flour, sugar and butter, amongst others.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and butter.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter Sosa Natural del distrito de Santa Rosa, Región Ayacucho es un padre y esposo muy abnegado, su pequeña Soeeli de 9 años es su principal fuente de motivación junto a Elizabeth con quien forma un lindo hogar. Temporalmente reside en una vivienda construida a base de adobe en calidad de alquiler. Durante muchos años fue testigo del crecimiento económico de sus padres a través de la venta de prendas de vestir y calzados, es por ello que motivado por la experiencia que ganó desde niño decidió desde hace 5 años liderar junto a Elizabeth su propio negocio siguiente el rubro de sus padres.
Se siente muy a gusto por como le ha ido últimamente puesto que gracias al firme apoyo de Elizabet inician desde muy temprano su labor, adicionalmente debe viajar de vez en cuando a la capital para la compra de mercadería al por mayor consistente en zapatillas para hombre y jeans de todo tipo, puesto que actualmente la demanda de los mismos presenta una buena acogida en su negocio preferentemente en temporadas claves.
Con motivo de sacarle un provecho adecuado a la temporada de fin de año desea contar con mercadería adicional consistente en ropa de temporada y prendas exclusivas para niños y lograr obtener buenas ganancias como todo buen comerciante.
Tiene sus objetivos a largo plazo en hacer que su negocio sufra una expansión considerable logrando convertirlo en una gran galería de prendas de vestir con una diversidad de prendas para todas las edades, pero este sueño solo será posible con el paso de los años y la suma de esfuerzo y trabajo. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, se siente muy agradecido con la confianza brindada la cual piensa retribuir con un buen comportamiento en el pago puntual de su préstamo. Con respecto a su banco comunal se siente muy a gusto ser integrante de este grupo puesto que los integrantes son personas que el conoce desde muy niño.
Con los 500 nuevos soles complementara su capital destinado a la compra de prendas de vestir para la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Walter Sosa is from Santa Rosa District in Ayacucho region. He is a very selfless father and husband. His little nine-year-old Soeeli is his main source of motivation, along with Elizabeth, with whom he has created a beautiful home. They are temporarily living in a house built of adobe, which they rent. 

For many years he witnessed the economic progress his parents made through the sale of articles of clothing and footwear. This is why, motivated by the experience he gained since childhood, he and Elizabeth decided five years ago to start their own business, in the same retail sector as his parents.

He feels very happy for how it is gone lately, since thanks to Elizabeth's steadfast support, they start their work very early. In addition, he must travel to the capital from time to time to buy merchandise at wholesale, such as men's shoes and jeans of all kinds. Currently there is demand for these products and they are well received in his store, especially at important sales seasons.

In order to take proper advantage of the year-end season, he wishes to have additional merchandise consisting of seasonal clothing and children's clothing. As any good businessperson does, he wants to succeed in obtaining good profits.

His long-term objectives are to have his business expand considerably, and succeed in converting it into a large clothing store with a variety of articles for all ages. But this dream will only be possible over a period of years, and with a great amount of work and effort.

This is his first loan with MFP, and he feels very grateful for the trust granted him, which he intends to repay by being conscientious in making his loan payments on time.  

With respect to his communal bank, he feels very happy to be a member of this group, since all the members are people he has known since he was very young.

With the 500 nuevos soles, he will add to his working capital, which is earmarked for the purchase of articles of clothing for the year-end season.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es: La Sra. Graciela tiene 28 años, tiene un hijo de 5 años,  se dedica a la venta de chocolates   en la zona de Adelita, Este préstamo es la  Segunda secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra.  Graciela va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de chocolates por caja, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es por la falta de capital, Graciela enfrenta retos en su negocio ya por estas fechas de fin de año los  precios han subido, por este motivo solicita el crédito ya que quiere abastecerse de cajas de chocolates ya que esta época también i incrementa sus ventas y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando productos para su negocio la Sra. Graciela es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Graciela is 28 years old and has a five-year-old son. She sells chocolates in the District of Adelita. This is her second loan with Emprender. She will use this loan to invest in the purchase of chocolates by the box. Her reason for requesting this loan is because she lacks capital.

Graciela faces challenges in her business. Prices have gone up as the year comes to an end. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can stock up on boxes of chocolates for the upcoming season. Her sales increase during this time, so she will utilize the benefits of this loan to buy products for her business.

Sra. Graciela is an extremely hardworking individual. She is pleased and grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy boxes of chocolates.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Edith;la socia continua con su negocio de elaboracion de tamales,la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende los tamales en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco y por las tardes vende en la puerta de una institucion privada,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo  de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como  manteca ,maiz y para algunos gastos personales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Edith belongs to the communal bank "Richary Runa."  This bank is located in the Cusco district, which is in the province and department of Cusco.

Edith is continuing with her business making tamales.  She has spent years in this business, and it is going very well thanks to the daily effort she puts into her work.  She sells tamales in one of Cusco's markets, and in the afternoons she sells at the entrance of a private institution.  Edith is a responsible and hardworking person, and this activity enables her to provide for her family. 

Edith is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her business, such as butter and corn, and to pay for some personal expenses.

Edith is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business, such as butter and corn, and to pay for some personal expenses

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Con 33 años de edad Edgar es un hombre soltero muy responsable y trabajador, aún no se inicia en su vida conyugal debido a que planea consolidarse como una persona de buenos recursos económicos a base de su trabajo y esfuerzo. Es propietario de una vivienda construida a base de adobe que le fue cedido por sus padres.
Desde muy joven aprendió las distintas técnicas que se debe emplear para obtener una buena producción de cacao gracias a que fue siempre partícipe de las actividades ancestrales de sus padres en el campo. Generalmente para culminar las tareas rutinarias de sus parcelas convoca a jornaleros quienes al ser ex compañeros suyos se sienten a gusto con el trabajo que desempeñan logrando posteriormente gracias al trabajo empleado en la campaña buenas mazorcas que son posteriormente comercializados a los acopiadores de su zona. No obstante comenta que sus productos sufrieron una disminución en el pago del precio final perjudicándolo notablemente.
Desea contar con capital suficiente que le permita iniciar la campaña productiva con todas las de ganar, para ello debe contar con la mano de obra firme de los jornaleros del lugar para el deshierbo y adquirir sacos de abono orgánico como el guano de ave que es muy indispensable para el tipo de suelo que posee en su parcela.
Tiene la motivación de a futuro aperturar un negocio propio en la ciudad para así lograr consolidarse como un gran comerciante y aportar de manera considerable a la economía de su familia cuyos lideres aun son sus padres. Este es su primer crédito, desde su ingreso al banco comunal se siente agradecido y a la vez comprometido con la cultura de cumplimiento que poseen sus compañeros de su banco comunal.
Los 1,000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la contrata de jornaleros para el deshierbo y tareas adicionales así como en la compra de abono orgánico guano de ave muy necesarios para su tipo de terreno que poseen sus parcelas.
texts.en:
Edgar, 33, is a very responsible and hardworking single man.  He still hasn't gotten married because he plans to grow stronger and be a person with good economic resources on the basis of his work and effort.  He owns an adobe house given to him by his parents.

He learned the various techniques for getting a good cacao crop from a very young age, thanks to always participating in the ancestral work of his parents in the fields.  Generally, to finish the routine tasks on his land he hires day laborers who are comfortable with the work, being his former co-workers.  Later, after the work of the season, he manages to get good berries that he sells to the distributors in his area.  Nevertheless, he comments that his crops suffered a drop in payment in the final price, which was very detrimental to him.

He wants to have enough capital so he can start the growing season with everything he has to gain.  For this he needs labor from area day laborers to weed and he needs to acquire organic fertilizer, such as bird guano, which is indispensable for the type of soil he has on his land.

He's motivated to open his own business in the city in the future to grow stronger as a merchant and to contribute considerably to the finances of his family, whose heads are still his parents.

This is his first loan.  Ever since he joined the communal bank he has been grateful, as well as committed to the culture of performance of his colleagues in the communal bank.

He'll use the 1,000 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy organic bird guano and to hire day laborers for weeding and other tasks necessary for the type of terrain on his land.

loans.use: to hire labor and to buy organic fertililzer

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia
C 800.000
Grecia


Lucia tiene 44 años de edad, de profesión educadora, y ante un problema de sobrepeso decide empezar a trabajar en mejorar su salud y después de 5 años la de otras personas de las comunidades de Poás y Grecia. Forma su empresa SEV (Servicios de Salud, Estética y Vida) trabajando en varias comunidades de estos 2 cantones con 80 mujeres y en crecimiento, apoyándolas con ejercicio, motivación y otros aspectos que les permita mejorar su calidad de vida y las de sus familias. Se presenta como una mujer trabajadora, con deseos de apoyar  a otras mujeres a mejorar su calidad de vida por medio del ejercicio y la motivación. Vive actualmente con sus 2 hijas en la zona de Grecia en la Provincia de Alajuela.

Inició por auto superación y con ayuda de su trabajo como educadora, el cual no ejerce, mejorando su salud y su hija mayor. Por medio de la televisión se entera de los servicios de Fundación Mujer, ayudándole, por medio de 2 préstamos anteriores a  conseguir equipo y un vehículo para mejorar la atención de sus clientas. Demuestra una excelente conducta de pago y crecimiento de su microempresa. Esta abarcando otros grupos en la zona de Grecia por lo que requiere de inversión en uniformes y equipo audiovisual para las clases que realiza.

Atiende grupos de mujeres de Lunes a Viernes dando charlas y ejercicios en los barrios y comunidades de Poás y Grecia, su hijas la apoyan en la actividad, que es la fuente principal de ingresos del hogar. Ha logrado crecer con inversión, cuenta con equipo para sus clases y un vehículo para desplazarse  por las comunidades. Ha logrado realizar eventos anuales con el apoyo de las Municipalidades y el Ministerio de Salud. Buena proyección y crecimiento.
texts.en:
Lucia is 44 years old and an educator by profession. She previously suffered from a weight problem before starting to improve her health. Five years later, she began working with other people in the communities of Poás and Grecia. Lucia started a health, beauty, and wellness company and began working in different communities in the two cantons mentioned before. Her clientele includes 80 women and is growing. She provides support through exercise, motivation, and other aspects that focus on improving her clients’ quality of life and that of their families. Lucia presents herself as a hardworking woman. She wants to support other women as they improve their quality of life through exercise and motivation. Lucia currently lives with her two daughters in the District of Grecia in Alajuela Province.

Lucia started down the road of self-improvement through her work as an educator. Even though she did not exercise, she was able to improve her own health and that of her oldest daughter. By watching television, Lucia learned about the services offered by Fundación Mujer. With her two previous loans, Lucia was able to secure equipment and a vehicle so that she could provide better service to her clients. She has demonstrated an excellent payment history and growth as a micro-entrepreneur. In order to serve other groups in the District of Grecia, Lucia plans to invest in uniforms and audiovisual equipment for the classes that she will conduct.

Lucia meets with groups of women Monday through Friday. She conducts seminars and exercise sessions in the neighborhoods and communities of Poás and Grecia. Her daughters help with the business since it is the main source of household income. Lucia wants to grow with this investment now that she has equipment for her classes and a vehicle for traveling to the various communities. She has also been able to conduct annual events with the support of the local municipalities and the Ministry of Health. Her business shows potential for good growth projection.

loans.use: to buy uniforms and audiovisual equipment for her wellness company.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” RICHARY RUNA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Angélica;la socia continua con su negocio de venta de lechon esto es un plato hecho a base de carne de chancho,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio como carne de chancho y para algunos gastos personales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Richary Runa Communal Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, belonging to Cuzco province in Cuzco department.

This member is Sra. Angélica. She continues with her business selling “lechón,”  which is a dish made with pork. She has had this business for several years and has been doing well thanks to the effort she puts into her work every day. Angélica sells in one of the markets in the city of Cuzco. This is the way she has been able to help her family get ahead.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies for her business, such as pork, and to meet some personal expenses. She is happy about the loan and promises to make all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her business such as pork and to meet some personal expenses.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en:
Leonia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with six children, two of whom currently attend school. She is also looking after her parents. For seven years, Leonia has been operating a pub and selling crates of beer and soda, at retail, from home. She works seven days a week. She has no other source of income.

Leonia has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy crates of beer and soda and jerrycans (containers capable of holding several gallons of liquid) of local gin for resale. Her challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her dream is to accumulate profits to help her put up rental houses and to own a fully stocked pub. 

Leonia joined MCDT because of the timely loans. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy crates of beer and soda and jerrycans local gin for resale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past ten years, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop in which she sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 2000000 UGX (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt for resale and will help Margret to generate greater profits and pay for family medical expenses and food. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to own a farm of cows. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Margret, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt for resale.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher, a 50-year-old man, is a businessman who owns a cafeteria. He has been in the business for five years. He is married with three children.  Since Christopher joined Faulu Kenya, he has increased his profits and increased the number of his customers. 

Christopher wishes to expand his business. He requires a loan of 53,156 KES to buy meat, a freezer, and charcoal.

loans.use: to buy meat, a freezer, and charcoal for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina de 58 años radica en la comunidad e San Agustín desde muy niña, ha logrado encontrar a la persona ideal en su vida en su esposo Alfredo de 51 años, su felicidad se complementa con sus hijas Silvia de 27 años y Vilma de 22 años quienes hasta hoy desempeñan estudios superiores con el apoyo de su madre. Posee una vivienda construida a base de madera.
Se desempeña en el rubro agropecuario en unas parcelas que adquirió desde muy joven en donde se dedica netamente al mantenimiento de café. Lleva ya casi 30 años en el rubro y siembre tuvo el apoyo de su esposo para las diversas actividades contacto en ocasiones con la contrata de jornaleros para actividades mas complicadas y masivas.
Le agrada su trabajo en el campo debido a que es una labor muy tranquila y a su vez es posible degustar los granos de café que produce para sentir que el trabajo tan abnegado que realiza será valorado por los usuarios finales en otros lugares del mundo. No obstante la época de lluvia es un tiempo complicado en donde es necesario hacer sacrificio, pero gracias al trabajo aplicado puede finalmente obtener buenas ganancias con la venta de los granos secos a los acopiadores quienes cotizan sus producto a un precio aceptable.
Antes del inicio de la temporada lluviosa, en la zona desea contar con capital de trabajo para la adquisición de plantas y su posterior plantado por parte de los jornaleros de la zona quienes también realizarán el respectivo deshierbo y limpieza de sus parcelas.
A futuro planea con el fruto de su trabajo y esfuerzo concretar la construcción de su vivienda con material noble. Tiene el orgullo de poseer 17 créditos con MFP, denota que es el símbolo de su capacidad cumplidora y buena inversión. Se siente muy a gusto por el ambiente armónico que muestran sus compañeros de su banco comunal que hacen de cada reunión un momento de dialogo y motivación para el agrado de todos.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles realizará la compra de plantas de café para su posterior sembrado y la contrata de jornaleros para el deshierbo y limpieza de sus parcelas previo a la campaña y temporada de lluvia.
texts.en:
Agustina is 58 years old and has resided in the community of San Agustín since she was very young. In her husband Alfredo, 51, she has managed to find the ideal companion. Their happiness is complemented by their daughters: Sylvia, 27 and Vilma, 22, who with their mother's support are pursuing post-secondary studies. She owns a home constructed from wood. 

She farms a few parcels of land that she acquired at a young age, where she devotes herself exclusively to looking after her coffee plantings. She has worked in this sector for 30 years, and has always had her husband's help for the various activities. On occasion, she hires day laborers for the more difficult and large-scale work.

She likes her farmwork due to the fact that it is very peaceful work, and at the same time, it is possible to sample the coffee beans that she produces, so that she can feel that the very selfless work she does will be valued by the final consumers in other parts of the world. In spite of the rainy season, it is a difficult time when it is necessary to make sacrifices. But thanks to the work she has done, she can finally get good earnings with the sale of the dried beans to the collection centers, who value her crop at a fair price.

Before the start of the rainy season in the area, she wants to have working capital to acquire coffee plants, and for having it planted by the day laborers in the area, who also will carry out the weeding and clearing of her parcels of land.  

In the future, with the fruits of her labor and effort, she plans to realize the building of a home with good quality materials. She is proud to have had 17 loans with MFP, and this is a reflection of her reliability and sound investments. She feels very comfortable because of the harmonious atmosphere created by her fellow communal bank members. This makes each meeting a time for dialogue and motivation that everyone enjoys.

With the 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase coffee plants for later planting, and hire day laborers for the weeding and clearing of her parcels, prior to the planting time and the rainy season.

loans.use: To buy coffee plants and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El joven Juan tiene 22 años, el es  soltero  se dedica al  servicio de internet y diseño grafico que se encuentran en la localidad  de Santa Rita,  este préstamo es el primera secuencia de su crédito dentro de la institución   El joven Juan va a usar este préstamo para compra de computadoras para  su negocio, la  razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de mas computadoras ya que su clientela está incrementando y el desea darles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, El joven Juan enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que existen varios cafés internet en la zona pero el les trata muy amablemente a sus clientes y por esta razón siempre van a su negocio y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando muebles para su cafe internet.
texts.en: Juan, 22, is single and he works providing Internet service and graphic design. He lives in the area of Santa Rita. This is his first loan from the institution. Juan is going to use this loan to buy computers for his business. He is applying for this loan because he needs more computers, since his customer-base is growing and he wants to provide them with better service. Juan confronts challenges in his business, like competition, because there are several internet cafes in the area. But he treats his customers very well and this is why they always go to his business. He is going to use the profits to continue buying furniture for his Internet cafe.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Amiel

texts.es: Aniel, de 22 años, vive con su esposa Jenifer y su hija Yadel, en la casa de su tía desde hace 2 años.  Hace 2 años conformó su familia, aún le falta un camino largo por recorrer, pero decidió consagrar su esfuerzo y aspiraciones a la agricultura y ganadería, donde siembra en terrenos agrícolas que le fueron heredados por sus padres. Pero la actividad que le resulta más rentable es la compra y venta de animales, en principal de ganado vacuno, pues el pueblo donde vive se encuentra en producción de leche y venta de carne. Tiene poco más de un año en este negocio de compra y venta de ganado, por lo que desea aumentar sus ganando y seguir progresando para comprar su casa propia. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues quiere quedar muy bien con su asociación, “Yanamarca unida”. Aniel, invertirá el dinero en la compra de un toro para engordarlo y venderlo.
texts.en:
Aniel, 22 years old, has been living with his wife, Jenifer, and their daughter, Yadel, in a house owned by his aunt for the past two years. Two years ago he started his family and still has a long road to travel, however he decided to devote his efforts and aspirations to farming and cattle raising. He cultivates land inherited from his parents, although at the moment he finds that buying and selling animals, principally cows, is more profitable. He lives in a village that produces milk and sells meat. He has had a cattle buying and selling business for a little over a year and he wants to expand his cattle holdings and continue progressing so that he can purchase his own home. 

This is Aniel’s third loan from MFP and he is grateful for the financial support they provide since he will be able to continue with his goal of improving his business. He promises to be punctual in his repayment of the loan because he wants to remain on good terms with his communal bank, Yanamarca Unida. Aniel will use the money to purchase a bull to fatten and sell.

loans.use: to purchase a bull.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
En el municipio de San Juan de Limay, comarca San Lorenzo vive don santos  con su esposa y 5 hijos al que tiene el deber de mantener y darles sus estudios, de profesión, agricultor en granos básicos y ganadero, en ganado de leche y engorde.

Don santos conocido como una persona honesta y emprendedora, tiene más de 28 años de experiencia y trabajar estos rubros, trabaja junto con su familia en su finca que es alta mente productiva y quiere sacarle un buen provecho explotándola en uno de los mejores rubros de la zona como es el ganado ,hoy en día  está solicitando un crédito, donde piensa Salir  beneficiado y así  comprar  6 novillos de engorde y repastarlos por un lapso de un año , luego venderlos ya que estos tendrán el peso necesario para la  venta en el matadero y de esta manera él obtener otros ingresos que le ayudará a mejorar mas su finca y el nivel económico de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos lives with his wife and five children in the town of San Juan de Limay in the San Lorenzo region.  He's responsible for supporting his children and providing for their education.  He works in agriculture, growing basic grains and raising cattle for milk and for fattening.

Santos is known as an honest and enterprising person.  He has more than 28 years of experience working in these areas.  He works with his family on his farm, which is highly productive.  He wants to profit from it in one of the region's best areas, which is livestock.

Now he's asking for a loan to buy six young bulls to graze and fatten for a year, then sell when they have the necessary weight for sale and butchering.  This way he'll have other income to help further improve his farm and his family's economic situation.

loans.use: to buy six young bulls to fatten

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Francisco Eduardo

texts.es:
Francisco Eduardo vive en un municipio de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona responsable con buenos valore morales, tiene una familia compuesta de cuatro hijos, dos de ellos son estudiante de primaria.

Don Francisco Eduardo labora como ayudante de fontanería, en una empresa del estado desde hace cinco años.

Solicita a CEPRODEL  un crédito y poder comprar materiales de construcción tales como bloque, arena, cemento para construir su vivienda de concreto y darle a su familia mejor condición de vida.

Agradece a CEPRODEL por la oportunidad  y la confianza que le den  con este financiamiento  otorgándole, porque atreves con estos créditos ha podido mejorar poco a poco su casita.
texts.en:
Francisco Eduardo lives in a municipality of Managua, Nicaragua.  He is a responsible person with good moral values, and has a family composed of four children; two of whom are students in primary school.  Don Francisco Eduardo has worked as a plumbing assistant at a company of the city for five years.

He asks CEPRODEL for a loan and to be able to buy construction materials like cinder blocks, sand, and cement in order to build his home out of concrete and give his family better living conditions.

He thanks CEPRODEL for the opportunity and the trust given to him with the loan they are granting him, because through these loans he has been able to improve his home little by little.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Oscar Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Oscar Antonio, de oficio zapatero, con edad de 43 años, acompañado, reside en el departamento de Masaya, es propietario de un pequeño taller de  zapatería desde hace ocho años, la cual consiste en la   elaboración de calzado para damas y caballeros, sus ventas las realiza en el mercado oriental de la cuidad de Managua, al cual  viaja para comercializarla,  posee clientes en el mercado municipal de Masaya y cuenta con una  clienta  que viaja al hermano país de Honduras donde le comercializa las Sandalias. 

Su núcleo familiar lo componen tres persona, su esposa y su hijo en edad escolar,  en el negocio trabajan el y su esposa quien lo ha apoyado para salir adelante.

 solicita un  financiamiento para la compra de  materia prima como: vaqueta, esponja, cajuela, remache, manila, argolla, hilo, pega amarilla y blanca, fibra, forro fino, evillas, laca, zener y tela guatemalteca.  Considera que este financiamiento le ayuda a incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Oscar Antonio is a shoemaker, 43 years old, married, and lives is the Department of Masaya.  For eight years he has been the owner of a small shoemaking shop, which consists of making footwear for women and men.  He makes his sales in the eastern market in the city of Managua, which he travels to in order to commercialize his work.  He has customers in the town market of Masaya and relies on a customer who travels to the neighboring country of Honduras where he sells the sandals.

His immediate family is made of three people; his wife and his school-aged son.  He works in his business with his wife who has supported him in order to get ahead.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy raw material like tanned cowhide, foam, PVC resin, rivets, cotton cord, rings, thread, white and yellow glue, fibers, fine lining, buckles, polish, paint thinner, and Guatemalan fabric.   He says that this loan helps him to increase his sales and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy tanned cowhide, foam, PVC resin, rivets, cotton cord, rings, thread, white and yellow glue, fibers, fine lining, buckles, polish, paint thinner, and Guatemalan fabric.

loans.name: Diógenes Efrel

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua vive Diógenes Efrel, es una persona que viene luchando para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia, trabaja actualmente para el estado como ayudante fontanero, es casado tiene dos persona a su cargo,  laboral desde hace once años.

Esta solicitando un crédito para comprar materiales de construcción tales como bloque, arena, cemento, para realizar una ampliación en su vivienda ya que tiene una pulpería y quiere a condicionarla, para darle mejor comodidad a su familia. 

"Con este segundo financiamiento me ayudaría mucho para el desarrollo y el futuro de mi familia, con esta segunda oportunidad que me darían".
texts.en:
Diógenes Efrel lives in the city of Managua Nicaragua, and is a person who fights on in order to give a better standard of living to his family.  He is working now for the city as an assistant plumber, is married and has two people who depend on him, and has worked for 11 years.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy construction materials such as cinder blocks, sand, and cement, in order to make an expansion on his home so that it has a general store, and he wants to adjust it in order to provide better comfort for his family.

"This second loan opportunity will greatly help me with the development and future of my family."

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Aracelis Del Socorro

texts.es:
El señora Aracelis es una señora que reside en el casco urbano de Condega desde hace mas de veinte años aproximadamente y esta felizmente casada y tiene dos hijos los que estudian actualmente.

Ella se desempeña como administradora en una empresa local de televisión por cable desde hace aproximadamente unos nueve años y su esposo labora como conductor en un canal de televisión local, cabe mencionar que ambos con sus ingresos mensuales  asumen los gastos familiares y  escolares de sus hijos y así lograr prepararlos como profesionales en un futuro.
solicita a ceprodel su segundo financiamiento y de ser aprobado este crédito ella podrá realizar las compras de algunos materiales de construcción tales como cemento y ladrillos y pagar la mano de obre de la mejora que le realizara a su casa de habitación, ya que sus ingresos mensuales no son suficiente como para poder realizar las mejorar con esfuerzo propio y en el momento preciso, por lo que ella se muestra agradecida por la atención que se le a brindado anteriormente en Ceprodel y confía en dicha institución. De esta manera ella piensa ir mejorando las condiciones física de su casa y darles un techo mas bonito y presentable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aracelis is a woman who has been living in the Condega city center for more than 20 years approximately and is happily married; she has two students who are currently in school.  She has been employed as a manager at a local cable television station for about nine years and her husband works as a television presenter for a local station.  It’s worth mentioning that with both their monthly salaries they take on family expenses and educational expenses for their children thus succeeding in preparing them to be professionals in future.

She is requesting her second Ceprodel loan and if it’s approved she will be able to buy some construction supplies like cement and bricks and pay labor costs to do some home improvements because her monthly income is insufficient to do he improvement all on her own and at the right moment which is why she’s grateful for the care Ceprodel provided previously and trusts this institution.  In this way, she plans to continue improving her house’s physical condition to provide a more presentable, attractive home for her children.

loans.use: to buy bricks and other building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is 64 years old. She is provided with a retirement pension. She lives in a small village in Senaki District. She is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has three milk cows and two pigs. She milks the cows and produces dairy products which are sold locally. 

Nunu is a very hard working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan to purchase calves. After purchasing calves, she will raise them and expand her dairy business. She will sell more products and, thus, will increase her income. With increased income, Nunu will improve her living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves and expand her dairy business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make more soap and rent a business location.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es:
Ángela, de 32 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Sinesio de 35 años y sus 3 queridos hijos de 13, 8 y 3 a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida y por quienes esta dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo.
Lo que realiza Ángela es la venta de bebidas típicas de la región, este trabajo le permitió brindar muchas mejoras en las condiciones de vida de su hogar ya que es un negocio muy rentable, ya que tiene una carretilla en la cual transporta sus bebidas y debido al gran movimiento comercial y la alta temperatura de la ciudad de Pucallpa siempre vende mucho, ella es una persona muy alegre y siempre realiza sus ventas con una sonrisa bien grande, aun que ahora le va muy bien, al principio tuvo muchas dificultades como el de no saber muy el preparado de los refrescos pero con el tiempo pudo aprender y ahora es una de las mejores del sector en donde ofrece sus deliciosos refrescos.
Lleva 7 años en el negocio y lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que caminar todo el día en busca de clientes, desea más adelante tener una tienda donde pueda vender de todo y no solo limitarse a bebidas típicas, lo que más le complace es conversar con sus clientes, ya que mediante ellos se puede enterar de las bebidas que más les gustan, tiene como planes el de poner una fuente de soda y ahí empezar a vender en mayor cantidad sus refrescantes preparados. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá mas segura de avanzar con su trabajo, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas y no dejar mal al grupo tan bueno que le esta dando la oportunidad de poder incrementar su capital de trabajo respaldándola en su banco comunal. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará más frutas para sus bebidas y les ofrecerá una mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ángela is 32 years old and is a very friendly hardworking woman.  She lives in a home of her own with her husband, 35 year old Sinesio, and their three children, ages 13, 8, and 3, to whom they want to provide a better quality of life for which she is prepared to work.

Angela sells typical regional drinks and this work allows her to provide a better quality of life to her home.  Her business is very profitable because she has a cart where she transports her drinks and because of the large amount of commercial movement and the high temperatures in the city of Pucallpa.  She always makes good sales.  She’s a happy person who always makes many sales with a big smile, now that things are going well for her.  At first she had many difficulties, such as not knowing how to prepare the drinks, but in time she was able to learn.  Now she is one of the best in the sector, where she offers her delicious drinks.

She has been doing this for seven years and the most difficult part of her work is having to walk all day in search of customers.  She wants to have a store in the future, where she can sell all kinds of things, not just drinks.  What she really wants is to keep her customers because it’s through them that she finds out which drinks are best liked.  She plans to set up a soda fountain and help sell in quantity.

This will be her third loan through MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She is certain to advance her business and is committed to making her payments on time and not leave the group in poor standing because they are backing her in increasing her working capital.  She will use the 2,000 PEN to buy more fruit for her drinks so that she can offer a greater variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El señor Marco Antonio es un joven padre de familia, casado y con 2 hijos, se dedica  a la comercialización de elementos de artesanía en general y los distribuye en las principales ferias turísticas de la ciudad. Marco Antonio en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para comprar mercadería como chompas, bufandas, gorros, adornos cerámicos, utilitarios y bisutería para capitalizarse para la campaña navideña. Marco Antonio está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la ciual representa el principal ingreso económico de su familia y la oportunidad de proporcionarles una mejor educación a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is a member of the “QORICHUSPAS” Communal Bank in the city of Cuzco, Perü. He is a young father, who is married with two children. He sells general handicraft items and distributes them in the main tourist markets in the city. 

At this time he is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise, such as sweaters, scarves, hats, ceramic ornaments, utilitarian objects and jewelry, in order to capitalize on the Christmas season. Marco Antonio is very grateful to KIVA for enabling him to support himself and get ahead in his business, which provides the main source of financial support for his family and the means to give his children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase sweaters, scarves, hats, ceramic ornaments, utilitarian objects and jewelry.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonya dreams of working in financial management. In addition to attending school full time, she works 30 hours a week to afford her tuition and her daughter’s expenses. Sonya earns about $4 a day and pools her income with her father, who works as a cashier at a local shop. Together they earn around $9 a day for their family. 

With the money from her loan, Sonya plans on purchasing vital textbooks that will help her complete her final years of school. She has made it this far without books, but in order to complete her thesis and earn the high grades she aspires to, she needs materials. With a degree in hand and skills that can help her in the professional workforce Sonya expects to earn $14 a day in her future. This increase would not only change her life but that of her daughter’s as well.

loans.use: to pay for the books she needs to study for her courses

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.en:
In Bolivia, submitting a thesis and receiving a degree are accompanied by fees. In fact, the final semester of many university programs is often more expensive than any other part of the university experience. Rosmery is ready to graduate and earn her law degree but she is stuck. Unable to afford the final step of her program, she faces the threat of having to postpone her education and return to work.

Rosmery’s parents own a barbershop and make just enough to support their four children. Rosmery has a child of her own and as the oldest, she wants to set a good example for her brothers and be the first in her family to earn a university degree. 
She is passionate about law and shares that she “loves reading and truly cares about the laws and obligations of all people.” With her degree she hopes to be able to improve her city of Sucre. She describes it as a “beautiful city with lots of culture.”

loans.use: to pay for her thesis fees so she can graduate

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the thesis fees and books she needs to graduate

loans.name: Erika Marcela

texts.es:
Ericka es originaria del municipio de Telica, es una joven de 29 años, casada, madre de dos niños, que se dedica a laborar como maestra de primaria. Eligió esta profesión porque le apasiona enseñar a leer y escribir y se siente bien porque aporta al desarrollo de Nicaragua en formar profesionales que son el futuro de dicho país.

A pesar de ser joven y de haber formado a temprana edad su familia es una mujer madura, emprendedora que piensa en el futuro para sus hijos, en construir su propia vivienda con todas las condiciones y no habitar toda la vida en casa familiar.
Para lograr sus sueños se esfuerza día a día para cumplir en su trabajo en la jornada laboral a pesar de quedar tan lejos la escuela donde imparte clases, ya que tiene que salir de su vivienda a las 5 am para estar puntual y ser una maestra ejemplar.

Poquito a poco y con la ayuda de los créditos ha construido lo esencial de una vivienda pero necesita otro crédito para comprar materiales como ladrillos, cemento, perlines y zinc para seguir con esta obra.
Confía en Dios que KIVA  a través de Ceprodel aprobará su solicitud para cumplir su objetivo de ver su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ericka is from the municipality of Telica.  This young woman is 29-years-old and the mother of two children.  She works as an elementary school teacher.  She chose this profession because she’s passionate about teaching to read and to write and feels good because she contributes to Nicaragua’s development by forming professionals who are the country’s future.

Despite being young and having formed her family at an early age, she’s a very mature, enterprising woman who is concerned for her children’s future; to build her own house with all conditions and not spend her entire life living in the family home.  To reach her dreams, she strives daily to do her work even though she lives far from the school where she teaches and must leave home at 5am in order to be punctual and be an exemplary teacher.

Little by little and with help from loans, she’s built the essentials of her house but needs another loan to buy building materials like bricks, cement, roofing purlins and metal sheeting to continue with the project.  She trusts in God that Kiva through Ceprodel will approve her loan application so she can reach the goal of owning a house.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, roofing purlins and metal sheeting.

loans.name: Marisela Aideliz

texts.es: Marisela habita en una zona rural, hija de padres pequeños productores, la que con mucho esfuerzos emprendió sus estudios, logrando graduarse en la especialidad de   licenciatura en Español, la que hoy ejerce impartiendo clases en un colegio del sector donde vive, con 19 años de efectuarlo, como maestra de educación primaria, es soltera con 2 hijos con estudios primarios y secundarios a los que le brinda la atención para lograr el desarrollo académico, esta señora se presento a ceprodel a exponer la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda y ser beneficiada con un financiamiento el que lo utilizaría para la compra de cemento, hierro, zinc, ladrillo bloque y cerámica, para la construcción de cuarto y reparación de cocina, de esa manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Marisela lives in a rural area, and is the daughter of small business owners. With much effort she undertook her studies and succeeded in graduating with a Bachelor's degree in Spanish. 

She now uses her degree teaching classes at a school in the sector where she lives. She has 19 years of experience as a teacher of primary education. She is single with two children in their primary and secondary studies. She takes care to help them succeed in their academic development.

This woman presented herself at CEPRODEL to explain the necessity of improving her home and to benefit from financing. She will use the loan to pay for cement, iron, zinc, bricks, ceramics, and labor for the construction of a room and for kitchen repairs, thereby improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for cement, ceramics, sand, and labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy PCV pipes so that he can replace the pipes in his home

loans.name: Reynaldo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo Antonio vive en Managua  trabaja como distribuidor de factura desde hace 8 año  tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.

Esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción para hacerle mejoras a su vivienda.
Don Reynaldo considera que es necesario hacer esa inversión para mejorar  las condiciones de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Reynaldo Antonio lives in Managua and has worked as a bill collector for 8 years; he has two school-age children.  

He’s asking for a loan to buy building materials to do some home improvements.  Reynaldo feels it’s necessary to make this investment to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Don Víctor se caracteriza  por ser una persona responsable,  con su domicilio en Managua trabaja  como fontanero en una empresa..

Esta solicitando un crédito para construir el porche en su vivienda para darle  mayor seguridad a su familia
Es el tercer crédito que ceprodel le otorga y dice que estos crédito le han servido de mucho ya que a mejorado poco a poco su vivienda.

 El señor Víctor esta muy agradecido con CEPRODEL  por la oportunidad   para mejorar su vivienda
texts.en: Víctor is noted for being a responsible person.  He works as a plumber for a firm in Managua where he lives.  He’s asking for a loan to be able to build a porch at home to provide more security for his family.  This is the third loan Ceprodel has granted and he says they have been of much use to him because he’s been able to gradually do home improvements.  Víctor is very grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 32 years old and lives in the town of Fort Portal in Uganda.  She is married and has one child who currently attends school.  For the past four years, Beatrice has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Beatrice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  She will use this loan to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt for resale.  This loan will help Beatrice to generate greater profits and increase her stock of items to meet the demand of a greater number of customers.  Beatrice hopes that in the future she will be able to own a larger well-stocked shop. 

Beatrice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Beatrice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old, married, and has one child. He has been in the motorbike transport business for four years and is very hardworking. He hopes to own a taxi in the future and also provide a better life for his family. 

John requires a loan of 71,760 KES to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy repair parts for bikes.

loans.name: Jezabel De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Jezabel de los Ángeles vive en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar y el futuro de su familia, es casada y labora en una universidad privada desde hace año y medio desempeñándose como secretaria.
  
Esta solicitando un crédito a CEPRODEL para poder terminar una remodelación en un cuarto de su casa y este crédito lo invertirá en compra de arena, pintura, pago de mano de obra.

Con este sería el segundo financiamiento que Ceprodel le  brindaría para seguir acondicionando su vivienda. ya que con el primero hizo una inversión en reparar el techo.
texts.en:
Jezabel de los Ángeles lives in the city of Managua, Nicaragua.  She is a hard-working person who fights for the well-being and future of her family.  She is married and has been working as a secretary at a private university for a year and a half.

She is applying for a loan from CEPRODEL to finish remodeling a room in her house.  She will use this loan to buy sand and paint, and to pay for labor costs.  This would be her second loan from CEPRODEL to continue setting up her house.  With her first loan she was able to repair her roof.

loans.use: to buy construction materials like sand and paint, and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Visentina

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin” y con la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos, gallinas y chanchos, ella también se dedica a la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores como chanchos y gallinas. Es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia y está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Visentina continues as a member of the community bank “Virgin Concebida de Arin”. She is still rears livestock: small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, hens and pigs. She also grows arable crops.  She has been running this business for several years now and things are going well. She is applying for this loan to buy small animals such as pigs and chickens.  Visentina is a responsible and friendly person, who works hard for her family. She would be very pleased to receive this loan and she undertakes to make all the repayments.

loans.use: to buy livestock like pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Maria De La Concepcion

texts.es: María de 38 anos de edad, casada con un hijo de la localidad de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Ella trabaja como domestica, y esta solicitando el préstamo para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación las cuales consisten en pintarla, repellarla, y cambiar el techo ya que se esta deteriorado. Con el financiamiento lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción como:   bloques, cemento, pintura, arena, clavos, zinc. María agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos para tener un lugar digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
María, 38, is married and has a son. They live in the town of León which is located in the western part of the country. She works as a housekeeper. She is requesting a loan in order to make improvements to her house such as painting, plastering and putting on a new roof since it is starting to deterioriate. With the loan she will invest in buying construction materials such as: blocks, cement, paint, nails and zinc. 
Maria is thankful for the Kiva investors who help people with sparse resources to have a dignified place to live.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: blocks, cement, paint, nails and zinc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.es:
Cecilia, de 40 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de tener muchas ganas de sobresalir. Vive en compañía su conviviente Lauro quien es comerciante y sus dos hijos mayores de 15, 09 y 01 año de edad, habitando su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Cecilia es la repostería, oficio que aprendió estudiando en un centro de educación ocupacional, donde le enseñaron a elaborar deliciosas tortas, y pasteles para promociones, bodas y demás acontecimientos sociales, llegando a tener muchos pedidos por el buen trabajo que realiza, y continua actualizándose pues considera que siempre  hay cosas nuevas que  aprender, contando con un horno en su casa, donde realiza todos su preparaciones y atiende a sus clientes desde hace 12 años. Le gusta  la repostería así como las manualidades, se siente a gusto con su oficio pues le ha proporcionado muchas satisfacciones, como los ingresos económicos y el poder convertirse  en una prospera empresaria, por eso tiene planes de abrir una fuente de soda en su casa, ya que su ubicación en una esquina es estratégica para un buen negocio. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, se siente contenta con el apoyo financiero para avanzar con su negocio. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues considera a sus miembros ser buenas personas. 
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles los invertirá en compra de ingredientes para la preparaciones de sus torta para esta campaña de fiestas en los colegios, que son moldes y utensilios de repostería.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 40 years old and is a hardworking enterprising woman with a great desire to succeed.  She lives with her husband, Lauro, who is a merchant, and their three children, ages 15, 9, and 1.  They all live together in her home.  Cecilia sells pastries and learned this at a trade school, where she learned to bake delicious tortes and cakes for parties, weddings, and social gatherings.  She gets many orders because she does good work and continues to update herself because she feels that there are always new things to learn.  With one oven at home, where she makes all of her wares and serves her customers, she has been doing this for 12 years.  She enjoys making pastries and working with her hands.  This has given her great satisfaction and an income, allowing her to become a true entrepreneur.  She plans to install a soda fountain in her home, since she is in a strategic location and does good business.  This will be her second loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support she has received so that she can move ahead with her business.  Aside from feeling comfortable with her bank, she considers the members to be good people.

She will use the 1,000 PEN from this loan to buy ingredients to prepare her tortes for the school celebration season, with molds and utensils.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Martha Mariela

texts.es:
La Joven Martha Mariela, trabaja en un centro Educativo  de la Ciudad de León desempeñándose como Directora del centro  desde hace seis años, es madre soltera de un hijo de 8 años de edad. 

Martha Mariela  sale se sus casa a las 6:30 am inicia sus  labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

es primer  crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel para realizar el pago de matrícula y compra de uniforme de su único hijo. 

 Ella sueña con la formación de su hijo y llegar a obtener su propia vivienda ya que actualmente habita con sus padres.
texts.en:
Martha Mariela works as the principal of the Leon Education Center, and has done this for six years.  She’s a single mother and has an eight year old son.  She leaves her house at 6:30 am, begins work at 7:00 am, and finishes at 5:00 pm, Monday through Friday.

This will be her first loan through CEPRODEL and will use the money to pay for her son’s tuition and school uniforms.

She dreams of having her own home because she currently lives with her parents.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education expenses.

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Señora Nubia de los Santos,  posee un negocio de venta de agua, gaseosas, jugos y cosadehorno   ubicado en uno de los mercado de la  ciudad de León, desde hace trece  años, ella realiza esta labor para llevar el sustento a su familia, es madre cuatro  hijos de los cuales solo dos están a su cargo,  Sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:00 am  abre su negocio a las 7:00 am y finalizando sus labores a las 6:00 pm este trabajo  lo realiza  de lunes a sábado en este mismo horario.
 
El  crédito que esta solicitando a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para gastos de graduación de su hijo, ella espera que sus sueños se le cumplan como es la preparación profesional de sus dos hijos que están a su cargo.
texts.en:
Nubia de los Santos has a business where she sells water, soft drinks, juices, and baked goods.  It’s located in one of the markets in Leon and has been there for three years.  She does this to support her family and is the mother of four children, but only two still depend on her.  She leaves her home at 6:00 am, opens her business at 7:00 am, and closes at 6:00 pm, Monday through Saturday.

She is asking from this loan through CEPRODEL in order to pay his son’s graduation expenses.  She hopes that her dreams of having her children work professionally will come true.

loans.use: to pay for her son's graduation expenses.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana de 55 años de edad, vive en la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena con su cónyuge y sus 4 hijos en las edades de 8 a 19 años. Ella aprendió de su madre el oficio tradicional de confecciones, con el que ha logrado apoyar el sustento de su familia desde hace 5 años, aunque su experiencia data de hace 35 cuando apoyaba a su madre.
