Las líneas de prenda en las que hace énfasis Ana son la ropa femeninas y cubrelechos de acuerdo con la época, en la cual solicitan sus clientela; así en Junio todo lo relacionado con ropa para camas y en los meses de diciembre y Enero vestidos para damas e infantil. Desde las 6 de la mañana ordena sus insumos y desde ese momento empieza a diseñar, preparar, ensamblar piezas, hasta las 5 de la tarde, que se levanta de la máquina para tomar su descanso  y llamar a sus clientes para que pasen a recoger lo confeccionado y establecer las fechas de pago. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, con el cual comprará telas en volumen, correderas, botones, para confeccionar las Blusas, vestidos, suéteres, pantalones  que sus clientes usarán en las fiestas de fin de año, época en la cual necesitan estar bien elegantes y llenos de amor para recibir el año nuevo y cantar los coros de navidad.
texts.en:
Ana is 55 years old and lives in the lovely city of Cartagena, along with her husband and four children, between the ages of 8 and 19.  She learned to make clothing from her mother and she has been able to support her family for the past five years, although her experience dates back 35 years, when she used to help her mother.

She makes her lines of clothing are for women in accordance with the season and as requested by her customers.  So in June she makes pajamas and in December and January makes girls’ dresses.

She begins setting up her supplies at 6:00 am and begins designing from that moment in order to assemble the pieces until 5:00 pm, when she takes a break from her machine and calls her customers to go pick up their orders and arrange payment dates.

She is asking for a Kiva loan so that she can buy fabric in volume, zippers, and buttons to make blouses, dresses, sweaters, and pants that her customers will use at end of the year festivities.  This is the time of years when people need to be elegant and full of love to receive the new years and sing Christmas carols.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es: Marco Antonio de 55 anos, casado con cuatro hijos mayores de edad. Él es originario de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Marco tiene por actividad económica el servicio de veterinaria desde hace 18 anos que se dedica a dicha actividad. Él es un hombre responsable, trabajador, con buena calidad moral. Marco esta solicitando el financiamiento para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación la cual consisten en levantar una pared. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como cemento, zinc, arena, piedrín, alambre, clavos. Marco agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un lugar digno donde vivir.
texts.en:
Marco Antonio is 55 years old and married with four adult children. He is originally from León, a place that is located in the western part of the country.

Marco works as a veterinary and has been doing this work for 18 years. He is a responsible man, hardworking, with good moral character. 

Marco is asking for a loan in order to make improvements to his house which consists of putting up a wall. With the loan proceeds he will buy construction materials such as cement, zinc, sand, gravel, wire and nails.

Marco is grateful for the support that the Kiva loaners provide to people with scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua in order to have a place to live.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, zinc, sand, gravel, wire and nails in order to put up a wall in his home

loans.name: Indhira

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios para celulares,ella tiene una tienda donde vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia sale adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de celulares y accesorios.La socia solicita el credito para comprar celulares y accesorios para celulares.

La socia esta contenta con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues working selling cellular phones and accessories. 

She has a store where she sells from 8:00AM until 7:00PM. She has been doing this for seven years and it is going very well, and it is through this business that she is getting ahead. 

Her dream is to expand the business of selling cell phones and accessories.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy cell phones and accessories. The member is pleased about the loan and she agrees to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy cellular phones and accessories in order to sell them in her business

loans.name: Marlitt

texts.es:
La socia sigue trabajando haciendo trabajos eventuales como organizacion de eventos,venta de productos de belleza,ella esta estudiando la carrera de administracion y le va muy bien,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 hasta las 1:00 p.m y en las tardes la socia estudia,el sueño de la socia es abrir una empresa de marketing.La socia solicita el credito para pagar las mensualidades de la universidad.

La socia está muy agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working occasionally organizing  events and selling beauty products.  She’s studying business administration and is doing very well.  She works from 8am until 1pm and attends classes in the afternoon.  Her dream is to open a marketing firm.  She’s requesting the loan to pay her monthly tuition fees.  She’s very grateful for the loan and commits to make her payments.

loans.use: to pay her monthly university tuition fees.

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
El socio Efrain pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary Runa” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.

El socio continua dedicandose a la ganaderia,el socio lleva años en esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,el socio es una persona resposanble y empeñoso siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.

El socio solicita el credito para la compra abono y para algunos gastos personales.

El socio agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en: Efraín belongs to the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  He continues working in animal husbandry.  He’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He’s a responsible, enterprising person who supports his family this way.  He requests the loan to buy manure and to pay a few personal expenses.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy manure and to pay some personal expenses.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina pertenece al  banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia continua dedicándose hacer masajes en una institución privada de la misma forma lo realiza de forma particular,la socia lleva años realizando esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia.

Luz Marina requiere el préstamo para la compra vivieres para su hogar y para algunos gastos personales. 

La socia se siente agradecida y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Luz Marina belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Ricchary Runa” communal in the city of Cusco.  She continues working giving massages in a private firm; she does so independently.  She’s been in this business for years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into it daily.  She’s a responsible, enterprising person who supports her family this way.  Luz Marina needs the loan to buy food for her home and for some personal expenses.  She feels grateful and commits to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy food for home and to pay some personal expenses.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro donde hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño del socio es tener un carro nuevo.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas y repuestos para su carro.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: He continues working in transportation.  He has a car he uses to provide taxi services with from 7am until 10pm.  He’s been in business five years and does very well.  He supports his son by means of this business and his dream is to own a new car.  He requests the loan to buy tires and spare parts for his car.  He’s grateful for the opportunity provided by this means and commits to make his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy tires and spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia vende ropas interiores y tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en sus pequeños negocios,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa interior.La socia solicita el credito para comprar ropas interiores como medias y polos.

En esta oportunidad la socia se ha comprometido a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en: She continues working selling clothes and underwear and also selling beauty products from 8am until 6pm.  She’s had her small businesses for 8 years now.  Her dream is to have a store where she can sell the underwear.  She requests a loan to buy underwear like stockings and shirts.  On this occasion she’s committed to make all her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy clothes and underwear.

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es: EL Banco Comunal Fe y Esperanza esta conformado por 11 integrantes de los cuales todas son madres solteras, con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad ellas son originarias del municipio de Malpaisillo que esta ubicado en la zona norte del país.  Las mujeres de este banco se caracterizan por ser personas responsable, trabajadoras, con ganas de superación personal. Las cuales se unieron para ayudarse mutuamente y salir delante con sus diferentes actividades económicas ya que es su medio de vida y de sus hijos. Cándida Rosa es la coordinadora del banco, la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de pago del grupo en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación, la cual consisten en vender productos de consumo diario para el hogar y en cantidades pequeñas como sobrecitos de shapoo, sobre de café, azúcar, frijoles, pan, leche, huevos, jugos. El banco comunal Fe y Esperanza agradecen la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para salir adelante. Y tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Fe y Esperanza communal bank is made up of 12 members, all of whom are single mothers with a total of 20 children to care for.  They are all originally from Malpaisillo, located in the northern zone of the country.  These ladies are responsible, hardworking women with a desire to get ahead personally.  They got together to offer mutual support and get ahead with their different activities, because this is how they support their children.

Cándida Rosa is the bank’s coordinator and in charge of making timely payments for the group.  She has a grocery store in her home and sells daily consumables in small quantities, such as shampoo, coffee sorbet, sugar, beans, bread, milk, eggs, and juices.  The “Fe y Esperanza” communal bank appreciates the Kiva lenders because they provide help for people of limited resources so they can get ahead in poor countries such as Nicaragua, allowing them to make a dignified living.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Jonny José

texts.es:
Don Jonny José vive en el departamento de Granada Nicaragua, él viaja todos los días a Managua donde labora, desempeñándose como ayudante fontanero en una empresa del estado desde hace siete años para poder llevarle el sustento a su familia.

"Este es el primer crédito que estoy solicitándole a  CEPRODEL, para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cinz, perlines y así poder hacer una inversión en mi vivienda, cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado".  

Con este financiamiento podrá tener una condición mejor de vida, esperando el apoyo de kiva y ceprodel.
texts.en: Jonny José lives in Granada Department, Nicaragua.  He travels to Managua every day which is where he’s employed as a plumber’s assistant for a state firm; he’s had this job for seven years in order to support his family.  This is his first Ceprodel loan request and it’s to buy building materials like metal sheeting and roofing purlins to invest in his house; he will replace the roof which is in poor condition.  With this financing he’ll have better living conditions; he’s hoping for Kiva and Ceprodel support.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Gelmount Jose

texts.es:
Gelmount José es nacido en la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, es una persona con un núcleo familiar de tres personas bajo su responsable, se desempeña laborando como lector  desde hace ocho años en una institución del estado.

Esta solicitando a Ceprodel un crédito para seguir mejorando su vivienda y así poder darle una condición mejor de vida a su familia, este crédito seria la segunda oportunidad que le brinden para realizar una inversión en el techo que está en mal estado, compraría materiales de construcción tales con cinz, madera y mano de obra.

Gracia al primer financiamiento que le dieron pudo resolver una parte de reparación y con este segundo completaría lo del techo, es una persona que cumple sus cuotas establecida conforme su plan.
texts.en: Gelmount José was born in the city of Managua, Nicaragua.  His nuclear family consists of three people in his care.  He’s been employed for 8 years as a reader for a state institution.  He’s asking Ceprodel for a loan to continue improving his house to provide better living conditions for his family.  This loan will be his second and will be used to invest in the roof which is in poor condition.  He will buy building supplies like metal sheeting, lumber and pay labor costs.  Thanks to the first loan he was given he was able to pay for part of the repairs and will use this second one to complete the roof.  He’s a person who makes his payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Jairo Luis

texts.es:
Masatepe es una bella ciudad del departamento de Masaya. Que se caracteriza por sus tradiciones religiosas y su artesanilla que son elaboradas en esa ciudad de Nicaragua.

 Jairo Luis  creció con buenas costumbres y el amor al trabajo que sus padres le enseñaron para ser una persona de bien, es casado y está  compuesta con un núcleo familia.

El actualmente  trabaja para una universidad privada donde se desempeña como agente de seguridad donde lleva tres año y medio laborando.
Necesita  realizar una mejora en su casa como es el piso ya que es de tierra.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar materiales de construcción tales como cerámica boom. Esto permitirá mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia. 
Esta muy agradecido con  Ceprodel  y kiva , ya que dice que aparte que se le atiende bien también son bajos los intereses.
texts.en: Masatepe is a beautiful city in Masaya Department that’s noted for its religious traditions and crafts that are made in that Nicaraguan city.  Jairo Luis grew up with good habits and the love of work which his parents taught him so he’d be an upstanding citizen.  He’s married and has formed a nuclear family.  He’s currently employed as a security guard at a private university; he’s been on the job for three and a half years.  He needs to do some home improvements; he wants to improve the floor which is currently dirt.  The loan he’s asking Ceprodel for will be used to buy building materials like tile that will make it possible for him to improve his family’s standard of living.  He’s very grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva because besides the good service he gets the interest rates are low.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
El Señor Edmundo, de oficio artesano de la madera, con edad de 60 años casado, reside en el departamento de Masaya, es dueño de su propio negocio de juegos de videos para distracción de los  niños que pasan cuando salen del  colegio y niños vecinos del sector.
La idea de poner su negocio surgió con el propósito  de buscar alternativa de trabajo, ya que la ebanistería  no podía ejercerla debido  a la falta de empleo, con el apoyo de su esposa emprendieron unos pequeños negocios que hasta la fecha le ha ayudado a salir adelante con su hijos, lo que ha permitido apoyar grandemente a su hijo mayor  con sus estudios universitarios.

Se acerca a nuestras oficinas para solicitar  financiamiento y comprar accesorios como discos de juegos, controles de nintendo 64 play II. 

Considera que este financiamiento le ayudara a estar actualizado con juegos que le interesan a los niños lo que le permitirá mantener sus ingresos
texts.en:
Sr. Edmundo is 60 years old, married, and a woodworker by trade.  He resides in the Department of Masaya.  His dream was to have his own video game business where the neighborhood children could pass the time after they finished school.  

The idea for this business emerged because he needed to find another source of income since he was not able to find work as a furniture maker.  With the help of his wife, Edmundo established a few small businesses so that he could help their children get ahead.  As a result, he was able to help his oldest son with his university studies.  

Edmundo came to the offices of CEPRODEL so that he could request a loan in order to buy accessories, including video game discs and controls for the Nintendo 64 and PlayStation 2.  He says this loan will help him acquire the games that the children are interested in, which will help him maintain his stream of income.

loans.use: to buy video game discs and controllers.

loans.name: Hilario De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Hilario de Jesús es originario de la comarca Santa Ana jurisdicción del la ciudad de Pueblo nuevo a unos 52 km al noroeste de la cabecera departamental de Estelí. Este señor esta felizmente casado y tiene  dos hijos varones un que esta en edad escolar y el otro que esta tierno.

El se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias tales como la crianza y venta de ganado bovino de engorde y la producción de hortalizas desde hace aproximadamente unos 30 años de manera continua y lo que ha sido su principal soporte familiar y su esposa se dedica a las labores del hogar.

 Este señor ha trabajado con los financiamientos de Ceprodel   le han beneficiado positivamente en el desarrollo de su hato ganadero y la producción de sus cultivos. Nuevamente el solicita un financiamiento a ceprodel para la compra de un novillo para desarrollo, el pretende con esto aumentar su hato ganadero y en un futuro  poder venderlo a un mejor precio y obtener una mejor ganancia con lo que el podrá comprar mas animales.
texts.en:
Hilario de Jesús is from the Santa Ana district which is under the jurisdiction of the city of Pueblo Nuevo about 52 kilometers northeast of the Estelí Department main center.  He’s happily married and has two sons who are school age and one who is still a baby.  He works in agriculture and animal husbandry activities like raising and selling cattle and growing vegetables.  He’s been doing this for about 30 years continuously and it’s been his main source of family support; his wife does household chores.

He has worked with Ceprodel loans for ten cycles that have had positive benefits in his herd development and in his crop production.  He’s once again requesting a loan to buy a bullock to raise.  He intends with this to increase his herd size for future sale at a better price thus earning higher profits that he can then use to buy more animals.

loans.use: to buy a bullock.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Martha Isabel, reside en la cuidad de Masaya conocida también como cuidad de las flores, con 47 años de edad, vive sola con sus hijos, posee una  pequeña pulpería que la tiene en su casa, la cual la inicio con capital propio desde  hace dos años, también comercializa la venta de cajetas de coco, elaborada por ella misma a base coco, azúcar, colorante, la cajeta la comercializa en el mercado municipal de su cuidad. 

Doña Martha busca  la manera de optimizar sus ingresos  con sus pequeños negocios, con el propósito de mejorar el nivel de vida para su familia. Sus compras las realiza en el mercado municipal de Masaya, para reabastecer su pulpería.

solicita un préstamo a ceprodel que le permita abastecer su pulpería en la compra de  arroz faisán, azúcar, aceite, leña en raja y en manojo, gaseosas, golosina; que es lo que mas le están demandado  sus clientes, esto  por la temporada en la que se mejoran las ventas, por lo que necesita hacer esa inversión, que le ayudara a dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en: Martha Isabel lives in the city of Masaya, also known as the City of Flowers.  She’s 47-years-old and only lives with her children.  She has a small grocery store at home that she started with her own capital two years ago.  She also sells coconut sweets that she makes herself from coconut, sugar and food coloring that she sells in her city’s municipal market.  Martha is looking for a way to optimize her income with her small businesses in order to improve her family’s standard of living.  She makes her purchases to restock her grocery store in the Masaya municipal market.  She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to stock her store.  She will buy Faisan brand rice, sugar, oil, firewood in bunches and by the piece, soft-drinks and snacks which have the highest customer demand; this is because of the season when sales improve and she needs to make this investment so she can provide better service.

loans.use: to buy coconuts, rice, soft-drinks, snacks, firewood, oil and medicines.

loans.name: Jairo Javier

texts.es:
El señor Jairo Javier vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja como  guarda de seguridad en una universidad de Managua  desde hace 13 año.
Padre de familia responsable  con mucho deseo de superación para el  y su familia.

Don Jairo  solicita  un crédito ya que tiene el proyecto de cambiar  el techo de su casa ya que tiene muchos  año de haber construido la vivienda  se encuentra en mal estado y es por eso que urge la compra de cinz y madera para mejorar su vivienda.

 Es el tercer crédito  que CEPRODEL le ha financiado y se siente muy agradecido por que gracias a esa oportunidad ha podido ir mejorando el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo lives in the city of Managua and has worked as a security guard at a Managua university for 13 years.  He’s a responsible father who very much wants his and his family’s improvement.  

Jairo is requesting a loan because he has a project to replace the roof at home because the house was built many years ago and it’s in poor condition which is why it’s urgent for him to buy metal sheeting and lumber to make some home improvements.  

This is his third Ceprodel loan and he’s very grateful because thanks to this opportunity he’s been able to gradually improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and lumber to repair his house.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Don Alfredo Gregorio vive en la cuidad de Managua trabaja cono cobrador del servicio de agua potable en la cuidad de Managua.Casado  tiene dos hijos a su cargo uno en edad escolar
 
Alfredo solicita un crédito ya que necesita hacer gastos de egreso escolar de su hijo.
Y la otra parte del crédito lo utilizara en la remodelación de su cocina que considera tiene que hacerles algunas mejoras.
El señor Alfredo Gregorio agradece a ceprodel ya que  esta seria el segundo crédito trabajado con la institución y gracias a eso ha podido mejorar la condición de vida  de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo Gregorio lives in the city of Managua and works as a potable water bill collector for the city of Managua.  He has two school age children in his care.  

Alfredo is requesting a loan because he needs to pay for his son’s graduation costs.  Another part of the loan will be used to remodel his kitchen because he feels it needs quite a few improvements.  Alfredo Gregorio thanks Ceprodel since this is the second loan he’s had with the institution and thanks to it he’s been able to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Dora Maritza

texts.es:
El señora Dora Maritza es una señora que reside en el casco urbano de Condega desde hace mas de treinta años aproximadamente y esta felizmente casada y tiene tres un hijo varón y dos hijas mujeres, los cuales se encuentra estudiando

Ella se desempeña como como secretaria  en la dirección de un colegio  de Condega donde tiene aproximadamente unos 5 años de laborar de manera continua y responsable y su esposo trabaja como mecánico automotriz en un taller de mecánica propio que este tiene en su casa de habitación. Esta pareja trabaja arduamente a diario para poder obtener un ingreso y así poder lograr sacar adelante los estudios de sus hijos y que estos en un futuro logren ser unos profesionales

Esta Dora Maritza solicita su segundo financiamiento y que de ser aprobado ella piensa comprar la materia prima y aumentar el inventario en la venta de comideria que ella tiene en el mismo colegio donde trabaja, ella le ofrece a los estudiantes y demás personal de colegio, comida y refrescos, de esta manera esta clienta aumentaría sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos. Ella se muestra gradecida con Ceprodel por el financiamiento ya que ha logrado mejorar positivamente su negocio de comida.
texts.en:
Dora Maritza is a woman living in the Condega city center for more than 30 years approximately and she’s happily married and has a son and two daughters who are attending school.  She’s been continuously employed for five years as a secretary in the administration office of the high school.  She’s a responsible worker; her husband works as an auto mechanic in his own auto repair shop located at home.  This couple works hard every day to earn income and be able to pay for their children’s schooling so that in future they will become professionals.

She is requesting her second loan and if it’s approved she plans to buy raw materials to increase her stock inventory in the snack bar she runs at the same school where she’s employed.  She offers students and other school staff food and refreshments.  In this way, she’ll increase sales and as a result her income, too.  She is very grateful to Ceprodel for the loan because she’s been able to improve her food business positively.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her school snack bar.

loans.name: Grace Billy

texts.en:
Grace Billy is 31 years old and lives in the town of Ibanba in the Kabwohe region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 6 years, Grace Billy has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Grace Billy has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to  buy more clothes for resale, and will help Grace Billy to generate greater profits and pay for her childrens school facilities such as books and pens. Grace Billy hopes that in the future she will be able to build a big ressidatial house for her self. 

Grace Billy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace billy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to  buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 50 years old, married, and has four children. He has been rearing cows for the past 20 years, and also earns income from his rental houses. He was previously employed in a hotel. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Eliud's business has grown tremendously. He requires a loan of 105,300 KES to buy cows for sale. He hopes to increase his profits.

loans.use: to buy cows for sale.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Jaime es un hombre soltero que se dedica a la organización de eventos sociales para diversión como bailes y conciertos musicales. Jaime en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para pagar la publicidad de sus eventos para  fiestas de fin de año. Jaime está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle desarrollarse  y mantenerse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en: Jaime is a member of the “QORICHUSPAS” communal bank in Cusco – Peru.  He is single and organizes social events such as dances and musical concerts.  Jaime is asking for a loan in order to pay for advertising for his events for the end of year festivities.  He is very appreciative to Kiva for helping him to develop and maintain his financial activities.

loans.use: to pay for advertising.

loans.name: Wilmer

texts.es: Wilmer, de 27 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa Zaida y sus hijo Alexander a quien cuidan en la casa que compraron hace 2 años. Él es un hombre maduro y serio, por ello hace poco logró adquirir su casa con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Su actividad económica es la agricultura y ganadería, posee terrenos heredados de sus padres, los cuales cuida y fertiliza con su esposa. Este es su principal medio económico por lo que espera poder sacar el máximo provecho.  Ahora desea capital para comenzar la siembra pues es temporada y desea tener mucho éxito. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues quiere quedar muy bien con su asociación, “Yanamarca unida”. Wilmer invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Wilmer is a responsible man of 27 years of age. He lives with his wife Zaida and his son Alexander in the house that they bought together 2 years ago. He is a mature and reliable man, and it was thanks to these qualities that he managed to acquire his house, after a lot of work and effort. His work is agriculture and animal husbandry. He owns land that he inherited from his parents, which, together with his wife, he tends and maintains fertile. This is his principle means of support and for this reason, he hopes to achieve the best harvest possible.  He needs capital now, in order to start planting, as it is the season. He hopes to be very successful. This is the third loan with MFP and he is grateful for the economic support that these loans have provided. This present loan means that he will be able to continue with his plans to improve his business. For his part, he promises to pay his installments on time, because he wants to remain on good terms with his association - “Yanamarca unida”. Wilmer plans to invest the money in organic fertiliser for his freshly sown fields.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertiliser.

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.es: Claudia Carolina de 34 anos de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos de 11, 9 anos de edad del departamento de León, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente de país. Ella tiene por actividad económica pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es un tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas  como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, cigarros menudeados, arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, huevos, leche. Tiene 8 anos de tener el negocio. y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo en invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería con productos de consumo diaria para el hogar. Claudia carolina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos  y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: Claudia Carolina, 34, is a single mother of two children who are 11 and 9 years old; she lives in León Department, a place located on the country’s west zone.  Her economic activity is a ‘pulpería’ located at home.  A pulpería is a store that sells food items in small amounts like packets of coffee, packets of shampoo, cigarettes by the unit, rice, sugar, oil, soap, eggs and milk.  She’s had the store 8 years and has been responsible with her payments; she’s made them on time and as scheduled.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital to stock the store with items of daily home consumption.  Claudia Carolina is grateful for the support Kiva lenders offer people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a way to earn a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela, de 64 años, vive en compañía de su esposo Cloriano con tiene 4 hijos a los que cuidó y educo, pues todos son profesionales. Ahora ellos viven solos en la casa que compraron hace 40 años.  A pesar de la edad que posee, Adela continúa trabajando y aferrada a l campo, “me gusta estar en el campo, nací, crecí y moriré ahí”, menciona. Es por esa razón que siembra alfalfa en los terrenos agrícolas que posee, además de diversos productos comestibles, como papa y habas, pero para su consumo. Gracias a los años de trabajo pudo obtener buenos clientes, sobre todo ganaderos que compran la alfalfa que produce, pero como no se abastece también compra a diversos agricultores el restante que le falta, es así que desea de un apoyo financiero para seguir con su trabajo de venta de alfalfa al por mayor. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.
Adela, invertirá el dinero en la compra de alfalfa al por mayor para continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Adela, 64, lives with her husband, Cloriano.  They have four children she raised and schooled; they are all professionals now.  She and Cloriano live alone in the house they bought 40 years ago.  Despite her age, she continues working firmly attached to the countryside.  “I like being in the countryside; I was born here, grew up here and will die here,” she mentions.  This is why she grows alfalfa on the farmland she owns as well as other foodstuffs like potatoes and lima beans for her own consumption.  Thanks to the years of work she was able to obtain good customers above all cattlemen who buy the alfalfa she grows.  Because she does not produce enough, she also stocks up on the rest she needs from various farmers which is why she needs help from the loan to continue with her business of being an alfalfa wholesaler.
This is her fourth MFP loan and she’s grateful for the economic support she’s given because she’ll be able to continue with her projects of improving her business.  She also promises to be punctual with her payments.  Adela will use the money to buy alfalfa at wholesale to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy alfalfa at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Indiana De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Indiana con 27 años  de edad, originario de Granada, con conocimiento académico de quinto año de secundaria, casada, madre de 1 hijos de 3 años, de oficio comerciante. Ella inicio vendiendo ropa con un pequeño préstamo que hicieron, pero le fue mal porque las personas que le compraban no le pagaban, luego ella decidió  pedir un segundo préstamo el cual le ayudo a superar sus ventas y asi obtener mayores ingresos, ya que con las ganancias que obtuvo de la venta de ropa, pudo invertir su dinero en la compra de calzado, negocio que conoce como funciona desde muy pequeña. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y el de su esposo.
A ella le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos en la ciudad de  Matagalpa, ya que es un buen lugar para vender su mercadería, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio para  atraer mas clientela.
Indiana solicita el préstamo para comprar zapatos y sandalias  etc. Ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a invertir mas en su negocio y asi obtener mas ganancias, sus planes futuros es poder abrir otra tienda para vender zapatos, su meta próxima  es hacer crecer su negocio y convertirlo en una fuente de ingresos sostenible.
texts.en:
Indiana, 27, is from Granada and attended fifth year of secondary school; she’s married and has a 3-year-old son.  She’s a merchant.  She started out in sales with a small loan she got but she didn’t do well because people who bought from her did not pay her and then she decided on a second loan which helped her improve her sales and earn higher income.  With profits from selling clothes she was able to invest her money in purchasing shoes, a business she’s known how it operates since she was a little girl.  Her parents and her husband support her efforts.  

She’d like to make her products known in the city of Matagalpa because it’s a good place to sell her merchandise and she hopes to expand her business to attract more customers.  Indiana is asking for the loan to buy shoes, sandals, etc.  She figures that this loan will help her invest more in her business thus obtaining higher profits.  Her future plan is to open another store to sell shoes.  Her short-term goal is to make the business grow turning it into a source of sustainable income.

loans.use: to buy shoes, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Yenny

texts.es:
La socia Yeni pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia continua trabajando en la venta de materiales de construccion ,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,a la vez la socia tambien continua brindando los servicios de masajes siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia Yeni requiere el préstamo para la compra de vivieres para su hogar.

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Yeni belongs to the communal bank “Ricchary Runa” from the Arariwa Association in the city of Cusco.

She continues working selling construction materials. She has been doing this work for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts in each day. At the same time she also continues offering massage services and this is how she supports her family.

Yeni needs a loan in order to buy housing supplies.

Yeni is grateful for the opportunity provided through this loan and she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy housing supplies for her business

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El Joven Juan  tiene 32 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable,  vive con su  madre y sus hermanos  en una  comunidad de Choluteca  al sur de Honduras.
Juan su negocio es la  venta  de  ropa  nueva, el necesita el préstamo para la compra de  pantalones, camisas, blusas, calzonetas, faldas, vestidos, Sandalias, blúmeres, sostenes y  gorras. 
Juan con el préstamo el espera tener más mercadería  para aumentar sus ventas y así satisfacer la demanda de los clientes que lo visitan a diario.
Juan con los ingresos que obtenga espera  mejorar  un poco su estilo de vida y el de su familia.
en el futuro Juan,  espera que su negocio crezca hasta convertirse  en una  tienda móvil  y con esto seguir apoyando a su familia y brindarles mejores oportunidades a sus hermanos.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Noviembre  2012
texts.en:
Juan is 32 years old.  He is a very hardworking and responsible person.  He lives with his mother and his brothers in a community of Choluteca in the south of Honduras.

Juan’s business is selling new clothes.  He needs the loan to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, swimming trunks, skirts, dresses, sandals, underwear, bras and caps.  With the loan, young Juan hopes to have more merchandise to increase his sales and in this way satisfy the demand of his customers who visit him daily.

With the income that he obtains he hopes to improve his lifestyle and that of his family a little bit.  In the future, he hopes that his business grows to become a mobile store and with this continue supporting his family and providing better opportunities for his brothers.

loans.use: to purchase pants, shirts, blouses, swimming trunks, skirts, dresses, sandals, underwear, bras and caps for his business.

loans.name: Los Agricultores Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Gumercinda esta casada, tienen 30 años de edad, cursó los 6 años de educacion primaria, tiene  2 hijos los cuales aun no estudian, se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, inició criando pollos, pavos y otros y hasta el momento lleva 5 años de experiencia, cuenta con el a poyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un prestamos que lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos, para crianza y venderlos cuando sean grandes, y tener sus ganancias. Las demás integrantes se dedican al comercio y a la crianza de animales.
texts.en:
Santos Gumercinda is married, is thirty years of age, and did six years of primary school education.  She has two children, neither of whom are in school yet.  She works in agriculture and breeds animals.  Having started with chickens, turkeys and other animals, she now has five years of experience and is supported by her husband who has a business.

Santos is organising a group to take out a loan that will be used to buy pigs to raise and then sell  for a profit when they are older    The other members of the group work in businesses and raise animals.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is married and has two children. He owns a grocery store and has been in business for five years. He also sells charcoal. He is a very hard-working and determined man, and from the time he joined Faulu he has become self-reliant. He describes his business as very busy and his customers as loyal. 

Someday he hopes to open up a wholesale grocery and be the main supplier of groceries around his area. He wants a loan of 53,156 KES to buy charcoal, potatoes, tomatoes and onions, to resell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, potatoes, tomatoes and onions, to resell.

loans.name: Yondembeh Group

texts.en:
Siray is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Siray was born in Kabala town, 42 years ago. She is married and the couple has 4 children. For more than 10 years, Siray has been selling ready-to-wear-clothes and different types of cloth (such as Bamako cloths, a type of cloth dyed in Mali, and wax cloth).

With the help of this loan, Siray and her group members will be able to expand the size and improve the quality of their respective businesses. They hope the loans will lead to more sales, better profit, and, consequently, improvements in their standards of living. Siray is going to use her share of the loan to buy clothing and cloth in large quantities to add to her current stock.  

(Attached beneath the photo is Ramatu, a borrower who was not present for the group photo.)

loans.use: to buy clothing and cloth in large quantities to add to her current stock

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is 39 years old, married and has three children. He has been selling charcoal for the past ten years and also roasts maize and sweet potatoes for extra income. He is very hard working because he has to provide for his family. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.
He wishes to grow his business into a wholesale enterprise and also to open a barber shop. He requests a loan of 105,300 KES to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 66 años es una mujer sencilla; vive en compañía de Hilario su esposo desde hace 40 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 2 de ellos en su casa propia. Desde niña, gusto de vivir en el campo y gozar de su clima y de los verdes pastos. Por ello, continua trabajando y a pesar de su avanzada edad quiere morir en el campo como creció. Sembrando y cuidando a sus animales. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, alverja y habas los que en cada cosecha comercializa a la ciudad de Huancayo o a la capital del país, donde consigue mayores ingresos. Todo esto lo realiza, gracias al apoyo de su esposo e hijos, a quienes enseño el oficio de la agricultura. De igual manera cuida a su ganados, vacas de calidad de las cuales extrae leche para consumir y comercializarlos a un mayor precio. De es manera obtienen una ganancia extra que le ayude a progresar. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Juana, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembrios de pastos y alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Juana, 66, is an unassuming woman living with Hilario, her husband of 40 years.  They have five children but only two of them still live with her in her own house.  Since she was a girl she’s liked living in the countryside enjoying its climate and greed pastures.  Because of this, she continues working and despite her advanced age wants to die in the same countryside where she grew up in planting and caring for her animals.

Her main crops are potatoes, peas and lima beans that she sells each harvest season in the city of Huancayo or in the nation’s capital where she earns greater income.  She does all this thanks to support from her husband and her children who she taught the occupation of agriculture.  In the same way, she cares for her cattle, quality cows she extracts milk from to consume and sell at higher prices earning extra income that helps her make progress.

This is her 4th MFP loan and she’s grateful for the economic support she’s getting because she’ll be able to continue with her projects to improve her business.  She promises to be punctual with her payments, too.  Juana will invest the money in the purchase of organic manure to nourish her pasturage fields to feed her animals.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.en:
Bonifacio is studying to become an automotive technician at Universidad San Fransisco Xavier. He loves cars and if fascinated by automotive engineering. With a technical degree and expertise in valuable skills Boniacio predicts that he will be able to earn $14 a day, a great increase over the $3 a day he earns currently.

Bonifacio is the oldest of six. Both his parents only had the opportunity to earn a primary education. Currently his father works as a farmer while his mother tends to the house and family. He works 30 hours a week along with some of his other siblings to help contribute to the family’s monthly salary. Together they only bring in $434 a month. 

Finding room in their budget to afford Bonifacio’s tuition has been a struggle. His family values education and wishes to improve their economic status but simply can’t afford it. Right now Bonifacio can only afford his tuition fees and has been managing his classes with out any supplies. He has nothing to take notes with, no textbooks, and is without a computer. With this loan, he plans on buying a computer and his textbooks and hopes to graduating on time with excellent marks.

loans.use: to pay for the books he needs for his courses

loans.name: Fabiola Coralita

texts.en: Fabiola is passionate about language and the doors that having foreign language skills can open. Currently she is enrolled at Universidad San Fransisco Xavier and on schedule to graduate at the end of this year. But without a loan, she would be unable to pay the fee associated with her final thesis. Currently Fabiola works 35 hours a week earning $25 dollars in addition to school and receives some help from her parents but it is not enough. Fabiola also hopes to purchase a laptop with her loan, a tool that will greatly improve her abilities at school and later on in the workforce. As the oldest in her family She hopes to set an example for her younger brother and sister.

loans.use: her thesis fees, a laptop and books that she needs to graduate.

loans.name: Ana Obdulia

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poderlo invertir en el negocio y también hacerle mejoras a la vivienda se comprará materiales para la elaboración del pan, como harina, azúcar, también una parte en la venta de ropa adquiriendo prendas de vestir variadas, blusas, faldas, otra parte la invertida en la mejora para la vivienda y compra de gallinas, todo esto para sacar el mejor provecho de las fiestas de fin de año.

Ella considera que los préstamos le sirven para mejorar el negocio y de esta manera ha ido poco a poco mejorando las instalaciones de la casa y apoyar a sus hijos en los estudios.
texts.en:
Ana is asking for a new loan to invest in her business and also to make improvements to her home.  She will buy ingredients to make bread, such as flour and sugar, and she will use part of it for clothing sales, buying different types of garments, such as tops and skirts.  She will invest another part of it in her home and in the purchase of chickens, all of which is to get the most out of the holiday season.

She believes that these loans help her improve her business and they are how, little by little, she has been improving her home facilities and helping her children with their studies.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, blouses, skirts, and chickens, as well as for home improvements

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 22 years old, married, and raises chickens to earn a living. She has been in business for two years and describes her business environment as being very favorable as she has many customers. She is very ambitious and hardworking. She also earns extra income from teaching. Faulu Kenya has enabled her save her money. Someday, Regina hopes to expand her poultry business. She requires a loan of 10,428 KES to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed

loans.name: Janefer

texts.en: Janefer is a 37-year-old businesslady with two children. She has been in business for eight years and works very hard in order to support her children on her own. She was previously involved in selling clothes, and Faulu Kenya has helped her to develop a saving ethic. Janefer hopes to have a large grocery store someday and to increase her profits. She needs a loan of 53,156 KES to buy avocados, oranges, mangoes, pawpaws, passion fruits, and spinach.

loans.use: to buy avocados, oranges, mangoes, pawpaws, passion fruits, and spinach

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 35-year-old business lady who owns a boutique. She raises her two children on her own and she was previously involved in farming. She is very hard working and since she joined Faulu Kenya she has learned how to save her money. 
She hopes to open another boutique and be able to travel outside the country to get clothes for sale. She requires a loan of 32,298 KES to increase her stock of clothes for sale.

loans.use: to increase her stock of clothes for sale

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa, 37, is a single mother with two children, aged 7 and 10. The children live at home with their mother and attend school. For the past seven years Hawa has been selling soft drinks and mineral water. She sells from 7am to 10pm daily. Hawa make profit when she sells, because her soft drinks and mineral water are always cold to quench her customers' thirst. Hawa learnt how to sell from her friends. She transports her goods by means of taxi to her business area. She highly appreciates all the lenders for their support in her business. With the business she feels independent. Hawa is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks and mineral water for the business. Her future plan is to build a house, and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and mineral water for the business.

loans.name: Musidal Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Musidal” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to request for a loan of 500,000.00 Leones each, in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Mariama is the leader of this group. Mariama is 48 years old, and married with 7 children. Mariama sells market-foods such as palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, etc. She has been doing this business for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, Mariama will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock

loans.name: Sobeh Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the Sobeh Group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs, who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of 2,200,000 Leones, in order to invest in their businesses. 

Iyeba is the leader of this group. Iyeba is 45 years old. She has been a businesswoman for many years. She sells palm oil, which is the country’s most popular cooking oil. With the help of this loan,  Iyeba is going to buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy gallons of palm oil, to add to her current stock

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet, 27, completed her high school education. She lives with her friend at Sinkor. She has two children, aged 5 and 10 years, who are in school. Janet works at selling for twelve hours a day. She sells ladies' blouses and skirts. She has been in this business for the past six years. 

Janet thanks the lenders for making their continued support toward her business. She makes a profit when she sells, because she sells quality goods, and because she has good interactions with her customers. She increases her sales every day. Janet is requesting a loan to purchase more ladies' blouses and skirts, to resell to her customers. Her dream for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' blouses and skirts, to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Faafofola

texts.en: Faafofola is 36 years old, married, and has five children. She wants to start a small business, making and selling pancakes, in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy ingredients and utensils, like flour, sugar, oil, tongs and spoons. Faafofola hopes to extend her business in the future. She joined SPBD in 2012, to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils to use in starting up a business, making and selling pancakes.

loans.name: Lauaea

texts.en: Lauea is a 20-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing cucumber, pumpkin, tomatoes and beans to earn a living. Lauea has requested a loan to buy more seeds and picks, spades, wires,etc. Lauea will spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, picks, spades and wires, etc.

loans.name: Legogo

texts.en: Legogo is 24 years old and married with 2 children. She has a small garden where she grows taro, taamu and banana that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Legogo needs a loan to buy chemicals, weed spayer, bush knives, spades etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Legogo will use the profits from her sales to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives and spades etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and yarn

loans.name: Carlos Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Carlos Agr icultor de la zona de Ticuantepe junto a su esposa e hijos han lucha mucho para salir adelante su mayor sueño es tener un buen futuro y que sus hijos tenga mejores condiciones de vida actualmente necesita darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos para que puedad crecer y que sus frutos sean de buena calidad, con este nuevo financiamiento comprar los siguientes insumos: Complento, Urea, Fertilizantes, etc. muy agradecido con Afodenic quien atravez de Fondos  Kivan lo han apoyado por muchos años.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos has been farming in the District of Ticuantepe with his wife and children. Together they have strived to move forward. His greatest wish is to have a good future and see his children have better living conditions.

At the moment, Carlos needs to maintain his crops so that they can continue to grow and produce good-quality fruit. With this new loan, he will buy farming supplies such as plant food, urea, fertilizers, and other items. He is very grateful to AFODENIC for having offered Kiva funds for many years.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his crops.

loans.name: Lauaea

texts.en: Lauaea is 19 years old and married with 1 child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 1 year. Lauaea has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, vegestable oil, tongs, spoons etc. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lauea plans to extend her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, vegetable oil, tongs, spoons etc.

loans.name: Unidos Para El Progreso Group

texts.es:
Saludos desde Perú! Este es el grupo Unidos Para el Progreso

Sonia es una de las integrantes del grupo. Ella es casada  y tiene 02 hijos, para ella es muy importante su familia es por ello que junto a su esposo siempre tratan de darle lo mejor a sus hijos, hace 10 años empezó su negocio de comidas, se inicio vendiendo salchipapas, gaseosas y helados. En la actualidad tiene un  restaurante donde atiende de lunes a domingo, sus mejores clientes son vecinos del lugar y trabajadores de transporte público. Sonia desea seguir mejorando su restaurante, con el préstamo solicitado podrá comprar utensilios nuevos para su negocio; mas adelante desea ampliar el local donde funciona su restaurante para poder recibir a mas comensales. Sonia está muy agradecida por los inversionistas de KIVAque hacen posible su préstamo, en la foto ella viste chompa roja y anteojos.
texts.en:
Greetings from Peru! This is the group “United for Progress”

Sonia is a member of this group. She is married, with 2 children. Her family is very important to her, and for this reason she tries, together with her husband, to give her children the very best possible. Ten years ago she started her food business. She started off selling “salchipapas”,* soft drinks and ice cream.  At the present time she has a restaurant where she works from Monday to Sunday. Her best customers are people from the neighbourhood and public transport workers. Sonia would like to continue to improve her restaurant. With the loan that she has applied for, she will be able to buy new cooking utensils for her business. At some point in the future, she would like to extend the premises of her restaurant, in order to be able to serve more customers. Sonia is very grateful to the KIVA investors who make her loan possible. In the photo, she is the one in a red sweater and glasses.

* Salchipapas are a kind of kebab from the Andes.

loans.use: TO BUY COOKING UTENSILS

loans.name: 10 Estrellas Del Norte Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “10 ESTRELLAS DEL NORTE”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de helados, tejido de ropa de bebe, tienda de llantas, tienda de barrio, venta de refrescos y gelatinas, carnicería, venta de calzados, hilado de lana.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias con distintos rubros, donde la señora Lidia es parte integrante, ella indica que es el tercer año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que la visitó en su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene dos negocios de hilado a mano de lana de vicuña, mismo que aprendió de su madre hace años atrás y que en la actualidad ella lo trabaja.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana de vicuña) que adquirirá de las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto, posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The community bank “10 Estrellas del Norte will begin the second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Alto Lima. There are eight members and it is headed by a board with Lidia as the President.

The business that the members of the communal bank are involved in are diverse and among them are: selling ice cream, knitting baby clothing, tire store, neighborhood store, selling soft drinks and gelatin, butcher shop, selling shoes and spinning wool. The loan that they are taking will benefit the small micro entrepreneurs in different ways. 

Lidia is part of the group. She indicates that this is the third year belonging to Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a supporter of the institution who visited her at home.

Currently she has two hand-spun vicuna wool businesses. She learned from her mother years ago and today she still works at it. The loan that she is now taking is to increase her capital (to buy vicuna wool) that she will buy from the popular markets in the city of El Alto, and later she will sell her creations from orders. This kind of work permits her to generate income to support as much as possible her household as she is single and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the credit and health training.

loans.use: to buy vicuna wool to make her creations to sell later

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is 39 years old and lives in San Andres, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has two children. 

Danilo is engaged in a hog-raising business. He earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan, which he will use to purchase feed and vaccines for his hogs. 
 
Danilo has been a member of PMPC for almost 2 years. He hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vaccines

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 36 years old, is married and has one child. She lives in Tipan, Oroquieta City. For the past 9 years, Josephine has operated a general store. She has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. for her store. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for nine years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Primetiva

texts.en: Primetiva, 62 years old, is married and has seven children. She lives in Lawa-an, Aloran Misamis Occidental. Primetiva has a hog fattening business. She has requested a loan to renovate her house. Primetiva has been a member of PMPC for 12 years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to renovate her house.

loans.name: Genoveva

texts.en: Genoveva, 63 years old, has 6 children. She lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Philippines. For the past 5 years, Genoveva has owned and operated a business, selling a variety of dresses and ready-to-wear products. She earns PHP 8,000 monthly from her business. Genoveva has requested a loan of PHP 11,500 to buy new sets of ready-to-wear clothing to sell. Genoveva joined GDMPC in 2007. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to buy new sets of ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old married man with two children. He used to work as a nurse. In February 2011, he opened his own business, a small grocery store in the Palestinian camp where he lives with his family. He hoped to improve his family's living by increasing their income.
Mahmoud insisted on starting his own business because several job opportunities are unavailable for Palestinian refugees since certain boundaries limit their ability to develop better careers.
He is applying for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital with special product offerings, especially cereals and hot drinks for the winter.
This will be his second cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and Mahmoud has a good repayment record.
He hopes to use this loan to continue to improve his business as much as he can. His previous loan served his business well because it allowed him to use special discounts to introduce new products to clients.

loans.use: To increase his business capital with special product offerings, especially cereals and hot drinks for the winter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her vehicle

loans.name: Fany Yaneth

texts.es: Fany  de 27 años de edad, es una joven madre de un pequeño de 6 años de edad, ella es muy responsable y vive junto a su madre y una hermana. Fany posee una venta de frutas a las afueras de un mercado, ella ha poseído este negocio desde hace 5 años atrás lo que es muy positivo ya que las personas la conocen muy bien. De esta manera Fany ha logrado brindarle todo lo necesario a su hijo, trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, en la espera de realizar la mayor cantidad de ventas posibles. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo de comprar mayor cantidad y variedad de frutas,  ya que ella comercializa por mayor y así mismo por unidad, lo que le permite contar con muchas ventas. Fany desea mejorar sus ganancias, ya que ella es la única que posee trabajo en su hogar, es por ello que debe optimizar su servicio y de esta forma obtener más clientes.
texts.en:
Fany is 27 years old and is the young mother of a six year old boy.  She is very responsible and lives with her mother and sister.  Fany has a small fruit selling business outside the market.  She has had this business for five years.  It’s gone well and is very well known.  Fany has managed to provide everything for her son in this manner, working from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm in the hopes that she will make the greatest number of sales possible.

She is asking for a loan so that she can buy fruit in quantity and variety.  She sells in quantity and in small amounts and this will allow her to count on a large number of sales.  Fany wants to improve her earnings since she is the only one who works in her household, so she needs to optimize her business and gain more customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit for resale.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en: Editha, 44 years old, is married and has four children. She lives in Mangguihan, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. Editha has a general store and she earns PHP 9,000 monthly from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc. for her store. Editha has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap, etc.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
Roger, 43 years old, is from Dolores, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is married and has two children. For the past 8 years, Roger has operated a motorcycle transport service business, earning 6,000 PHP per month.

Roger joined GDMPC in 2007. He is requesting a new loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. Roger plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita, 70 years old, is widowed and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 9 years, Amelita has operated a general store in the Philippines. She has previously received funds through Kiva. Amelita has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of grocery items to sell. Amelita hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en: Mylene is a 31-year-old resident of St. Cruz, Tangub City. She provides for her 2 children's needs from the small amount of PHP 5,000 she gains monthly from her poultry business, which she has operated for 5 years as an aid to her husband's income. Mylene became a member of GDMPC in 2010. She has applied for a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase feed and other supplies. Mylene wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Lave

texts.en: Lave is a 24-year-old single lady. She would like to start growing taro, taamu, and tomatoes to earn a living. Lave has requested a loan to buy chemicals, knapsack spray, a file, a spade, an axe, a wheelbarrow, etc. Lave will use her profits to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy an axe, a spade, chemicals, knives, a file, a wheelbarrow, knapsnack spray, etc. for her farming business.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 37 years old, married and has 6 children, two of whom are in school. 

Analyn is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn requested a loan of 10000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Analyn has been farming rice for four years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Analyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Lester José

texts.es:
El señor Lester José vive en un populoso barrio de la ciudad de Managua Nicaragua, actualmente trabaja para el estado desempeñándose como soldador  desde hace tres años, es una persona responsable.
  
don Lester José  solicita a ceprodel un tercer crédito para seguir construyendo poco a poco su vivienda, en esta ocasión lo necesita para cambiar el techo ya que esta en mal estado.

Con este tercer financiamiento lo invertirá  en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como cinc, madera, clavo y poder reparar su techo.
texts.en:
Lester José lives in a populated neighborhood in Managua, Nicaragua.  For three years he has been working for the state as a welder.  He is a very responsible person.

Lester José is asking CEPRODEL for his third loan so that he can continue building his house little by little.  On this occasion he needs to replace the roof because it’s in bad shape.

He will use the money from this loan to buy building materials such as zinc metal sheeting, lumber, and nails so that he can repair his roof.

loans.use: to buy roofing materials.

loans.name: Félix  Elías

texts.es:
El Señor Félix Elías es trabajador  de una institución del estado en Managua, donde se desempeña como inspector de campo desde hace seis años, es  casado con tres personas a su cargo, responsable, con buenos valores morales.

El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar materiales de construcción tales como arena, cemento, bloque, este crédito lo invertirá en reforzar las paredes de su casa y repellarla para el bienestar y estabilidad de su familia.  

Los sueños de Don Félix Elías es ver su casita bien acondicionada con el apoyo que Ceprodel y kiva le pueda brindarle.
texts.en:
Félix Elías is a hardworking man who has been working for six years as a field inspector for the state in Managua.  He is married, has three people to support, and is of good moral character.

He is asking CEPRODEL for this loan in order to buy building materials such as sand, cement, and cinder blocks to reinforce the walls of his house and repair it for his family’s wellbeing. 

Félix Elías’ dreams are to see his house very well set up and he will be able to do this with CEPRODEL’s and Kiva’s support.

loans.use: to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Seak

texts.en: Seak is 37 years old. She is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in the agricultural business for more than ten years, has extensive experience and is successful in her career. She is involved in cultivating rice and fattening animals. She makes an approximate income of $2 daily. Her husband (who is with her in the picture) sells coconuts. He earns about $6 per day. In order to improve her husband's business, Seak is requesting a loan of $400 to pay to hire a store to sell coconuts. In the future, she would like to expand her business and send her children to a good school. Moreover, she hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to hire a store to sell coconuts sold by her husband.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes, 48, is a resident of Caloocan, Philippines. She is married to Manuel, an employee, and a mother. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually earn an income for their everyday expenses.

Mercedes operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mercedes hopes to expand her business and dreams to have her house renovated through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business inventory.

loans.name: Cora

texts.en:
Cora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more inventory to sell.

NWTF is re-listing Cora's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en: Cristy, 30 years old, is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 5 years, Cristy has operated a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell. In the future, Cristy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita previously accessed a 27,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures. 

Teresita would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better, as more items to sell will result in better profit. Teresita's profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Teresita hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is a 43-year-old resident of Barangay 5, Tangub City. She helps meet her family's needs from the small monthly amount of PHP 5,000 she earns from her banana production business, which she has operated for 7 years. Flordeliza became a member of GDMPC in 2009. She has applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Flordeliza wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 49 years old and married with four children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Elena has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Logo

texts.en: Logo is 49 years old and married with four children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, and beans that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Logo needs a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow and spades. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Logo will use the profits from her sales to save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, bush knives, a wheelbarrow, spades, etc.

loans.name: Saidjalol

texts.ru: Саидджалолу 26 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Его ребенку 2 года. Он единственный кормилец в семье, так как его жена домохозяйка и нигде не работает. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 5 лет назад он начал свой бизнес услугой таксиста. Его эффективность помогает ему быть успешным в бизнесе.
