Cristina is 36 years old and has three children. Cristina is married and her three children are in school.

Cristina is in the agricultural business raising ducks in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed for her ducks.

Cristina has been raising ducks for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed for her ducks.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 60 years old and married. She is from Sebasi, Clarin. She has two grown children who have helped her in taking care of their bananas. They have been raising bananas for 20 years and earn PHP 3,000 a month. 

In 2008, Antonia joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 from to purchase seedlings and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and for weeding costs.

loans.name: Ofa

texts.en:
Ofa is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. 

Ofa has requested a loan to buy veggie seeds, chemicals, fertilizer and sprayers. She became a member of SPBD this year. With her profits, Ofa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, wheel barrow a bush knife.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is 56 years old and married with nine children.

Erlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, canned goods and other groceries.

Erlita has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Erlita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Norlina

texts.en:
Norlina is now married and has children. She is 23 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past two years, Norlina has managed a banana production business, earning PHP 5,000 each month. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Norlina joined Kiva's partner, GDMPC this year. She hopes to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 47 years old and married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Delia has a computer games station business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her computer games business.

Delia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional unit for her computer game business.

loans.name: Alapama

texts.en:
Alapama is 38 years old and married with four children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pork buns, donuts and german buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy tools and things to start her business. 

In the future, Alapama hopes to expand her business and to have more savings to help her family in the future. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking tools, a new oven, sugar, yeast and soft drinks.

loans.name: Vainiua

texts.en:
Vainiua is 25 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling food in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Vainiua has requested a loan to buy snacks, soft drinks, ice-pops and pancakes to sell on her food stall. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Vainiua plans to expand her business to help her improve her house and to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy snacks, ice pops, soft drinks and flour.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en:
Eseta is a 55-year-old married woman with eight children. She would like to start growing taro and bananas to earn a living. Eseta has requested a loan to buy equipment, taro plants and banana trees to start her business. 

She has been a member of SPBD for a year. Eseta will spend her profits on her children's school fees and will save more money so she can better her family.

loans.use: to buy taro plants, weed killer, chemicals, fertilizer and bush knives.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia is 43 years old and married with four children.

Virgilia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Virgilia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Virgilia has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy a delivery truck for her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Akisa

texts.en: Akisa is a 40-year-old married woman with no children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Akisa has requested a loan to buy seeds and tools to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for a year. Akisa will spend her profits on expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, gloves and a wheel barrow.

loans.name: Suititi

texts.en:
Suititi is 39 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Suititi has requested a loan to buy flour, coconuts, sugar, cooking oil, and an oven. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Suititi will help with her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, an oven, cooking oil and coconuts.

loans.name: Sefilina

texts.en:
Sefilina is 41 years old and married with 10 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling german buns, donuts and pork buns in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy everything she needs for her business. 

In the future, Sefilina hopes to expand her business and save more money for the better future of her family. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast, and a new gas oven.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Teresita has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

NWTF is re-listing Arlene's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 40 years old.  She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school, Thelma works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.  Thelma has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Thelma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Khdija

texts.en:
Ms. Khdija is a 49-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been in the business of goat purchase and sales. Her husband is working for a daily wage. His income is not enough to cover all the household expenditures, so Khdija decided to play her role and purchased some small goats with the help of her husband. She brings them up and sells them in her community and local market. She makes good profit from selling goats.

Ms. Khdija has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She has been in association with Kashf for four years. In order to purchase two more small goats, she applied for a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of her profits on the expansion of her business. She also shared that her dream is to carry on with her assistance to her husband to provide the best possible facilities for her children.

loans.use: to purchase two more small goats.

loans.name: Ulufale

texts.en: Ulufale is a 48-year-old married woman with five children. She would like to start growing vegetables to earn a living. Ulufale has requested a loan to buy tools and seeds to start her business. She has been a member of SPBD for one year. Ulufale will spend her profits to pay for her children's school fees and will save more money to purchase new land to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, fertilizer, shovels, and a wheelbarrow.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 47 years old and lives in Baybay, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with five children. Wilma has a tailoring business and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month. She has requested a loan to pay the placement fee for her daughter going abroad.

Wilma has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Wilma hopes to improve her living conditions using the profits from her business and with the support of her daughters.

loans.use: to pay the placement fee for her daughter going abroad

loans.name: Lotesi

texts.en: Lotesi is 50 years old and single. She has 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bag of flour, sugar, oil, and a frying pan. In the future, Lotesi hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, and a frying pan.

loans.name: Fevie

texts.en: Fevie, 25, is married with two children. She is from Pan-taon, Ozamis City. Fevie has cultivated bananas for sale for 8 years, and earns 5,000 PHP a month. In 2011, Fevie joined GDMPC. Fevie is requesting loan of 6,500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Silveria

texts.en:
Silveria is 42 years old, married and has three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Silveria has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Silveria requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like blouses, pants, foot-wear and other ready-to-wear clothing.

Silveria has been in this business for six years. In the future, Silveria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like blouses, pants, foot-wear and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Silomiga

texts.en: Silomiga is 34 years old and married with six children. She wants to start a small business making and selling ice cakes and other items in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy bags of sugar, flour and boxes of snacks. In the future, Silomiga hopes to expand her business to help her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sugar, snacks and foam cups for her ice cakes business.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil works hard to support her family. She is married and has run a shoe making business in the Philippines for seven years.

Cecil has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her shoe making business.

loans.name: Elenoa

texts.en: Elenoa, 36, is single with 4 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to to buy bags of sugar, flour, cooking oil, a frying pan, and an oven. In the future, Elenoa hopes to extend her business. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bags of sugar, flour, cooking oil, a frying pan, and an oven.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 33-year-old second hand clothes dealer in Mombasa. She is married and a mother of two children. She has been in this business for the last seven years and she is doing well.

Victoria will use the requested loan to purchase additional bales of second hand clothes in readiness for the festive season and use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her first loan was repaid successfully and this being her second loan, she hopes to excel in her plans.

loans.use: To purchases bales of second hand clothes for the festive season.

loans.name: Evylen

texts.en:
Evylen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 16000 PHP through NWTF to buy an additional videoke unit for her business.

NWTF is relisting Evylen's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional videoke unit for her business.

loans.name: Chinzorig

texts.en: Mr. Chinzorig is 45 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger in Tosontsengel soum of Zavhan province of Mongolia. His wife, Manibadar, works as a supervisor at a public water well. His daughter Sosorburam and son Sanjaadorj, ages 21 and 17, are university students. He has been running a business selling wooden furniture and Mongolian ger parts since 2009. His wife has started working and the family income has increased a bit. His two children studying at university with their tuition fees and living expenses account for most of the family's expenses. Mr. Chinzorig has been running his business for the last few years and has already built a close client base within his area. He is now requesting 1,650,000 tugriks to pay for his two children's university tuition and living expenses. He and his wife are diligent, hardworking and responsible people.

loans.use: to pay for his two children's university tuition and living expenses.

loans.name: Maanaima

texts.en: Maanaima is 68 years old and married with 8 children. She wants to start a small business making and selling printed clothes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy materials, paint, brushes and an elei board. In the future, Maanaima hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paints, materials, brushes, and a painting board.

loans.name: Para Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Para desarrollo se llama este grupo que está empezando a trabajar, este en su primer ciclo y como el nombre del grupo lo dice, se unieron para desarrollar el espíritu de cada una de ellas.
Es parte de este grupo la Sra. Myrian Beatriz, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con ansias de salir adelante y progresar para poder ayudar a su familia. Myrian tiene el gran deseo de tener un gran local para poder seguir vendiendo sus productos.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de cosméticos para poder venderlos y así seguir ganándose el sustento del día a día.
texts.en:
This group is called "Para Desarrollo" and is just starting to work. This is their first loan cycle and as the name of the group says, they have united to develop the spirit of each one of them.

Myrian Beatriz is a part of this group. She makes a living selling cosmetics of all kinds. She is a very hard working woman who is anxious to get ahead and make progress in order to help her family. Myrian has a great desire to have a large locale to continue selling her products. She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics to sell and continue making a living each day.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to be sold.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidas lleva por nombre este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, que gracias a su trabajo y sacrificio ha podido llegar a su ciclo numero 13. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que luchan por sus familias para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Felicia, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, siempre tiene muy buena variedad, y es por eso que está haciéndose de muy buena clientela y con eso tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Cuenta la Sra. Felicia que solicita este crédito para la compra de prendas de todo tipo, para poder surtir su negocio y seguir dando a su clientela la variedad a la que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
This group is named Mujeres Unidas (United Women) and is from the city of Encarnación. Thanks to their work and sacrifice they have been able to reach their thirteenth loan cycle. They are women who head their families and fight to give their families all that they need for a dignified life. 

One of the members of the group is Felicia. She makes a living selling clothing on foot. She always has a good variety and it has been because of this that she has a good clientele and the means to support her family. 

Felicia states that she is requesting this loan to buy all types of apparel in order to stock her business and continue offering her customers the variety that they are used to.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Leutu

texts.en:
Leutu is a 35-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows cabbages, green peppers, green beans and tomatoes to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year. Leutu has requested a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, hose, gloves, baby cabbages and green pepper seeds.

Leutu has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Leutu hopes to improve her business to help with family matters and her kids' educations.

loans.use: to buy a hose, wheelbarrow, chemicals, gloves and green pepper seed.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Este comité esta en el 5º ciclo del programa, esta integrado por 9 señoras, todas son vecinas, conocida de la zona, que se unieron con el propósito de ayudarse las unas a las otras y por medio de ese trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
 Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Jacinta, quien se dedica a la peluquería. Es una trabajadora muy buena en lo que hace, ya que se esfuerza mucho para dar a sus clientes un buen servicio. Jacinta quiere seguir trabajando para poder agrandar su negocio y poder dar trabajo a otras personas también.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de tintes, shampoo, spray y demás. El grupo está contento por la ayuda que está recibiendo de Kiva y de fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
This bank is in its fifth cycle of the program.  It's made up of nine women, neighbors and acquaintances of the area who got together with the goal of helping each other and, through that work, helping their families.

One of these women, Jacinta, makes a living with a beauty salon.  She's a very good worker in what she does because she makes a lot of effort to give her customers good service.  Jacinta wants to continue working to be able to expand her business and employ other people as well.

She's requesting this loan to buy dye, shampoo, hairspray, and other products.

The group is happy about the help it's receiving from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy dye, shampoo, hairspray, and other products

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Ms. Parveen is a 47-year-old married lady. She has been raising cattle for two years. Her husband works in a marble factory. His income is not sufficient to cover the daily expenses of the household. So, Ms. Parveen decided to engage herself in an income generating activity. She purchases cattle, looks after them, and sells them a few months later to make a profit.

Ms. Parveen is the mother of four children – all of them are going to school. She has been in association with Kashf for two years with an excellent repayment history. She has some savings and applied for a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase more livestock such as goats and sheep. She wants to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock such as goats and sheep.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 36 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Fatima has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase more clothes to sell to customers. Fatima has been in this business for five years. In the future, Fatima would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell to customers.

loans.name: Malaea

texts.en:
Malaea is 46 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling barbeque in her community and has been doing this for three years. Malaea has requested a loan to buy a carton of chickens, mutton flaps, soya, onions, salt and gas ovens. 

She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Malaea will hope to improve her business to help her family and support her kids education.

loans.use: to buy soy sauce, chicken, sausages, onions and mutton flaps.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is 25 years old and married with two children.  With one kid in school, Marcela works very hard to provide for them.

Marcela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell.

Marcela has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

In the future Marcela would like to save enough to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Palolo

texts.en:
Palolo is 58 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Palolo has requested a loan to buy flour, oil, a cooking oven and a large cooking pot. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Palolo hopes to improve her business to help her kids education and her family matters.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, a cooking oven and a large cooking pot.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fausto Aníbal

texts.es:
Don Segundo Aníbal es un señor artesano ibarreño que vive con su esposa y su hijo. Don Segundo se define como una persona de carácter alegre, humilde y muy trabajador, comenta que el trabajo es la base para construir el camino para lograr sus metas.

El crédito que el Sr. Segundo Aníbal solicito a Fodemi se lo invertirá en la compra de betunes, pintura de zapatos, ceras etc., materiales necesarios para el trabajo diario de Don Aníbal ya que su trabajo está siendo muy reconocido en su ciudad y cada vez es más solicitado.

El sueño que el Sr. Segundo tiene es seguir trabajando con mucha fuerza, para lograr construir su propia casa para vivir con su familia y seguirles brindando todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Don Segundo Aníbal is a craftsman from Ibarra who lives with his wife and son.  Don Segundo describes himself as a person of happy character, humble and hard-working.  He says that his work is the base on which to build the road to achieve his goals.

The loan that Sr. Segundo Aníbal is requesting from Fodemi will be invested in the purchase of polishes, shoe dyes, and waxes, etc., materials that are needed for the daily work of Don Aníbal, since his work is becoming well known in the city and is more sought after.

Sr. Segundo's dream is to continue working with a lot of effort to be able to build his own house to live with his family and continue to give them everything they need.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of shoe waxes, leather dyes, and shoe polishes needed for his daily work cleaning shoes.

loans.name: Jurenda

texts.en:
Jurenda, a 35-year-old married mother of five children, has made a living in Guingona, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental through the operation of a retail store selling a variety of food and home-use products for four years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Jurenda joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Vaiese

texts.en:
Vaiese is a 24-year-old woman who is single with no children. She has a small taxi service. She has one year of experience in this business.

Vaiese needs a loan to buy car parts, seat covers and new tires, and to pay her registration fee. She will use her profits to help improve her taxi services and support her family members. Vaiese joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy car parts, seat covers and new tires, and to pay her registration fee.

loans.name: Milly

texts.en:
Milly lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children, one of whom currently attends school. She is not looking after any other member of the family.

Milly has been selling charcoal from home at wholesale and retail for eight years. She works seven days a week. She also sells piped water and rental houses as other sources of income.

Milly has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT- SACCO to buy more sacks of charcoal for sale. Her challenges include transportation and the high costs of running a business. Her dream is to become a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to the university level. She joined MCDT because of members' testimonies about the benefits of being a member. She lives in her husband`s house without access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Elvina

texts.en:
At age 29, Elvina is married with two children. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

Elvina owns and operates a plot of farmland where she plants bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years and earns PHP 3,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase farm chemicals. 

Elvina has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, since 2007. In the future, Elvina's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 35 years old and married with five children.

Roselyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

Roselyn has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Roselyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Evite

texts.en: Evite, a 32-year-old married mother of three, has been making and selling tapa design clothes to earn a living for the past year. Evite has requested a loan to buy paints, brushes, design board, roll materials, and rubber bands. She plans to use her profits to help her children's education and improve her family's living conditions. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes, design board, and roll material.

loans.name: Jackeline

texts.es:
Jackeline, de 29años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su conviviente Víctor de 30 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Hugo de 7 y Virginia de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio al que Jackeline se dedica es a la venta de comida rápida, específicamente pollo broaster y a la venta de cerveza, gaseosas y hielo, su puesto esta ubicado en su propia casa y todos los fines de semana lleva muchas cajas de cerveza y  gaseosas para renovar las que han sido consumidas durante la semana. Ella es una vendedora muy alegre y carismática, por eso sus clientes la prefieren antes que a la competencia, aun recuerda cuando se inicio en este negocio y vendía de a poco y cantidades mínimas, pero con manera de ser logro obtener mas clientes y aumentar sus clientes y por ellos mismo las ventas.
Le esta yendo muy bien en lo que hace ya que al tener dos actividades también genera doble ingresos a su hogar y con eso puede brindar mejor condición de vida a su familia, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de trabajo, lleva 6 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar las pesadas cajas de cerveza. Para el futuro, espera poder poner una tienda, donde pueda brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Por tanto éste será su  préstamo número 08 con la institución MFP, espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas que son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 3500 soles, comprará ingredientes para continuar con su negocio, además de muchas cajas de gaseosas y cervezas para tener listo para vender en estas fechas.
texts.en:
Jackeline is 29 years old and a very friendly and hardworking person.  She lives in a home of her own, along with her husband, 30 year old Victor, and her two children, seven year old Hugo, and 3 year old Virginia, to whom they want to provide a better quality of life.

Jackeline’s business is fast food, specifically broasted chicken, beer, soft drinks, and ice.  Her stall is located in her home and she takes many cases of beer and soft drinks every weekend to replace the ones she has sold during the week.

She is a very happy and charismatic saleswoman.  This is why her customers prefer to buy from her.  She recalls when she was first starting out, she only sold just a small amount, but she managed to get more customers and increase her sales.

Things are going very well for her and she generates a double income for having two activities, so she is able to provide better living conditions to her family.  What she likes the most is that she can talk to customers and make her working time go by faster.  She considers the most difficult part of her work to be having to transport the heavy cases of beer.  In the future she hopes to be able to set up a store where she can provide better service.

This will be her eighth loan through MFP and she hopes for your cooperation so she can continue her goals.  She is committed to making her payments on time, as with the previous ones.  She also likes being a part of the communal bank because all of its members are responsible and united.  She will use the 3,500 PEN to buy ingredients so that she can continue her business.  She will also buy many cases of soft drinks and beer to have on hand to sell over these dates.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 27 años, es una mujer sencilla vive con sus esposo Joder y sus 2 hijos: Jeanfranco y Iker, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada desde hace 2 años. El trabajo al que se dedica es la compra y venta de ganando porcino, pues tiene muchos clientes que gustan de preparar comidas a base de este animal. Ya tiene varios años dedicándose a esta crianza, espera poder tener cerdos de calidad, pero requieren de un capital muy alto, que ya se encuentra juntando, ya que quiere formar un capital propio. Ahora desea seguir en el negocio, le esta yendo bien, comenta que tiene pedidos de estos animales para año nuevo, por lo que tiene que comprar un promedio de 20 cerdos, es así que desea el apoyo económico para comprar el restante. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico que le brindan, pues de esa manera seguirá con sus proyectos de mejora para su negocio. Asimismo promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, pues quiere quedar muy bien con su asociación, “Yanamarca unida”. Ruth, invertirá el dinero en la compra de 10 cerdos para aumentar su ganado.
texts.en: Ruth is 27 years old and a simple woman who lives with her husband, Joder, and two children, Jeanfranco and Iker.  She cares for them in a rented home and they have lived there for two years.  She buys and sells pigs and has many customers who like to prepare pork dishes.  She has been doing this for several years and hopes to have quality pigs, but they require lots of capital and she is already saving up because she wants to build up her own capital.  Now she wants to continue the business.  Things are going well for her and she has orders for these animals for the new year, so she wants to buy 20 pigs.  She is hoping for is hoping for your support so that she can make up the difference.  This will be her third loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support because it will allow her to continue with her business improvement plans.  She also promises to be on time with her payments because she wants to remain in good standing with the association, “Yanamarca unida.”  Ruth will use the money to buy 10 pigs so she can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de confeccion de disfraces,el tiene un taller donde confecciona diferentes trajes para danzas tipicas,el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,el socio ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de confeccion de disfraces.El socio solicita el credito para comprar hilos,botones,telas y lentejuales para confeccionar los trajes.

El socio esta contenta con el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos.
texts.en:
This member continues to run his costume manufacturing business.  He has a workshop where he makes different types of costumes for typical dances.  He works there from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and has been doing this for eight years.  Things are going well for him and his dream is to expand his costume business.  He is asking for this loan in order to buy thread, buttons, fabrics, and sequins.

He is happy about the loan and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Tepora

texts.en:
Tepora is 33 years old and married with three children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community. She has been doing this for one year. 

Tepora has requested a loan to buy flour, oil, a gas oven, a large cooking pot and a large frying pan. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tepora will use her profits to help pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, a gas oven, a large cooking pot and a large frying pan.

loans.name: Marcesa

texts.en:
Marcesa is 44 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years. 

Marcesa is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy pants, t-shirts, slippers, and other clothing to sell.  In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase pants, t-shirts, slippers and other clothing to sell.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de taller de automatriz,donde se realiza reparacion de carros,la socia trabaja administranod su negocio desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de taller de automotriz.La socia solicita el credito para comprar llantas,repuestos para carros y aceites para los carros.

La socia se compromete a hacer todos los pagos de los préstamos necesarios a tiempo.
texts.en:
This member continues with her auto shop where she repairs cars.  She manages the business from 8:00 am to 6:00 pm and has been doing this for five years.  Things are going well for her and she wants to expand the business.  She is asking for this loan to buy tires, auto parts, and lubricants.

She is committed to making all of her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy parts and lubricants.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal “Ricchary  Runa” de la Asociación  Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

La socia continua con su negocio de venta de carne,la socia vende en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Cusco,la socia lleva años en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como carne de chancho y res para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Irma is a member of the “Ricchary Runa” communal bank of the Arariwa association in Cusco.

She continues with her butcher shop business and sells in the Cusco markets.  She has been doing this for many years and things are going well for her thanks to the daily effort she puts into her business.  She is responsible and enterprising and in this way has been getting her family ahead.

She is asking for a loan to buy supplies such as pork and beef for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on schedule.

loans.use: to buy pork and beef.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: Ronald es el socio que pertenece al  banco comunal “QORICHUSPAS” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. El señor Ronald es un joven estudiante muy trabajador y emprendedor, que se dedica  a la comercialización de papa pelada, las cuales distribuye en los diferentes restaurantes y pollerías de la ciudad. Ronald en esta oportunidad está solicitando su préstamo para pagar sus estudios universitarios de Ingeniería Civil. Ronald está muy agradecido con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad económica, la cual representa el principal ingreso económico para el pago de su educación.
texts.en:
Ronald is a member of the “QORICHUSPAS” communal bank in Cusco – Peru.  He is a very hardworking and enterprising young student who sells peeled potatoes, which he then distributes to different restaurants and chicken stands around the city.

He is asking for a loan so that he can pay for his university tuition in Civil Engineering.  Ronald is very grateful to Kiva for helping him develop his business, which represents his main income toward his tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie, 30, is married with three children. She is from Panta-on, Ozamis City. To make a living, Angelie owns and operates a banana production business. For almost eight years, Angelie has usually earnt 5,000 PHP per month. 

In 2011, Angelie joined GDMPC. Angelie is requesting a loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting.

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
Susitina is a 40-year-old woman who is married with five children. She has a small bakery business. She has two years of experience with this business.

Susitina needs a loan to buy flour, baking soda, baking powder, yeast, oil, baking pans, a large cooking pot and steel racks. She will use her profits to improve her business and help her kids' educations. Susitina joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, baking soda, yeast, a cooking pot, etc., for her bakery.

loans.name: Vaofilifili

texts.en:
Vaofilifili is a 27-year-old married woman with two children. She would like to start growing taro crops, bananas, etc., to earn a living. 

Vaofilifili has requested a loan to purchases goods to use for her business, including a wheelbarrow, bush knife and fertilizers. She just became a member of SPBD. Vaofilifili will spend her profits to help her family and provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, bush knife and fertilizers to start growing crops.
